Reviews.Title: “A Classic in the New England tradition when New Englanders were rich”
Reviews.Author: Peter G
Reviews.Content: Right in town of Boston, eaasy to get around but why leave this beautiful hotel when it has everything you might desire.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Elegance”
Reviews.Author: TeamSmallState
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an early 20th century feel similar to the Newport Mansions/European-Versaille style. Very high ceilings in the hotel spaces with mirrors, and gold leaf. Definitely have breakfast here. The restaurant is currently in a room with hand carved wood panels on the walls an ceilings. The restraint/bar is under a major renovation. I got a behind the scenes peak at the construction and it looks like it will be fantastic. This is a great location for shopping. Its one block off of Newbury Street. The room was nice and recently renovated. All stone bathroom with large shower. Only neg on the shower there were no shelves in it, no where to put shower toiletries except on the floor of the shower.... very minor point but if someone from the hotel reads this... It did feel quite, it's not the cool young boutique hotel, or catering to the younger crowd. I would stay here again... we usually stay at the Fairmont Battery Wharf. Check it out for a more modern take, and on the water... the location is not as central however.

Reviews.Title: “Charming old world hotel convenient to getting around Boston”
Reviews.Author: arvinchin
Reviews.Content: Charmingly historic old world hotel which is currently undergoing renovation in half of building. Very secure with key card to elevator and rooms. Beautiful lobby and meeting rooms. Food was adequate. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Nice modern health club on roof. Room was very clean and modern with traditional style and comfort. Bathroom was luxurious with new marble tiles. Keurig Coffee maker and little refrigerator bar stocked for convenience. Valet parking is kind of expensive, but parking is notoriously difficult in Boston. There is a large public parking lot slightly cheaper near the local "T" train station on Clarendon 2 blocks away. The Hynes convention center is walkable as are the numerous other hotels in the area. Back Back and South Bay areas sandwich this location. Walkable to downtown area but can take the T. Public Library accross the Street as is a beautiful sandstone church. Can check luggage with front desk so you don't have to carry around after checking out. Entrance to Mass Pike extension is nearby. Route 93 access is also driveable. Join hotel club for wifi access. Have business center for a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the Fairmont Copley in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: BBCGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Just spent one night at the Fairmont Copley Hotel in Boston and wish we could have stayed a week! It was the perfect hotel experience from check in to check out. Great location for all Boston sights and an exquisite facility in the grand old hotel style. The staff is super personable and they even have a beautiful black lab in the lobby for ready petting--complete with cut glass water bowl and his own storybook: Catie at the Copley. If you want to feel special, this is the spot!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in the Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: jack_b1
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Copley Plaza every year on the Gold Floor for several special ocassions (birthdays, etc.) Always have superior service. We have recently noticed that it has become pricey for both rooms and drinks, and may reconsider our next trip at another hotel of simliar genre. We stayed in one of the newlly renovated rooms. It was tastefully done, but you loose some of that old world charm the hotel has been known for. The new health club on the added top floor is great, lots of light and plenty of equipment.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things...”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel02532
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited this proerty in Boston. An unexpected event occurred, a funeral, and we had to find a rental car to drive to the location. The staff at the Fairmont could not have been more understanding. The car was arranged for, delivered to the door, returned when we were done driving. All seemless service.Our first morning there, I helped myself to the new coffee service provided in each room. I used Splenda in the coffee. When we returned to the room, extra coffee was saiting and extra Splenda. This may not seem like a big deal - but the point is that the housekeeping staff noticed what we liked and made sure we had it. Such little touches are simply not present in most of our stays. It's the little things that matter and Fairmont does them well!

Reviews.Title: “Refurbishment excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Travelwriter17751
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is going through a major refurbishment effort and the results are great. My refurbished room was wonderful..decorated in a gorgeous gray blue. The hotel is rewiring all the rooms so that every room has a new coffee maker. There is a stunning new fitness facility above the sixth floor. Fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Liz G
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location. However I would not stay there again until the refurbishment is complete unless you got a VERY GOOD deal. Staff were very friendly and it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Undergoing renovations, looking much better. Still one things to think about....”
Reviews.Author: Asta72
Reviews.Content: Reviewed this hotel almost exactly a year ago ( please feel free to read the much longer and extensive one I wrote!). But as I'm only travelling with an iPad this time I can't be bothered to type too long.... But wanted to review this hotel again as its undergoing some major renovations.! I am giving the hotel a rating of 4 this time around as opposed to the 3 it got the last time mainly because of their much improved internet which can be a total dealbreaker for me. Improved: * Internet is much better this time around fast and stable wifi! * General freshness and comfort of room much improved * Quality of tech stuff in room great Sill not great: * They have done nothing about the windows of he hotel. And as its located in a busy intersection o town in can, and will most likely be, super noisy! So if you have problems with noise make sure to get a room facing inwards! * Cold... Although I do believe that they have vastly improved their AC system as well Things to think about when booking: * The bathrooms all seem a little bit different. Som with bathtubs and sep. shower. Some with just a tub. Plus the size of the tubs vary, so shop around * The noisy streets should be considered But all in all it's in a great central location with lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, undergoing renovations, great service”
Reviews.Author: 2deer
Reviews.Content: The Copley is an historic property that is undergoing major renovations. I am sure it will be a very good property when finished, but for the moment I rank as average. My room was great. I was told I was only the third guest to have stayed there. Though the sleeping rooms are good, the bathrooms are small (historic property). The service is excellent with good attention to detail and attentiveness. The downside is the hallways smell like paint, work is going on in very near proximity to rooms that are being used. The business "center" is open to the lobby so no privacy or real quiet. The Oak room is closed, but the St. James is a nice substitute. Drinks are expensive and short, for the price one expects a better pour. For a night or two of business travel it is fine, would not book a group. Give it 12 -18 months and I imagine it will be back to the Very Good range.

Reviews.Title: “High cost but no service at all, not worth.”
Reviews.Author: liujee
Reviews.Content: We checked in 2/6/2012, 1st the heater was not working and the "charged & high-speed" WiFi was still charged and slow to no service. 2nd night, heater started to make loud noise at closed to midnight, 2 space heaters werec used to heat this 5-star hotel room, and WiFi still very slow to no signal. 3rd night, we finally switched to a different room to had a room finally have heat but the WiFi don't even work. They believed the problems were the setting on our laptop, iPhones, ipad, We finally met the manager (Patrick) only got an offer to use the computer station in this so called 5-star plaza hotel. Manager Patrick told us this paticular room, we actually were the 1st guests stay in , they don't know all the problems, (did I mentiom toilet won't flush properly also. ) All I can say is it is not worth to spend lots of money on this Fairmont copley plaza Boston, when it has no service. Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, but little to offer asw a hotel”
Reviews.Author: DragonboatFL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business because my client was also staying here. A beautiful hotel, but significantly lacking in many ways: 1. I arrived at 5pm and my room was not ready. I had to take a different type of room or wait up to an hour. 2. The hotel had gone through a recent renovation. However, the results of this were very disappointing. 3. For $280/night, my room had thin windows that did little to keep out noisy traffic sounds; no coffee maker; cold, slippery tile in the bathroom; no soap dish in the shower, so the only place to put soap and the shampoo bottle was on the floor. 4. The desk had a new, complex system where you could connect your laptop to the flat-screen TV for video, PowerPoint presentations, etc. In the desk was a packet with all kinds of connectors for that system, but no ethernet cable to plug into the connection. Yes, they have wi-fi, but it was a very weak, slow connection, so an ethernet would have been very helpful. 5. The fitness center was â€œclosed for inspectionâ€�. 6. Only good thing: as a vegetarian, I seldom see anything exceptional on hotel dining room menus. However, the vegetarian pasta dish that I had in the St. James dining room was the best I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Stetlife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2012. Trash on the room floor, bedside light didn't work, thermostat broken, fire drill at 11PM and no apology from manager to whom I complained the next morning after a sleepless night. This hotel is turning into a dump, and no one in authority cares.

Reviews.Title: “Relics of old decency...”
Reviews.Author: RolloPollo
Reviews.Content: This grand old lady has a great deal of charm, but badly needs a large dollop of TLC. The hotel has an elegant old world facade and nice classical internal decor. However, the decor needs upgrading and a lot of the furnishings are badly scuffed. Its overall upkeep looks to have been neglected. It has a very tired feel. Without wishing to be unkind, it's like a 5 star being run as a 3 star. The beautiful pictures on the hotel website were misleading in conveying the impression of a more upscale hotel. Our bedroom was a good size and had what we needed, but it was showing its age. The location is excellent and the the hotel staff were polite, if a little subdued. Overall, we managed to see past the hotel's failings and enjoyed our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rodi925
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby and very convenient location for conferences. Rooms need a complete redo. Very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Dog-Friendly, but Rough around the Edges”
Reviews.Author: robotmuppet
Reviews.Content: We really like this hotel cause it is a nice hotel in a central location and is dog-friendly. However, the rooms are very rough around the edges and in need of renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good concierge but front desk needs help!”
Reviews.Author: jahuja
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during the time between Christmas and New Years. The location is just fantastic as is it in the middle of everything. Had booked a superior room and was upgrading to a better room. There was a lot of confusion in checking in. The room that was available was a room with King bed (when I had asked for 2 queens). And it looked like somebody had jumped on the bed after making it. They then moved us to another room and said it had a fireplace and was better - but it was again a room with a King bed and no fireplace. Finally got a room with 2 queens and a fireplace - but this was no better than a regular fairmont room. The fireplace didn't work, the room faced Copley square but the window was beside a bed. The bathroom was small and it had two walk-in closets?? Also there was no coffee machine or kettle. To make it worse, it smelt like a smoking room. But we were tired and didn't want to move again. So just stayed there. Ended up paying for a superior room, wasting an upgrade certificate and all we got was a regular room. On the plus side, the concierge service was excellent. She knew the area well and gave great tips. And the meal in Oak Room was fantastic. Would love to go back and visit again - but will try the other Fairmont this time!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reactions - great staff, worn facility”
Reviews.Author: peacecorpparents
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza to attend a wedding that was held there. We booked two rooms, one for us and one for our son. The reactions were pretty mixed. The good: The staff was excellent. Friendly, efficient and patient, from the front desk staff to the valets. One of the young valets cheerfully walked over to the parking garage in 7 F degree weather to fetch something I had forgotten in the car. They were great and made the stay there better than it otherwise might have been. The not so good: The Fairmont is one of Boston's grand old hotels, and it is showing its age. Much of the building is very dimly lit. Our bathroom door would not stay closed. The shower water was warm, but not hot, and was noticeably cooler by the end of the shower. The heating in one room was fine, but when the fan was on in the other room, it blew hot air all the time and the room temperature was in the 80's. We ate breakfast in the hotel dining room. The food was okay, but only okay. It was also very expensive and service was very, very slow. The Fairmont still charges for wi-fi, a pet peeve of mine when so many other hotels are providing it at no charge. So, three stars instead of higher, but with one last comment - the location is splendid. Copley Square is a great central location for just about anywhere you might want to go in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Glamour, Modern Comfort”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMaeBear
Reviews.Content: Originally my husband and I were going to The Copley to celebrate or wedding anniversary. Then, our childcare arrangements fell through. So, I called and spoke with the front desk, told them my tale of woe and asked if we could book a second adjoining room to ours. The front desk was very sympathetic, however, wasn't able to guarantee adjoining rooms. The very friendly and upbeat reservationist did promise nearby rooms. Since my daughter is 14 and very responsible, that sounded fine. Imagine our delight when we arrived and received the three room suite on the top floor overlooking the park! According to the history of the hotel, the likes of Elizabeth Taylor and Frank Sinatra once graced the same suite! The furnishings and decor were tasteful, and included antiques as well as modern amenities including a Bose sound system. The baths were old fashioned, perfectly functional and charming. The beds were extremely comfortable. The kids had dinner in the living room overlooking the park. Room service for dinner and breakfast were luxurious. Downstairs, the lobby and other public rooms were amazing. If you are looking for a Boston Hotel with old world charm, brilliant service and a bit of history, go to the Boston Copley Plaza. Be sure to have a drink in the Oak Room Bar. The waitress was friendly and service was very professional. One thing to check when you reserve your stay, ask if they are renovating during your stay. A waiter told us that there was going to be some refurbishment work soon. Frankly, it already looked great to me as it is!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: fam4luv2travel
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel. The rooms were expected but the concierge service was just the best. Stayed in many five stars but the concierge goes way and beyond. I emailed a week before to inform them that we were coming and if they can recommend some restaurants for the week we were there. She called(international) and asked what type of restaurants we liked and what time. When we arrived she had a list of the reservations that she had made-all hip, great restaurants from French to Japanese. Jim and Catie Copely(the black lab) were super nice and helpful when our son wondered around the hotel when he was not supposed to and kept him company until I could find him again. Not just great service, but service with warmth and a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant With Issues”
Reviews.Author: MarshBruce
Reviews.Content: Like the Englishman, upon being asked by his waiter at the club, "How is your boiled egg?", replied, "Parts of it are quite good", so I have some difficulty rating The Fairmont Copley Plaza Boston. Should you be a member of the Fairmont's President's Club, the doorman will greet you by your name when you arrive at the curb of the front door. Your car will be stored for $42.00/day. You will receive free internet service, or if not a member you will pay a hefty daily fee for it. The hotel is under renovation. I don't think my room had been renovated yet. The window could not be opened for fresh air. The edges of the doors had chipped paint. The bed, sheets, blanket, and pillows were excellent. The closet very large. The furnishings elegant, with two electric outlets right there on the desk, for charging my half-dozen battery driven devices. The bathroom had issues. The shower curtain was on a narrow track, hard to pull around the tub and too short. The toilet was located so close to the wall that it was difficult to use, especially with the toilet paper holder occupying the space where one's right leg is located. It takes a while to get hot water. The desk phone did not work, but the one at the bed did. The desk clock did not work either; it runs on batteries, though maintenance assured me it did not. The down light to call the elevator on the fourth floor was out. You just don't put your room card in the slot to call the elevator, but must withdraw it do activate the elevator. Details, details. Prior to sleep, I requested additional pillows from the front desk; they arrived twenty minutes later. No Sunday paper brought to room or available at front desk; you can buy one in the gift shop. There's a bottle of water in the room, with a tag around the neck of the bottle, declaring its price is $7.00. I miss the iconic Brass Rail Bar off the lobby! It's no longer there.

Reviews.Title: “Old world elegance and charm”
Reviews.Author: Wendy S
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Fairmont in November of 2011. Rich, elegant decor combined with a friendly, attentive staff. And right in the heart of Boston, convenient to lots of things. The breakfast was in their small restaurant--the food delicious and well presented. We ate there both mornings of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Small Room”
Reviews.Author: Andrew Q
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a lovely hotel right on the square at Copley Plaza, with Trinity Church at one end and the Boston Public Library at the other. The location is perfect. Copley metro stop is right outside and there are lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance in Back Bay. My only complaint is that the room was very small. There was some building work going on but this did not affect us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic old school hotel that knows how to treat guests.”
Reviews.Author: morr87
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed my stay here, dated property but location and service are top noch. There is something to be said for hotels that can deliver true five star service, such a rarity in Americas theses days. At the Copley its was superb from check in to check out. A friend warned me that there was construction happening at this property so when I called in and spoke to a reception manager (Patrick) he assured me that it was happening on the other side of the building and was well cordoned off from my room. Check in was smooth and swift, I received an email saying my room was ready as I was getting into my taxi at Logan. At arrival bellhops were at the ready to assist guests and made for a smooth transition from taxi to room. Oak Room was a real old fashioned American bar with fantastic service. Silky smooth cocktails and a vibrent (and quite young) atmosphere. True five star service thought, wanted to transfer hotels because I was worried about the crowds and noise in the square come new years. They helped me make a seamless transition to another property in there house car. Only criticism would be there room service, when it came the agent was very rude and dismissive. Despite that I will be back next time in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous room and outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: johannaRLM
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza last year over the March Break. The room was beautiful and very romantic and the room service was divine! We didn't have the best view but all the other little details more than made up for that. Looking forward to visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Mike J
Reviews.Content: After the renovation is complete, this hotel will receive an overall 5. Still quite pricey but a great venue for a wedding or conference.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Copley unlikely to disappoint”
Reviews.Author: DRJPH1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old hotel well positioned in Boston; rooms are old as to be expected and the floor-boards creak overhead; service is not the best I have experienced but this seems to be one of the best hotels in Boston otherwise; tip generously or invoke the wrath of the service staff!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cozziad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The place is so gorgeous you hardly want to leave it to see Boston. The service is very good and the room we had was perfect. It is right downtown too in an amazing location. This is one of those places I believe is worth spending extra on.

Reviews.Title: “Upcoming facelift for the Grande Dame”
Reviews.Author: artesa
Reviews.Content: This is venerable hotel in Copley Plaza was upfront in announcing an overdue remodel beginning next week. My husband and I spent a few days here over Christmas, and I paid a bit more for a room with a view when I made reservations. I was not disappointed with the view. Our room had faded, dated wallpaper, no pictures or mirrors (except for the bathroom mirror), the hems on the robes were frayed and the towels were a bit thin. The mattresses were very firm, no pillow top, and I really missed having a full length mirror. However, the room did overlook Copley square with it's beautiful Christmas tree and picturesque church. OK, so the hotel halls and our room appeared a bit stark, dingy even, but The Fairmont still held on to its former elegance with the room's chandelier dressed in shining crystal drops, high ceilings, the hotel's attentive doormen, and a wonderful cheery staff. Catie, the Fairmont mascot black lab retriever, graced the lobby with her large wagging tail, delighting children and guests with her presence. The lobby was festive with lights, garlands and a tree! The Oak Room wait staff were professional, friendly and caring in this very busy time but alas, we were too late making reservations for dinner Christmas Eve and had to go elsewhere. We did eat a pub dinner on Christmas Day in the Oak Room lounge (Kobe beef burger and fries!) which was perfect after the past two nights more formal dining. Though the jewels lost some glow, after this refurbish/remodeling project the Grande Dame will step out again in high fashion and with a new elegant look. Location is central to a walkable city, great shopping and dining. Will continue staying at Fairmonts.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: victoria082
Reviews.Content: I am very used to staying at Fairmont hotels while on business trips, but this time it was for pleasure. The hotel is impressive; it has the old aristocratic charm to it. I loved the lobby - marble, gold, mirrors, and amazing Christmas decorations; as well as the location â€“ walking distance to all youâ€™d like to see and visit. Our room was at the 4th Gold floor - signature. It was very nice but needed some renovations - chopped bath tub, lots of scratches on the walls here and there. Apparently they are aware of this as some major renovation work is going throughout the hotel. This said - I don't accept being awakened by construction workers whose voices were loudly audible through the AC. Also, the Gold lounge was under renovations and closed. They might have thought of adding some free drinks or something in the room instead. The not so impressive part was the room maintenance. The first they we were awaken by the cleaning lady at 9 (Christmas day) and I asked her to clean when we were out. When we went for a walk at 10 and came back at 1 p.m. the room wasnâ€™t made up at all. I had to call the reception to send somebody while we were away again. The tea and coffee was never replenished (3 nights stay), neither was the mouth wash. I realize I am getting picky but small details reveal the class of the hotel. Above being said, the reception staff was extremely friendly and efficient. I would definitely recommend the hotel while visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely historic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Edgingin
Reviews.Content: The hotel does a nice job of preserving the historic feel without seeming shabby. Doormen are always efficient and polite. Desk staff and Concierge are a mixed bag. I've sometimes spoken with seasoned staff who are as charming as the hotel. This past visit, the staff seemed very new and green and seemed as though they were not fully empowered to "make things right for the customer."

Reviews.Title: “Old world elegance and service”
Reviews.Author: harpsichordmama
Reviews.Content: We spent four lovely days in this beautiful hotel. Beautiful, comfortable room with fireplace overlooking Copley Plaza. Drinks in the elegant Oak Room Bar. Highly recommended: get the package that includes breakfast for a great deal. Only downside: tiny bathroom, strictly one at a time. But good location and superior service over rides that small inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great service, some rooms are a bit old”
Reviews.Author: greg_bar
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 10 nights in this hotel. The rooms are okay, very beautiful but with outdated technology. I had a room with a very very nice view on copley square, however it was in close proximity to the entrance of the staff area and it became very loud. The place has an amazing valet service, Louis took care of my car every day with an amazing professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reeva
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful five night stay at the Fairmont Copley Plaza Boston. From the moment we stepped in to the Hotel we were met with smiling friendly faces. The Hotel was very nicely furnished and will be even better with the renovations that are going on at the moment. We had no noise from these at any time during our stay. Our room was very large with two queen sized beds and a large walk in wardrobe and the bathroom was huge. Our room was clean and tidy and much better than what we were expecting due to some of the negative reviews of the Hotel on this site. We had breakfast in the Hotel every morning and the waiters were extremely friendly and efficient. We also had free wifi in our room after signing up for the Presidents club online. They have a resident dog called Catie Copley who was able wander around the Hotel and even had her own bed in the Reception area and guests were able to take her for a walk. The Hotel is in a great location and we walked everywhere We would not hesitate to stay at this Hotel again if we ever returned to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Completely charming!”
Reviews.Author: treetica
Reviews.Content: Every encounter with staff in this hotel was warm and so hospitable. I have not had such a pleasant experience at hotel ever and I marvel at this since it is such a large size. It also was great to see the black lab in the lobby. Love it! The historic building definitely has a lot of charm and is a great area to go shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Very Historic and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheDeacon87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Copley for business recently and was pleased. It's a bit dated and the continual renovations were a bit of a headache, but the staff and facilities were very nice. I took advantage of the Gold level and was surprised to find charges for the offererings in the concierge loung, other hotels do not do this on their concierge level in my experience. The rooms were spacious and were nicely decorated though the heating unit in the hotel could not be moderated so the temps in the hotel were quite high throughout the stay. Nice hotel but not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to love”
Reviews.Author: happycamperNewYork
Reviews.Content: Fairmont has worked hard to create the Fairmont Gold brand and when possible, stay at properties offering this option. The rooms are large and comfortable with good lighting. The interior design is classic and soothing with just enough gadgets such as a flat screen TV to feel modern without feeling frivolous. The staff are intelligent, helpful and are good at predicting travel times on rainy days.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tigerhawke
Reviews.Content: This was a girlie few days for shopping and some shows. The hotel is beautiful, the Oak Room was always buzzing with activity and the food & cocktails were delicious. The room was large and clean. Be careful with the hair dryers - we plugged it in and blew a fuse so no lights for a bit - but quickly repaired. If you want shopping, the hotel is two minutes walk from The Copley Center and the Prudential Center - shopping malls. A ten minute taxi ride (around $10) gets you to Quincy Market - a fun few hours of shops and restaurants. Boston has the friendliest people, from the hotel, to taxis, everyone in the restaurants and shops...I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service but the walls are thin”
Reviews.Author: yacineawt
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems great at first because of the great location and great service and the cute hotel dog that everyone can touch but when you are trying to sleep you nearly feel like if the people in the next room are speaking right next to you. The hotel was built in 1912 so I'm not very surprised. Apart from that everything at this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “great location, beautiful hotel, center of it all”
Reviews.Author: courtchick54
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here for a long weekend getaway nov 4 - 8. i was familiar with the area from a previous trip to boston, so knew we would have great access to public transportation, shopping, restaurants, etc. our room was very clean, HUGE (for older hotel standards) and very quiet. the only complaint i have is the HVAC which was located in the closet and ran constantly. the door was closed by a magnet and it would come unlatched every so often. the hotel is located less than 2 blocks from TWO T stations (copley and back bay) so we could go to either one and reach all our destinations outside of walking distance. the staff were incredibly (genuinely) nice, and the concierge gave us some very helpful info. water pressure was super, though i don't love the waterfall shower heads. large bathroom with a window that opens!!! bonus!!! we did not eat in the restaurant but a peek inside revealed a very Mad Men-esque environment with dark wood, low lighting and beautiful people. the lobbies, stairs, hallway to the front desk, ballrooms - all were very elegant, tasteful and period to the building. the only improvement could be the addition of an in-room coffee maker. overall we were both very happy with our choice and will continue to stay at a fairmont every chance we get.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect combination of historic grandeur and comfort in great location”
Reviews.Author: tripali
Reviews.Content: We stay here at least three or four times per year, and it just keeps getting better. We are usually there on business, so we don't spend much time in the room- but it is a great oasis of comfort in a perfect location for our needs. The last stay we got breakfast and parking included in the price of the room- a great deal. Join the President's Club- it is free and you will get a room upgrade if it is available, and free WiFi. Don't forget to say hello to the adorable black lab that lives in the lobby on the weekends! The only negative I can think of is that the fitness center is rather small for a hotel this size- and it was very busy while I was there. I found myself getting up super early to get there so I could get on a machine.

Reviews.Title: “If you'd like to feel like royalty, book a room at the Fairmont Copley Plaza Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LoveDancePaint
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over, and who knew my favorite hotel I've stayed at was less than an hour from where I live. I booked a room for a night on the town of Boston and I have never been treated so well. The room was immaculate, the staff was friendly and very helpful, dinner & breakfast the next morning in the Oak Room were both delectable... I truly have nothing negative to say about this beautiful, historic hotel in the heart of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm ~ New World Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Refined-Bohemian
Reviews.Content: This historic old hotel somehow manages to come off feeling both palatial and cozy. We enjoyed a weekend getaway, staying in a standard room with a king bed. The bathroom was small, yet modern and adequate -- which is only realistic in a 100 year old hotel. The bed and linens were so incredibly comfortable that we slept better than in our own bed at home! The gold chandelier that hangs from the center of the room is on a dimmer which was perfect for softening the room light later in the evening. The room had a good vibe and felt almost homey. I personally didn't care for the sound of the fan associated with the climate control (heat in this case), so I turned the heat up for maybe an hour before going to bed, then shut it off completely which was a wonderful solution. There was not an appliance in the room for making tea or coffee and we weren't ready to go to breakfast, so I consulted my smartphone map, and voilÃ¡, learned there was a Starbucks steps away. I went out the side door and it was just at the corner and brought back two teas to our room, allowing us to get going at an easy pace, then later enjoyed a delicious brunch in the Oak Room. Our guests at brunch ordered their signature Bloody Mary's, which were as much appetizers as they were a drink. The hotel's main floor corridors are also stunning. We so enjoyed our stay that we look forward to coming back and staying in a suite next time. And who couldn't love a hotel that's home to Catie the Labrador?! I'm more of a cat person, but this dog won me over and I hope to take her on a walk when we return!

Reviews.Title: “Business in Boston”
Reviews.Author: cantonioli
Reviews.Content: I had a conference at the Convention Center midweek, a Wednesday to Thursday stay. I chose this hotel because it is within decent walking distance of the Center, but also because I had heard good things from friends. The hotel is lovely. Tall, vaulted ceilings in the lobby--very clean, very welcoming, and overall just pleasing to the eyes. All staff were helpful and courteous, check-in simple and fast. I felt like if I needed anything they would certainly be there. My room was large, larger than I anticipated with great marble sinks, comfortable and large bed, and just a great room. I did order room service in the evening, a sandwich and a side salad, and it was fine. Nothing amazing, but when you are hungry at night and looking for something it was good. Then in the evening I got a knock on the door about a turndown service. While I didn't need it, it was nice to see the staff try--and, they gave me a printed card for the next day that told me the weather! Great hotel that I highly recommend, especially if you are looking to check out Newbury street.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm in this grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: donnap21
Reviews.Content: Our son's wedding was in the Fairmont Copley's Grand Ballroom. We stayed in the hotel for a few nights prior to the wedding and the staff was first class. We were treated to an upgrade along with fresh fruit waiting for us. The Oak Room restaurant in the hotel had wonderful food as well. The concierge and doormen were more than polite. The wedding in the grand ballroom was simply breathtaking. This hotel has old world charm, just beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boston Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: micklow
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week in Boston staying at the Fairmont Copley Plaza and it is certainly a grand hotel. I paid a few pound extra and upgraded to a Fairmont room and it was well worth it. The room was huge. All staff we came in contact with were very polite and helpful. The oak room bar was very palatial but not to my liking as i prefer drinking in real pubs, but i could not fault it if you fancy a romantic martini with someone. The hotel is situated in a perfect position for getting around Boston and door staff were polite and prompt and good for asking for advice. If you are looking for a romantic hotel this meets all your requiremnts.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MomX3Vermont
Reviews.Content: Grand and opulent main lobby area. Feels like you are in a different era. It's a beautiful hotel in a very convenient location. Customer service is outstanding. Umbrellas from the concierge and lots of good advice. We went to Newbury Street after we checked out and realized that we left a laptop charging cable in one of the rooms. We made a quick call to the hotel and they were extremely helpful. Someone ran right up to the room, got the cable, wrapped in plastic with our name on it and put it with our bags that we being saved with the valet while we shopped. We were traveling with our 3 children and booked 2 rooms. We asked that they be adjoining and we were thrilled to find out that we actually ended up with the whole end of a hallway to ourself. There is a potential doorway at the end of the hallway that can block off the whole area like it is one big suite with 2 bedrooms. It was awesome! My husband and I had a room with a king bed and the kids had a room with 2 queens. If you are traveling as a family and require 2 rooms, I cannot recommend this highly enough. Everyone had their own space and that feature alone made the high room price worth it. Don't expect to find modern conveniences like a coffee pot in the room or coffee in the lobby, but there is a Starbucks on the corner. Also, you will not find free wi-fi like a newer hotel. Wi-fi is $13. per room per night.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Fairmont Copley Plaza”
Reviews.Author: ts1877
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! It's my second time staying at the hotel and I will continue to choose the Fairmont as my favorite hotel in the Boston area. The hotel as you walk in transports you to a begone era of oppulence and grandeur. The staff is accomodating; whether your staying on the premier 4th floor or the others (I've stayed on both and was still pleased with my accomodations and service on when not on the 4th floor). Catey Copley (hotel dog) is the sweetest pup and she brings a special element to the hotel that cannot be duplicated by any Westin or Marriott. I gave 4 stars instead of 5 as I do think the hotel could use a bit of a minor update. Doors in the bedrooms need to be stripped of old paint and then repainted rather than just painting another coat on a already paint thick door. Also lighting in the bedroom is a bit odd, rooms can seem a bit dark as the lights are not positioned as strategically as one would like. Also, for breakfast additional offerings of just normal ceral should be available to guests. Not everyone wants to eat french toast or eggs benedict in the morning. Otherwise, this is a perfect hotel for a couple, family or a business trip. I highly recommend it and I am far from an easily pleased traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds but smoke smell? Really?”
Reviews.Author: pimpam1
Reviews.Content: A perfect location to do lots of touristy things in Boston. The room we had was small compared to modern hotels but nicely appointed. The bathroom was starting to show wear with some torn wallpaper and the toilet broke but that was promptly fixed when it was pointed out to the concierge. Cool "flip-up" outlet on the desk so you don't have to crawl under it to plug in. The bed was wonderful. Not sure if it was because we were exhausted from walking around town all day but we slept like babies with four king pillows and a very comfortable pillow top bed pad. So here is the drawback, the room still smelled of the "this-used-to-be-a-smoking-room" smell. You know the smell? Where you have to wash your clean clothes when you return from a trip? We dealt with it but I will ask to change rooms next time before I just accept it.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing staff not worthy of 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: JD4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Fairmont in August of this year (have been before), and we were very disappointed with the level of service from some of the staff, especially Reception. I love this Hotel for its location and ambience and that is why I was delighted we were going back but from check-in to check-out myself and my husband found the staff to be rude. Our room was fine but could do with some refurbishment - we were on a special rate and I felt we paid the price for this throughout our whole stay. The only member of staff who we found to be helpful was a girl in guests services (sorry I cannot remember her name, she had red hair). I come from a Travel and Hotel background and it takes a lot for me to right this type of review but I really do feel management seriously need to take a look at front of house staff, there are a lot of them but this is diffenitely a case of quantity over quality. I will not return to this hotel and will certainly not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Old Classic Hotel but Overrated”
Reviews.Author: avalon99
Reviews.Content: Travelled to this hotel for a meeting. Arrived in the evening pouring rain & no one there to open the door. There was a doorman there every other day. Very old and historic hotel. Beautiful foyer. Rooms are consistent with the period hotel. But door frames need to be painted Bathroom was very small (had a $500 Suite) with very little counter space. Compared to similar Fairmont properties the bathroom was less than I expected likely consistent with the age of the property. Dog barking in the next room concerns me about the cleanliness of the carpets if pets are allowed. Hotel staff very curtious. Excellent location for shopping. Oak Room restaurant nice atmosphere. Average Food. Overall nice Hotel but overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, old hotel”
Reviews.Author: RipleyG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a central location in Boston. It is 100 years old and very grand. It is also expensive but if you're after a treat (and wonderful cocktails in the Oak Room) then you will love this hotel. We used it as both a first night and final night in Boston. The staff are wonderful, the rooms are very comfortable and the surrounding are magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great hotel, great everything”
Reviews.Author: Danni0713
Reviews.Content: This has to be my favorite hotel in Boston. I've stayed here numerous times and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. The location is fantastic, the staff is always ready to help you with whatever you need. The rooms are large and very cozy. I can not say enough about the bathroom, soaking in the tub after a long day exploring the city has to be one of my favorite things. I will be returning in Feb 2012 for my birthday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: bergcarrie
Reviews.Content: First, before you stay at any Fairmont Hotel, join their rewards program. Access to a fantastic lounge in each hotel AND free internet. Pluses: 1. Location 2. Staff 3. Lounge/Gold Room is fantastic; great breakfasts and snacks all day (please don't forget to tip here,,,,I really hate when people get waited on hand and foot and can't scrape together a couple of bucks for the staff in the lounge). 4. Beautiful historical building. I had an excellent room. It was spotless and cleaned nicely each of the 4 days I was here. Robes in rooms, safe, and I had a coffee pot (not sure why everyone else said they didn't have one???) 5. Umbrella in the room. Living in Portland, I appreciate that kind of stuff on the road. 6. Oak Room Wedge Salad. YUM. 7. Catie the dog. Made me miss my lil 4 legged pal :(. Minuses: 1. Thin walls. I heard my neighbor all night long. And, I heard him press snooze about 10 times in the mornings. I was millimeters from going to knock on his door and go female on him. You are not at home buddy. Wake up. 2. Fitness room. Its a total joke. 2 treadmills and 2 ellipticals. In a walk in closet with some weights. You get a guy in their who takes garlic supplements, and sweats profusely, and you will gag on your towel. The nearby options are ridiculously overpriced. For a business traveler like myself, I expect high end hotels to have nicer fitness facilities,,,,,particularly if you have a lot of meetings on sight. And, because its sandwiched between sleeping rooms, you cannot get in there until 6:00am.

Reviews.Title: “Boston's best?”
Reviews.Author: rjmmac
Reviews.Content: Always stay here given the opportunity. Phenomenal location, nice staff. On the pricier end however, but it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Robinnora
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week during a conference at the Fairmont. We couldn't have been more pleased with the service, the room and the location. Joe Fallon the concierge was particularly helpful in planning my days while my husband was in the conference. Everthing you need is right out the front door. Restaurants, coffee shops, shopping, all within a few blocks. There is a trolley stop across the street. It's a great way to see Boston. You can hop on and off at all the stops. Trinity Church is across the street in the square. The Sunday service was beautiful. You can also take a tour. Don't miss The Museum of Fine Art. There is a subway stop across the street form the hotel that drops you off right there. The Oak Bar in the hotel was a great place to end the eveninh with a nightcap, and Catie Copley, the Labrador mascot of the hotel was a unique touch. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: caribe_chic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend and thoroughly enjoyed it. I was fortunate enough to get a travel agent rate, so I don;t have much to say about price. We were in a superior room which was very spacious and classic. The bathroom was huge and we were supplied with nice amenities. We especially liked the bathrobes. Upon my boyfriend's first shower in the room, we noticed that the tub was not draining well. We meant to tell the front desk about it before we left for the day, but we forgot. When we came back we met a maintance man outside our door with tools. Apparently the maid had told him about the clog and he came to fix it right away. He was working for about 10 minutes, and then left saying everything was fixed. However, the water still wouldn't go down. We were about to call the front desk when a 2nd maintance man knocked on the door just to see how the shower was. We told him it was still clogged and he fixed it fine. I was very impressed by this service, as we did not even need to notify anyone and they still did a follow up check after the first repair. The surrounding area is really great. We were only about a 5 block walk from the Prudential Center where the Ducktour starts and there are many great restaurants. We ate out every meal and usually brought it back to the room to just relax and watch some TV. The Oak Room looked gorgeous, but it was also expensive. We are pretty low key and it seemed a bit to stuffy for us, but there were always lots of well-dressed people looking quite satisfied in there whenever we walked by, so it must have been good. The hotel lobby is GORGEOUS. Very ornate with a real classic luxury feel. It reminded me very much of NYC's Plaza hotel, which is the sister to the Copley Plaza. The staff was courteous and helpful. A block away from the hotel is Boylston street, loaded with great eateries and shopping. The hotel is in a great location for walking and transit. There was even a Boston Sports Club about a block and a half away. My bf and I are both members of NYSC and could use the facility for no charge. Just know that in December a new area will open up on the upper floor with a huge fitness center and new rooms. Overall, this was an excellent stay. I would definitely stay here again. I recommend avoiding the valet service at the hotel ($42/day with unlimited in-and-out service). There is a garage across the street for about $32/day, so if you are not going to be driving around town and just leaving the car there, this is the better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: Whitesoxjoe
Reviews.Content: I treated my Dad to few nights in Boston for our favorite pastime - a baseball game at Fenway - and we were treated like royalty from the moment we arrived. It seemed like they were waiting for us when we arrived at the concierge (gold?) level and served us a drink and addressed us by name. The spread they served before the game was over the top amazing. My father kept saying that "he won the lottery"! It was the service that set this hotel apart - and is the reason I will stay at this hotel whenever I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: marjorieanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week for 3 nights. What gracious service and hospitality! The staff couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. Catie Copley, the Canine Ambassador, is a warm, welcoming face after a hard day of site seeing. The rooms are clean and fairly spacious with comfortable, well-appointed beds. The bathroom was way too small to maneuver about comfortably. However, it's a lovely hotel, right in the heart of the action. Would I return? In a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and close to all the action”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaGoldwing
Reviews.Content: YOu are right downtown and close to everything. Even had a Farmer's Market with interesting and great things across the street. Hotel is over-rated at $300.00 plus per night. Wall paper coming off the wall and curtains in bathroom torn. NOT EVEN a free cup of coffee on arrival or any in your room at all. they charge excessively for everything, even the Internet when it is free at a well-known coffee shop down the street. Hotel has dog I lobby that you can walk, if so inclined.

Reviews.Title: “A non-resident trip to the Oak Bar was a big success!”
Reviews.Author: JannJ28
Reviews.Content: The Oak Bar was recommended to us and we had the best of times. Just the two of us and a fantastic bar waitress (half Swedish, half American) who did all she could to give us a lovely experience. We enjoyed the Martinis, the wine and the delicious snacks. The pianist was very receptive to suggestions of material to play. This is an amazing hotel with an auspicious history (Kennedy connection plus more). I have no idea what it is like to stay here but please do visit for a nice evening out!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Staff”
Reviews.Author: Al H
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my husbands' 50th birthday with an initial visit to Boston in early July. This was our first Fairmont experience (but definitely not our last), we've already secured a return visit to this grand hotel. The property itself is very lush,gorgeous and centrally located. All attractions are walking distance with shopping literally steps outside. What impressed us more than the physical beauty was the 5star treatment we received consistently throughout our 7 day stay. Even prior to our arrival, I was fortunate enough to meet Mr. Jason Buckley (Guest Quality Manager),when I called with general inquiries . Each conversation he took the time to answer all my questions, offering suggestions and trip ideas. Mr. Buckley proved to be a great resource, knowledgable about his city and site. These phone calls left me feeling so welcome, that I was eagerly anticipating my visit. Upon arrival at Logan Int'l, we were graciously met with a gift as Mr. Buckley remembered it was a special occassion for us. He even recalled my favorite boutique (as was mentioned in a passing phone conversation); and set up a surprise shopping excursion at "White House/Black Market" exclusively for me, with my own personal attendant. A few days later while enjoying this luxury; Jason even stopped by to ensure that I was being well looked after. Wow! What attention to detail, what amazing service!!! My husband and I are avid travellers, vacationing a minimum of four times annually and four star establishments are our priority. In all our combined trips we have never received such outstanding service, it truly set the tone for the entire week. You'll also want to meet Ms. Sarah Miyake Everrett(Front Desk Manager). Their genuine enthusiasm and sincerity alone are worth the visit. The elegance of this historic property coupled with the best staff in the industry is a recipe for success and guarantees a unforgettable vacation. You deserve the very best, come experience it at the Fairmont Copley Plaza Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Aled_Vic
Reviews.Content: Luxurious hotel on the corner of Copley Square which is a great location to access all the great parts of Boston from the public gardens to The Boston Red Sox's Fenway Park. The hotel has great character about it and very friendly staff. They even have a Labrador welcome you when you check in. This hotel is at the top end price range but felt it was well worth it. Strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: saot14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because my husband was attending a medical conference at the hotel. The building is beautiful, elegant and the staff is ready to serve. One thing to note - don't expect monster sized rooms in a building of this age - even at the price you pay to stay here. Our room was very comfortable for us (just the two of us) but was much smaller than rooms in other cities we have visited. Hey, it's an old, historic building. Besides, how much room do you really need - you aren't throwing cocktail parties in there. You should be out seeing the sights anyway. Another tip - our bathroom was quite large because it was handicap accesible with a roll-in shower. I don't think the bathrooms in the other rooms would have been as big. The hotel was located in a nice area - walking distance to the shopping on Newbury St and covered mall, Boston Common and the beginning of the Freedom Trail, Beacon Hill and the South End. Of course, we like to walk. Also, took the subway just a short distance to Museum of Fine Art and Fenway Park. We had a very pleasant stay here (4 nights).

Reviews.Title: “recent conference and stay”
Reviews.Author: doug1c
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Fairmont Copley Plaza. Was on the planning committee for a conference held there. Logistics for the conference went well even though we shared a space that was used for a wedding on two evenings. My room was great and service excellent. Two problems. First,on my 4th night there I returned at midnight and my key card did not work. I went the front desk. At first that treated me like a fool asking if I was sure that I knew how to use my card. They gave me a new card and those did not work. I made 3 total visits to the front desk without being able to access my room. Front desk staff was pleasant but did not seem too concerned about my plight. Finally the night manage let me and my wife into the room. I still did not have a working card for my room. The night manager said that a key would be delivered and put under my door. When I awoke, no key and I had to call again. They said a key would not fit under the door. Good enough explanation, but one I received the key I found it could easily slide under the door. Second at checkout I had one room service charge that was mine and another that was not. I think the card snafu and false charge are related. Even though it was my forth night I was locked out of my room by the computer system and the front desk believed that I was in a different room 3 floors away. I hope that the person in that room enjoyed the room service that I was billed for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: tiby
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed at the Fairmont Copley in Boston. The accommodation and location was perfect. The staff was very helpful in helping us arrange our itinerary to see the most of Boston in our four days there. The room was clean and fresh and the hotel is very elegant. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kckidwriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont during the week of Hurricane Irene. The hotel decor is elegant, our room was well appointed, included a large marble bathroom, a chandelier on a dimming switch, a well stocked mini-bar and comfortable beds. The location was perfect - a few steps from the Prudential shopping complex, the subway, a theater kiosk and the Boston Library. Newbery street, is a block away and the Boston Commons is only minutes by foot. The hotel hallways are sweeping and grand, and the staff is very discrete. After checking in, the hotel offered to send up our bags. They arrived before we did - evidence of discretely camouflaged service elevators throughout the hotel. The morning paper was delivered in a monogrammed cloth bag which hung from our doorknob. One note: This is the ONLY hotel I've visited in months that did not knock on my door at some odd hour of the morning to see if we were gone or needed our room cleaned. That alone rates them 5 stars. The exercise room on the second floor is small, but contained everything we needed (ellypticals, treadmills, free weights, aerobic steps, exercise balls) and overlooks the park. My husband - an exercise junkie - especially liked the weight system which he described as "smooth." A special touch is a small refrigerator stocked with chilled hand towels to use after a session. I noted in a press release a larger fitness area is in process and we hope to use it on the next visit. We were forced to extend our stay due to flight cancellations. Despite the high winds, the hotel, and our room were relatively quiet. Even better, when we checked out, we'd discovered the hotel had eliminated the wireless internet charge because we had enrolled in the Fairmont President's Club the previous evening. That was a bonus. We were also told we could note our favorite room in the event we returned. Fairmont is now one of my favorite destinations when coming to Boston. Tip - for quick snack, the nearby Grocery store at the Prudential has the best lobster rolls on the planet - for less than $10 - in their deli section.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: HermesParis
Reviews.Content: The Copley Plaza presents an example of iconic and grand architecture. Inside, take a corner suite if you can. Our rooms overlooked the square and were spacious enough to dance or hold a yoga class. The modern renovated bathroom was a nice contrast to the patrician style. Fairmont is consistently superior. And the location is central.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great choice”
Reviews.Author: t1999
Reviews.Content: I am in and out of Boston all the time. The location of the hotel is great and the staff and service is always consistantly good.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Copley Plaza Boston”
Reviews.Author: ChiefPark
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect central location to access all that Boston has to offer. Walking distance for those so inclined to the Freedom Train, The Garden and Common and Fenway Park. The hotel itself is in a national registry building 100 years old but fully modernized. The service is spectacular. Fairmont Copley Plaza is know for its canine greeter Catie Copley a black labrador owned by one of the doormen who lounges in the lobby and greets the clients and their children. This was truly a wonderful hotel and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great old hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: VancouverMan66
Reviews.Content: Clean, well located, fantastic old bar. Go to hotel for me when in Boston. Not small or quaint but very upscale functional.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest luxury hotels in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: Lambert99
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 2 night stay here. Service was excellent. Hard to imagine how this hotel could improve. Will definitely stay here next time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NoFo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with a group of friends celebrating a birthday. It was in a perfect location and the staff was fantastic. They gave us lots of help with trip ideas and places to visit. The rooms were a bit shabby, but they are about to go through a $40 million renovation beginning this fall and we got to preview the new designs for the rooms and they are gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: macmac6
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont Copley Plaza!. We were pleased that our room was ready well in advance of normal check in time and the beds/pillows heavenly! Our room's view was awful but were offered an upgrade (at a higher cost) if we wanted. Hotel's location was amazing and we were minutes from shopping, restaurants and so much of the rich history that this beautiful city has to offer. Conceirge and front desk staff were great but we were very disappointed with the service in the Oak Room Restaurant on-site. We repeatedly had to flag our waiter down for service, fill our own wine glasses and he even brought me the wrong meal. Mistakes happen of course but then he started to argue with me even though the other 5 people at the table heard me order! Meal took way too long but the evening was luckily salvaged by having martini's overlooking the city at the Top of the Hub in the Prudential Tower. We would definitely return to this hotel but skip the restaurant for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very flexible and filled with luxury”
Reviews.Author: CaryTarHeel
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a recent business trip and the hotel was beautiful as ever. However, I was most impressed with the flexiblity I received. I traveled during the recent hurricane Irene. I found out that my flight was cancelled and I would have to stay an extra night. The hotel was able to accomodate my request and honor my rate. I then was able to reschedule my flight so that I would not have to stay the extra night but didn't find out until 2 PM that day. The hotel didn't charge any cancellation fee and didn't charge for an extra night even though I was checking out very late that day. The hotel is wonderful, beautiful and easily accessible to the Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything but the room...”
Reviews.Author: Martin B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was simply great (With reservations - ho ho) - Loved the restaurant, earthshakingly good breakfasts, the best Vodka Martinis on Earth. Brilliant staff. The room was a bit weary, there was construction owrk going on on the facade of the hotel all day long and we were advised to keep our curtains shut all day so the workmen wouldn't be peering in. (Groan, such fun to never have a decent view) I think it would be nice if we had been warned about this prior to our stay. (Some chance!) It was very noisy at night, due to some kind of ventilator outside, and my advice is, if your room faces the high rise mirrored building next door - Then get a room change. It's awful. Nothing can take away how much we loved all the staff and how fantastic all the food/drinks and service were. Just try to get the best rooms you can. It ain't cheap. The rooms/bathrooms and corridors we were given (First Floor) are long overdue a lick of paint and paper though. You aren't staying in the fabulous foyer, and in that regard it's like some of the top London hotels. The foyer is magnificent, some of the rooms a bit pants.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as i thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: ackelley
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend on Sat. night Sept.3, 2011. She was in town to bring her son to college. I have stayed at 5-6 different hotels in Boston, but never at the Copley Plaza. It always was too expensive. I will admit my friend did pay for the room. First off the Lobby in pictures looks beautiful, but is worn in real life. there is not enough seating and the couches are terribly uncomfortable. I had to wait for my girlfriend to arrive and did not find the lobby comfortable at all. The conceirge was very accomodating as I did leave my luggage as i strolled around the city. The room was ok. I though it was kind of small. We were on the 4th floor GOLD Concierge level. I thought the gold chandelier above the bed was tacky. Bathroom was samll. Hair dryer looked like it was from 1980. Waited 1/2 hour for shampoo to be delivered to the room because there was non left in the room. I wanted to write this review just to let people know that for the money, not worth it. I have stayed at the Fairmont Battery Wharf in Boston and that is well worth the money. Waterfront location, smaller more intimate hotel. Rooms are better.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing experience.”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTravelerTO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza this Labour Day weekend. I have stayed at Fairmont properties in the past and had a very positive experience. My experience at the Fairmont Copley Plaza was very disappointing and has impacted my future choices to stay at a Fairmont property. I do not recommend staying at this property. Overall, the hotel appears to be very luxurious. The lobby, main floor hallways, and ballrooms are gorgeous. However, the standard rooms are not a reflexion of the luxury seen on the main floor of the hotel. The rooms are very small and mediocre at best. We had the following problems with our room: 1. Hotel safe didn't work. 2. In room temperature control did not work. 3. Light bulbs in both the bedside lamp and hanging chandelier were burnt out. 4. TV didn't work. The cables were loose and we fixed it ourselves. 5. The hot water in the shower took a long time to heat up. 6. The drainage in the shower was blocked, leaving a pool of water up to our ankles when we showered. We called the reception for help with the safe as we wanted to leave our valuables in the safe before going out for the day. We waited 45 minutes, as security tried to fix it and finally could not fix it in a timely way. Overall, we felt that they don't maintain the rooms to the standard that is expected from a Fairmont hotel. In addition, the breakfast menu was misleading. We ordered a pastry basket for $14. It indicated that there would be a croissant, two muffins and a danish. Based on the description, we expected a full size croissant and danish. The reality was that the pastries were miniature size. It was VERY misleading and EXTREMELY overpriced for what we received. Thank goodness that Boston is such an amazing city! We spent less time in our room and more exploring the amazing architecture and culture.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating, friendly staff, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: londoner_sylviah
Reviews.Content: I booked 1 night here for our wedding night, and upon telling the front desk staff the occasion we got upgraded to a nice spacious room with a small sitting area and a tub as well as a shower (I know we got upgraded because my friends stayed in much crampier rooms for the same corporate rate). The bed was huge and extremely comfortable, and we even got a Fairmont music CD and a greeting card slipped under our door. Staff also let me check in a couple hours early knowing I needed to get ready, and the same girl who checked me in also chatted with me when we checked out. That was a nice personal touch. Although I saw the smaller rooms were less comfortable I still have a pretty good opinion of the Fairmont. I do like history and classic furnishings, as well, and this hotel has both in abundance. I can see how some people may not like the old rooms though. The hotel is definitely classier than the neigboring Sheraton, where I also stayed; at least someone at the Fairmont always picked up the phone, unlike at the Sheraton. My only gripes are that 1) on arriving back at the hotel after 11pm, we tried to unload the car and find a bellman/ valet to help, but no service staff were in sight. I know it's late, but I was left standing on the street for a while before my husband came back with a valet. 2) The cocktails at the Oak Bar were terrible, and overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stekou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Fairmont Copley Plaza from August 16 to August 19. Having read a few reviews on this hotel, I was skeptical about the hotel but decided to go anyways. I must say the minute we first walked in, we were impressed by the grandiose and wonderful lobby this historic hotel has. The reception was great and check in was very easy. Although our room was not ready, they offered to call us when it was. we grabbed lunch at a nearbye restaurant and within the hour, they called and we are able to get our room. This is not a modern state of the art hotel, so do not expect perfection, but the warmth and charm this hotel has is great. We stayed in a deluxe room facing Copley Plaza, the room was large, which was great for our 2 kids and the bathroom was fairly new and very nice. The hotel was very clean and and we would definitely stay here again. Here are a couple of tips that I will share with you, The WIFI is not free ???, $14.95 a day, however, if you register with the Presidents club before hand (free) you do get complementary WIFI !.. The restaurants at the hotel are fairly expensive, but if you want a good steak, try the Oak Room...If not there are plenty of great restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. One last thing, The location of this hotel is amazing, I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great looking but lacking good service”
Reviews.Author: john6251955
Reviews.Content: found other peoples' stuff under the bed - very dirty under tv table even had old traces of food. very noisy out side of room did not sleep through any of the four nights, trucks, buses, garbage trucks throughout the night. staff was very stuffy- unless you flashed a lot of money. not a good stay. the building is very pretty and very old that was the nicest thing of the stay. very over priced at over $400 per night - not even a doughnut for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A grande old dame”
Reviews.Author: sean s
Reviews.Content: There is something almost magical about first walking into this Hotel. Our stay, although brief, was on a Gold Floor with a corner room whose view took in Stuart Street. The double queen room was spacious with all the modern cons yet still retained its period setting and feel. A personal hand written note of "Welcome" from Fairmont Management was a memorable touch and added to the positive experience. The Gold Lounge was on the same floor as our room and was never full or over crowded during our stay. You could always find a quiet corner to loose yourself in a classic tale from the Lounge's library, or catch-up on email or just enjoy the atmosphere of this space. The Lounge's "Kitchen" served tempting canapes of an evening and a bountiful breakfast in the morning. Tea, coffee etc is on offer all day. One surprise though - any alcohol consumed from the lounge is chargable to your hotel bill. At the time ouf our visit, a glass of wine was $12. We did not touch the minibar in our room as this is a licence to print money (in hotel - not just here). We did not eat in the Hotel restuarants either. This hotel will celebrate its centenary in 2012 so some restoration work was underway during our stay but can not say it hampered our visit or dimminished it in any way. Restoration work complete, the Hotel will be even more special.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: YAM_FJR1300
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed twice at this Hotel both times we were visiting for New Years Eve (First Night) celebrations. This hotel is ideal for this as the parade comes around Copley plaza where the hotel is situated. The rooms were very well equipped and we were given a free upgrade which gave us a separate lounge area. We didn't eat in the Hotel so can't comment on the food but we did go in the Oak room for cocktails and drinks. This is a very cosy place to sit and enjoy a drink or two. Would recommend this hotel to anybody

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kate L
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza for 3 nights. The room was elegant and the hotel was beautiful. The staff were friendly, accommodating and made our stay a very pleasant one. The hotel mascot - Catie Copley - just adds to the small-town feel that the area has. I can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, classic design”
Reviews.Author: DavidLur
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay here and found the hotel to be upscale and the location was terrific. The staff could definitely use a little oversight particularly in the Oak Bar. The maitre'd was texting as we came in, and the wait staff was very casual in its conversation in the bar area. The entire hotel is WAY over air conditioned. We could not stay long in the Oak Bar because it was freezing (and the casual chatter from the service people drove us nuts! We came to enjoy a cocktail after a long day, not to hear about their issues at home). Our room upon checking in was 63 degrees. Coming in from the rain on a cold rainy day made our first few hours here miserable, but other than that I would recommend it. Aren't we suffering from a global energy crisis? Come on Fairmont, you should get it together. Anything under 72 is egregiously wasteful, and offensive.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here, great location but housekeeping leaves a bad taste”
Reviews.Author: mlsimp2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights and still love the location. I had a King room with a view of the air conditioners (ok I paid the conference rate). I love the historical aspect of the hotel and I think the other reviews where people gripe about paying for internet are sour grapes. I read the reviews and renewed my President's Club account for the free internet. If you have enough time to write a review I'd want to believe you have enough time to read reviews before you travel. I did have one problem here...my maid on my last night there took two drink glasses from my room that were my personal property. They had a logo that clearly identified them from the hotel and were left alone until my last day. I called the housekeeping supervisor and she even came up to see the room but had little to offer. The next morning at checkout the front desk gave a feeble effort at checking with housekeeping and then offered no resolution. I was left with a bad taste in my mouth and wondered what other personal items had been inspected during my stay by housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Room on the small side but great location”
Reviews.Author: BandBtraveller
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about the price as I booked with a good promotional rate much lower than the nearby Westin and Marriott Copley Place which I think were much overpriced. Location is great, just next to the Copley Square and is 2 minutes from the Amtrak Back Bay Station. The single room I stayed was a bit on the small side and in a long rectangular shape. No sofa, coffee table and safe in room and the TV was facing to the wall so you can't really watch it from the bed. Other than these small oddities the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Grande dame still scores!”
Reviews.Author: Nairey
Reviews.Content: We spent two very pleasant nights at the Fairmount Copley Plaza with our twin 16 yr old daughters last March break. Rooms are generous, comfortable and seemingly soundproof, service, courteous and friendly. Fairmont's trademark retriever on duty in the lobby is an added attraction for families with small children!

Reviews.Title: “One of the great hotels of Boston”
Reviews.Author: cathyhub
Reviews.Content: I love Fairmonts. I love the lobbies, I love the dogs, I love the service, I love the linens. I love the Fairmont Copley. I particularly love the suites with the bidets. I like cozy luxurious rooms, and that's what you get here. Some are smaller than others but I don't care about small. I sign up for meetings deliberately because they're located here. Fabulous place, great history, great service. I love Fairmonts.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mollyshumom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is almost 100 years old but is in wonderful condition. The public areas are beautiful. My standard room was large with a walk in closet and a very nice bathroom. It was very clean and quite quiet. Every staff member I encountered was extremely helpful and courteous. It is located near great ships and the main Boston library. The only amenity it doesn't have is an in-room coffee maker. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing good about this hotel besides the location”
Reviews.Author: Highway1983
Reviews.Content: Husband and I went to Boston to celebrate our wedding anniversary and stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza and we will definitely not return. We had the King Fairmont room and was so disappointed at the size of the room. Besides the bed and a writing desk, there is no space left, not even an armchair to sit on. My husband stayed there during the week for business at the gold room and I flew in to join him for the weekend where we booked the Fairmont King room. My husband asked the staff if there is anything they can do for us since we are celebrating our anniversary there and they had nothing. Dined at the Oak Bar for lunch, sat down, and waited for 5-10 min each time to get greeted by a server and to get a glass of water. Awful awful service.
