There's some kind of construction going on across the hallway from our room as well... I heard knocking and drilling during the day in the room. When we check out, some charges on bar and snack showed up on the bill which we didn't consume. Talked to front desk and they took that off. The location of the hotel is excellent, but if you're paying that kind of money, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A true Landmark Hotel for Boston”
Reviews.Author: HI_Nokaoi
Reviews.Content: My Wife and 4 year old daughter were greeted at the curb by the door man then by Catie the Hotel Mascot upon check in. Everyone was very hospitable and friendly. This hotel will be celebrating 100 years next summer so all of the rooms will be updated by then. However, only by touring the hotel did I even notice it going on. The detail and craftsmanship can only be found in Historic Hotels like this. The lobby, the ballrooms and Oak Room and Bar are great. The location is amazing! We checked in and walked to Fenway Park then took the T back. There are two T stations close by Copley Green and Back Bay Orange. On the negative my wife discovered a strawberry top a vacuum failed to pick up. I HIGHLY recommend joining their Presidents Club before you go It's free and you get Complimentary, In-room high speed Internet access which is 14.95/day, use of the house bikes, express check-in, use of the hotel BMW within 2 miles and lots of other benefits. We would love to return for their Centennial Celebration in 2012!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: jsEyes
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my adult children. Huge room. So spacious and the service was just wonderful. The hotel is lovely and staff is exceptional. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location...that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: raff622
Reviews.Content: Prior to this trip, I had not stayed here in about 10 years. It used to be "the" place...everything used to be just so. Not anymore. Other than the excellent location, the place is not what it used to be. Everything is just routine. From the check in, to the room, to the departure, its just plain routine. No one goes out of their way and the rooms could stand some updating. We did have a room with nice views of Copley Square. At this level, one expects a higher level of service, but there is nothing special here. I probably will stay here again, due mainly to the location, but I'm sure there are nicer properties out there.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, Elegance”
Reviews.Author: mikedespo
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza before so I knew the hotel would meet all my expectations. Spent the 4th of July night there and was checked in promptly with no issues. One negative (though minor but still rare for a top notch hotel like the Copley Plaza) was that the staff was not attentive when we walked in with bags. No attempt to help us and even after checking in ... no attempt to bring our bags up to our room (the front desk didn't even ask if we had bags and if we needed help). It's an oversight worth noting (even though I am very capable of handling my own bag) because you would not expect this and never experienced it prior. The room was laid out perfectly and plenty of space. Another minor thing that completely stood out was the half empty bottle of water just sitting on the table. Big oversight for a first rate hotel (and a bit gross since it leads you to question how thorough they clean). The room did appear clean though and the bed was comfortable. Ordered room service and it came up promptly and hit the spot. We ordered extra towels and said we would be leaving the room and to leave them on the bed. No one delivered them. We called again and eventually got them upon our return. The small "misses" are noted because of the hotel wanting to be a 5 star facility and my prior experience being so positive. Had breakfast the next day in the Oak Room and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: IrishGirl26
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Felt like I was really part of Boston history staying here. Gorgeous elegant feel and lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “another wonderful stay at this landmark hotel”
Reviews.Author: SCOTTYK57
Reviews.Content: I attended a business conference and this time brought my wife and two teenage children. I chose again to upgrade to the concierge level, which is one of the most relaxing and inviting of any hotel I have stayed at . It is a bright,comfortable area with a friendly professional staff. The hotel has been refreshing it's looks with new color palates in the hallways. The rooms are large, the beds very comfortable, and the maids service were always very prompt and efficient. The only negative is the very small hotel gym which will be a past tense since it is being addressed with a soon to be expanded fitness center. It is a short walk to the Boston Commons, Fenway Park, Newbury Street, and the Freedom Trail. A beautiful historic hotel in the middle of vibrant Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Arlington30
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from a one night stay in Boston. I heard great things about the Copley Fairmont and was not disappointed. We stayed on the the 4th floor which is the concierge floor which was great with two teenage, very hungry, boys. We checked in at 1:30 and our room was ready which was very nice. The concierge was very helpful, as we had a whirl wind 24 hrs. in Boston, directs to Fenway Park, Duck Tour, Freedom Trail and lunch in North Side. I only wish I would have made time for shopping which is great around hotel and taken the time to have tea at public library across the street. A plus was the NYT hanging on our door when we woke!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ATBMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our two kids on a family trip to experience Boston. Got a great deal on a travel website, but was cautious as to it being an old hotel and kid friendly. No problems on either account. GREAT location, close to the train station (walked from our train from New York), close to a subway station, and looking over Copley Square. The rooms were spacious and nicely appointed. It was obvious that a significant renovation had occurred. The concierge was eager to help us, even with family friendly places to visit and eat. We would stay here again without any reservation whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “Eegant service in an elegant ambience”
Reviews.Author: FinickyTravelers
Reviews.Content: This hotel boasts a gorgeous, bright, and spacious lobby; old-fashioned friendly and personalized service; an ideal Boston location; and one of the nation's outstanding martini bars and steak restaurants. Perquisites abound if you join the Fairmont President's Club, which has luxury hotels throughout the U.S. and Canada. The meager fitness center is about to be replaced by a state-of-the-art 3500-square-foot facility. Meanwhile, guests can get privileges at nearby centers.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service, especially during the Boston Marathon.”
Reviews.Author: jenlikesmexico
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Copley Plaza is a fabulous hotel - we have stayed there two years in a row for the Boston Marathon and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. Both times we had rooms on the Gold Floor. The Gold Floor staff is amazing, ready and willing to help with any request. The food in the Gold Floor lounge was great - excellent warm breakfasts and lots of proper snacks/goodies for post-marathon re-fuelling. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A sumptuous and souless hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Tripstaker
Reviews.Content: At right angles to both Boston City Library and Trinity Church, and facing onto Copley Square, this hotel is in a great location. When we arrived a farmers' market was in progress on the square. The Copley is impressive and certainly has the wow factor. The lobby is like a mini Versailles, complete with chandeliers and mirrored doors. We stayed two days and plushness of the lobby area never lost its impact. Room decor was faux Edwardian and it was very comfortably fitted out. Particularly impressive was the silver and black marble bathroom. Of course this all came with a hefty price tag. Our stopover here cost us more than anywhere else we stayed in Massachusetts. But the experience was all show and no substance really. Breakfast would never be included in such a grand place and internet use in the room was priced exorbitantly. Our first stopover on a 12 day trip, I wondered later why humbler, CHEAPER but just as comfortable hotels could offer free wireless internet but not the lofty Copley. Wonderful to look at and pass through it may be, but it totally lacks the essential ingredient of any hotel - hospitality! By all means stay there, but expect to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our family”
Reviews.Author: 4hends
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a good location. Convenient to Subway, restaurants, sights. We had a deluxe double plus rollaway for family of four and it was fine. Nice bathroom! I would stay here again if visiting Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Quokka7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five days. It was wonderful. My room and ensuite on the First Floor were huge! It was by far the largest and most comfortable room that I had during my entire six week holiday. When you arrive at the hotel you're greeted by Catie Copley. The beautiful (and very friendly) Catie is the Fairmont Hotel's Canine Ambassador. You can't help but fall in love with her! Make sure that you buy a copy of Catieâ€™s two books â€œCatie Copleyâ€� and â€œCatie Copleyâ€™s Great Escapeâ€�. Both books are written by Deborah Kovacs and Jared T. Williams. A portion from the sale of each book goes to the Guide Dog Foundation for the Blind. When you buy the book, make sure that you get it â€˜pawtographedâ€™ by Catie. The staff at the Fairmont Copley Plaza are very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. I was astonished that on the second day of my stay, the Concierge not only remembered my name but also happily chatted about the sightseeing that I was planning to do during rest of the day. She was wonderful! Even though the hotel was very busy, the Concierge never failed to have kind, friendly word â€“ something that is very much appreciated when youâ€™re a solo traveller from the other side of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Common Areas, Great Staff, "Dated" Room”
Reviews.Author: Cessnargh
Reviews.Content: When you look at the interior photos of this hotel, you know it is something special. Grand public areas, beautiful ballrooms, spiral staircases, elaborate bar and dining areas all convey the luxurious spirit of this historic hotel. The check-in process was easy with a helpful staff. The concierge is right by and happy to help as his dog rests at his feet in the lobby (a la the Chateau Frontenac in Quebec, another Fairmont property) and gets a friendly scratch from the hotel guests. This romantic experience kind of stopped for us at the first floor. Now it is an older hotel, designed by the same architect of the famed Plaza Hotel in New York (also a Fairmont property,) but our room was no where on the same level as the Plaza. First off it was small. I can live with small, but our friends were down the hall, with the exact same rate, booked at the same time, and their room was at least twice the size as ours! Secondly our room had a queen sized bed and theirs had a king. Not a big deal, but it would certainly require one to specify what type of room they were seeking if it mattered to them. The bathroom was also small, with a tub-shower combo, but the shower curtain only covered 2/3rds of the shower area. There is a big hole. If you are seeking privacy while you bathe...you'll have to ask for it from your partner since the curtain does not hide the space you are in. This all being said, we'd certainly stay here again, we'd just be more specific about the room. We ate in the hotel and the food was fine. The bar area was beautiful with a good crowd each night and the hostess and staff were all friendly and prompt. You have read the fitness room is not up to par for a hotel at the level of a Fairmont and the spa is nonexistant. My wife went to the GretaCole Spa in the hotel right next door and very much enjoyed her massage. Centrally located to much to see in Boston in a walkable area, and cabs were easy to come by for the longer trips. Checkout was simple and the staff and doormen were courteous. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory & would come again”
Reviews.Author: AliSmyth
Reviews.Content: All together the Fairmont Copley Plaza is a good hotel. It benefits from being in a beautiful historic building in a fantastic location. The staff, when around, are friendly and helpful, just don't hang around waiting for them to open the front door. The hotel is not cheap, but does offer rooms to those looking to pay a bit above average without breaking the budget. One note of caution would be that not every room within a room description (e.g. Deluxe) meets the advertised standards. Parking is not cheap, but is practically placed for visiting the city and you won't need to get the car out to get around once you're there. The room was decently sized with a nice bathroom and comfortable bed. The only drawback was the extremely loud air conditioning, which sounded like someone was driving a motorbike around inside in the room in the middle of the night

Reviews.Title: “Needs work ...”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_32066
Reviews.Content: We spent a full weekend in the hotel. It has pluses and minuses, but overall our impression was more on the negative side. On the positive side: - the location was very good - the bedding was nice - the bathroom was also reasonably nice On the negative side: - the doors have no insulation whatsoever. We could see the hallway lights under the door directly from the bed, and could hear everything - the tv did not work well, and repeated inquiries were useless - $7 for a bottle of water ? $15/day for internet access ? Most hotels include these amenities for free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, rooms a little tired and food overpriced for quality”
Reviews.Author: girl-friday2011
Reviews.Content: Lobby is lovely and grand - but this is not what continues in your rooms. The staff were helpful. Had dinner in the restaurant which was only average quality for extremely high price. The wi-fi was a complete rip off - 23 dollars for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Most exceptional customer service of any Fairmont hotel I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Yellowknifeguy
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Fairmont Copley Plaza while I was in Boston on a business trip. It was my first time visiting Boston. I am a Fairmont president's club member and have have the pleasure of staying at many Fairmont properties in Canada and the United States. I am pleased to say that this was by far the best hotel stay I have ever had. The hotel setting was amazing and the service of all the staff at the hotel was phenomenal. From the bellmen, the front desk attendants, housekeeping and food and beverage staff, I was always made to feel like a valued guest of the hotel. One night when I was dining in the Oak Bar, I asked the food and beverage manager where I could find a particular brand of cucumber vodka. Adam took the time to research the information for me and called a few liquor stores until he found a place where I could find it. Unfortunately when I took a taxi to the liquor store they were sold out. To my pleasant surprise, when I returned from my business meetings the next day, there was a bottle of vodka in my room for me. Adam had taken the time to find out another store that sold it and went out purchased a bottle for me. This was one of the many shining examples of the amazing customer services of this hotel. As a result I know that I will go back and stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay as expected, a little far from main attractions”
Reviews.Author: tangogurl
Reviews.Content: Luxury is as expected. Check-in staff and concierge were top-notch. Staff remembering check-in notes about anniversary was a plus. No coffee in room, even upon request was a let down. $10 pot of coffee is a bit steep. Could have more working plugs in this day and age. Pay for internet is a bit passe. Amenities were a bit stingy. No refills or replacement after use, even though I had stayed for 3 nights. Location is a little far from the main attractions, so you will have to take either a tour or learn to use the subway. Management handled security well despite the raucous outside from the July 4th celebrations. Express check-out was painless.

Reviews.Title: “All the right things - but at a price.”
Reviews.Author: R77556
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for our annual 4th of July tradition of seeing the Boston Pops Orchestra and fireworks dislpay on the Esplanade. We normally pick a hotel to use as a home base for the 3rd and the 4th. The Fairmont is an older hotel in a great location - the heart of Copley Square. As with most older hotels, the rooms are small. Ours was clean, a little worn but nicely appointed. It would have been the perfect size for someone travelling alone. The hotel gets very high marks for the things that I care about in a room - great bed, good water pressure in the shower, extremely courteous and helpful staff. On the "needs improvement" side, the air conditioning was almost nonexistant. I realize that it must be a nightmare to retrofit a building built in the 20's with A/C, but when it's 90 degrees and high humidity it gets pretty uncomfortable when it takes 8 hours for your room to go from 75 to 65. My biggest complaint, though, is the price. I'm not singling out the Fairmont on this. Any hotel in Boston is expensive. Even with the special internet bargain rate that I was able to get, this place was still pricey. Parking is extra, and you pay for internet (a pet peeve of mine.) If you are looking for a conveniently located high end place and are willing to pay the price ($28 for a continental breakfast - REALLY???) the Fairmont would be a good choice. If. however, you have the option af staying just outside of the city there are many less expensive places available.

Reviews.Title: “Go only for the historic feel...otherwise, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: alwaysbetraveling
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself, like Boston, is full of historic details. The lobby is lovely, with a feeling of grandeur. The staff were fine, but not overly helpful. The queen room was small, with not much space to put suitcases, or anything else. The bathroom was decent in size, but not much room to put toiletries. The shower was older, with the showerhead loose from the wall. Although one wants the "historic" feel, it just feels old overall, making it not quite comfortable. Pros: - convenient location near the Prudential Center, and Newbury Street, Boston Public Library - 2 blocks from the Back Bay station - duvet covers...no icky bed spreads! Cons: - no free wifi - small rooms - old feeling..."historic"? (thus, not feeling completely clean) I probably will choose a different hotel with more modern amenities the next time I come to Boston

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel,service could improve”
Reviews.Author: passiontravel9
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel very very grand and the rooms were really nice and as far as the location is concerned its just excellent and good as it can be.You can do all the sight seeing easily in the city from this location. In parts like for example the conceiarge service was superb,they told me routes to get to places which were not widely advertised so to their credit to go that extra mile for me to reach places by public transport. The service as far as the room servicing is concerned can improve and infact there is a communication problem for on days my room was not done even though i had informed the reception. There is a great value lunch available in the Oak Room which is nice. I will definately go back to this hotel for sure

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the historic lobby but move on”
Reviews.Author: HayOhio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I showed up a day early for a little leisure before a business conference. We checked in and quickly requested a different room as the first one was extremely musty smelling. It was on the first floor overlooking Copley Plaza. We sacrificed the view and a bit more roominess for a back hall room that smelled better on the top floor. We faced another building. Oh well. This room at least smelled like they put some type of fabric softener sheet in the vent. I suppose in a hotel of this age, maybe they can't get rid of the smells, but I don't remember the Plaza smelling like that in New York. Our new room's bathroom was the size of a closet. I'm NOT kidding. The tissue box cover was metal and sat atop the back of the toilet, which was slanted toward the bowl. So, you guessed it, the tissue box was forever falling on the toilet lid. There's no place to put your toiletries, no counter at all. The closet was so small, the two of us could not get all our clothes in it for a four day trip. Not much drawer space either. Anyway, it irks me to be asked to pay for internet access and coffee when the room rate is over $200 a night. (There is a Starbucks at the Westin across the street and a Panera .8 miles away.) The desk staff are quite inattentive. Just a so-so place for quite a pretty penny. Just enjoy a walk through the lobby, and then keep walking.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old lady, but needs renovation and make sure you have a street view.”
Reviews.Author: Melbournetraveller18
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old hotel (nearly 100 years old). In possibly the best location, close to subway stations right in city centre. Staff are friendly and helpful, nothing was too much for them. The only drawback is probably part of the attraction - the hotel is old and grand , but at the same time the rooms are old and would benefit from a full renovation. Many of the rooms face inwards, towards an inner courtyard therefore no view or sunshine, and you should ask for a sunny room facing the street. Also the hotel does not have a pool or gymn, which is a drawback for those who like a swim/train In fact there is an arrangement with local gymns/YMCA but you have to pay extra and this costly. On a positive note the rooms are quiet and private.

Reviews.Title: “Leona Helmsley would not be pleased”
Reviews.Author: LMC_Canada
Reviews.Content: This is an iconic hotel, old school charm located in downtown Boston. Staff are well trained helpful and pleasant to deal with. Our first room was large and clean, however much of the fittings were worn, surprising for a hotel of this character. No in room coffee maker and wireless internet was available throughout (not free unless you are a member of Fairmont President's Club). We later moved to the gold floor and the room was in better shape. (which included a great coffee maker). Summary: The hotel needs to throw out the old tattered linen's towels, drapes, etc. I think it is a lack of attention to detail. Somehow in an old grand hotel one might notice these imperfections more so than in a dark new sleek hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Stay”
Reviews.Author: sjf09
Reviews.Content: As a member of the Present's Club with "rewards" from the nights I stayed last year, We booked a suite for four days of dining, walking and museums.. A very large gracious space with an entry foyer, large bathroom, separate closet room and two beautiful rooms with antique and reproduction furniture from the early 20th century. We kept waiting for Teddy Roosevelt to join us. Check in and all other staff encounters were polite and professional. The location which permits easy strolling to Newbury and Commonwealth, the Commons and both the Back Bay and Beacon Hill areas is hard to beat.Thankfully, if you are looking for modern, flashy, hip and loud this will not be your cup of tea. It is not and hopefully never will be those.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: MartinMarshall
Reviews.Content: My family recently travelled to Boston for a mini vacation and to catch a Red Sox game (my daughter is a huge Red Sox fan). We decided to stay right in Boston and chose the Fairmont Copley and it was one of the best travel decisions I have ever made! The staff of this hotel were nothing short of outstanding! From the person meeting us as we drove up to the front entrance of the hotel, to the front desk staff to the concierge to the Oak Bar staff, the maid service and even the Valet's, I have never experienced this exceptional level of service in over 25 years of both business and personal travel. Do yourself a favour. If you get a chance stay in this hotel. You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “for VERY special occasions only”
Reviews.Author: fagala
Reviews.Content: We were there for a wedding (in the hotel itself). The rooms were really nothing special. Even with an event discount, a 2 night stay for 2 was close to $700.00. Parking was not included even though we were guests at the hotel. We liked the location; though if we were not there for the wedding, we would probably stayed at a hotel in a different location

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the Oak Room Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MichaelLondon_ON
Reviews.Content: During a recent stay at this hotel, at which I have stayed several times in the past, my wife and I decided to dine one evening at the Oak Room which is the main hotel restaurant. Having eaten here several times during past visits, and always to our satisfaction, this time was a disaster. The room was crowded and the wait staff was inadequate to handle the volume present. Although seated promptly, we waited for about 25 minutes before being approached by our waiter(I was just about to walk out). No greeting,just handed us menus and said something about he'll be back. He then did reappear and took our drink orders. I asked for a wine menu which did not appear. eventually he did come back for our food orders and on being asked a third time ,did bring the wine list. Asked for a particular wine and prodded by him to just give him the number. Comes back three minutes later, thrusts the wine list back at me and says pick another. No explanation. On to the meal. Ordered filet mignon at $56.00(8 oz). It finally arrives about 1/2 hour later markedly overcooked and totally dried out(obviously sitting under heat lamp for too long). My wife's salmon was also dried out. On politely inquiring as to why the food was in such poor condition, was rudley informed that the kitchen was overstressed and there had been other complaints for the same reason. Not a great explanation. This restaurant is very expensive and one expects better ; Boston has enough good restauarants which are more reasonably priced that they will not see me again. Thus an otherwise pleasant stay at the Fairmont Copley was spoiled, so much so that I will not eat in the Oak Room again, although I would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: RohitKhanna
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and the staff is attentive. Our concierge was wonderful. The room was good size but there was really no place to sit except the bed. A sofa would have been nice. The food in the restaurant and in room service was average at best and there are very few amenities. For $400/night I would think they might have a swimming pool or a spaâ€¦or even gourmet dining. The location was great, but there are other (less expensive) hotels in the same location. We will be trying one of those out next time. I would not pay more than $250/night for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine But Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Landonsholiday
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a Red Sox game and chose the Fairmont Copley because we like the brand and the price was excellent. Check in was easy, the hotel occupies a beautiful old building and the staff was friendly. We booked a room overlooking the park, which was clean and comfortable, but not all that big, and the view was urban and not all that interesting. There was an odd energy to the room and the floor, (and we felt more comfortable leaving the bathroom light on after dark!) The hotel is convenient to the Back Bay and Fenway. We had appetizers and drinks in the Oak Room which were fine, but there is much better to be found close by. In fact, we had dinner at Grill 23 which is only a couple blocks away, and which was amazing. The hotel is often a very good value, but don't set your expectations too high. It was clean, friendly, and that's about it. Be sure to double check your bill at check out.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: gumby30
Reviews.Content: We were surprised at how nice our stay was at the Copley Fairmont. The hotel staff was great from the doorman to the room service waiter. The hotel allowed us to check in early and keep our rooms a little later. The newly decorated rooms are quite nice with the largest HD TV I have experienced in a normal room. The beds are as advertised- heavenly.The location is great and the fact it is connected to one of Boston's best malls was a delight to my wife. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A reliable choice”
Reviews.Author: adevnturebound
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Labor Day weekend. Superb location, within walking distance to shopping, restaurants, etc. The staff was very professional and courteous. We were upgraded to a very large room upon arrival - no complaints there. We had a delicious breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Rooms and bathrooms are clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous Prices”
Reviews.Author: trebex
Reviews.Content: Prices are really exorbitant. And that's just for the room. A bottle of Evian water is $7. Toast on the room service menu is $6, orange juice is $7. That may be typical of this type of hotel, but it is still outrageous. If you happen to work for a company that has corporate agreement with them, prices are literally half the standard prices. If not, you are out of luck. My parents had the corporate rate, paying a whopping $200 less for a room that was twice the size of mine. I questioned at the desk why there was such a huge difference, they told me I was originally reserved for a smaller room and "If you're complaining about the size of the room, you should see the room you would've had". Great help. The staff are good a chit-chat, asking about where you're from and how the traffic was. But ask them to help you out otherwise, and get a snooty response. Really not worth the money. If you do stay, you can buy anything you need at CVS down the block and don't give the hotel any more money.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant historical hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Lvv2trvl
Reviews.Content: Great one night stay in Boston at this beautiful, historical Fairmont hotel. Easy walking distance to Newbury Street and the Copley Plaza which is an upscale mall with decent dining and tons of shopping. The concierge showed us a nice walking path to the Boston Commons visitor center where we caught up with our tour group to do the Freedom Trail. The visitor center was actually closed for renovations when we were there, but the tour guide is just outside the center and was easy to locate. The room we had was nice and spacious. We tried their room service for breakfast which was pricey, but nice and timely. It was overall a very enjoyable stay, 2 thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Mice!”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravelerExpert
Reviews.Content: I do not suggest staying here. I decided to stay here rather than the Copley Westin since I have stayed at the Kei Lani in Maui and liked it. Not this Boston Fairmont. Not a lean hotel. Saw a mouse in my room and was moved. Could NOT believe that I again saw a mouse near the elevator too...Never felt clean in this hotel. The bathrooms are TINY too. Not worth the money. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor at best!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerRI9
Reviews.Content: This hotel has gone down hill since my last visit two years ago. The service is not very good and the carpeting smells moldy in the hallways. My room had a bathroom with two swinging doors and a 1/2" opening so have fun sitting on the throne in full view! I was there for business meetings but we will not be doing this again. There are many alternatives in the area that are much nicer. The Westin is next door and better, The Lenox, The Mandarin Oriental - beautiful... all within 5 minutes walk. Stay elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Go for Gold - you won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: clubman44
Reviews.Content: On a vacation trip to Boston and New York my spouse and I spent three wonderful nights at the Fairmont Copley Plaza in Boston. We had read the reviews on the Fairmont Gold and decided that we should try it. How happy we were that we did. From the moment that we arrived on the 4th floor we were treated so well. We had booked and discharged our account in advance so as to get the best discount - $288 cost per night was worth every cent. We had requested a room with walk-in shower and on arrival the room provided did not have this facility.On seeking a change we were shown to another room and got both the shower requested and a larger room. Any request seemed to be of no problem to the receptionist on duty. I liked the brief tour of the facilty on the 4th floor public area - a kitchen with plenty of goodies, a dining area and further separate sitting areas.So, all in all it had a feeling of 'home from home' Free internet facility was helpful; just log on to one of the two stations. Breakfast was very good and being buffet type was all the more simple. The weather was cold March weather and so we had little need for copious water but bottled water and soft drinks were available all day in the kitchen. The evening canapies were more than what we expected and were a real temptation as we left each night to go to a restaurant As everything needed for hotel accomodation was provided we completed a very happy visit as we arrived - signed out in the knowledged that the cost was as already discharged; no funny 'extras'. When we return to Boston we will go for gold again!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better,,,”
Reviews.Author: tripper1964
Reviews.Content: I was booked in here for a two night business trip. Overall a nice, older hotel which had gone through a relatively new refurbishment. This seems a theme for me with Fairmonts (just stayed in the Santa Monica one two weeks ago and had the same initial impression). Most of the staff were good (maid, check-in) others were completely underwhelming - eg. disinterested / rude "In Room Dining" operator. Also, tried to go to The Oak Room for lunch - stood at the maitre de station (1.30pm on a Wednesday) for 5 minutes and no service. All fine for a 3 start but not for a 5 star. Also, was paying for the "Gold" level at around $430 per night, Can't see any value in that. The only thing "Gold" about it was the price. A pretty hotel, with a lovely ornate lobby, but not worth the money. I'm sure there must be better value in Boston

Reviews.Title: “Where everyone knows your name!”
Reviews.Author: JByrd52
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Copley Plaza staff is an outstanding array of professionals. All great you by your name with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Started with Fairmont Copley Plaza”
Reviews.Author: pmlk82212
Reviews.Content: Was visiting some universities in Boston with my daughter. The Fairmont was a great place to stay. It is centrally located, near the T, restaurants, shopping. The hotel has an old world charm. The lobby was amazing. The staff that checks you were efficient. We were early, so the bell captain held our luggage, while we explored the town. True the bathrooms are on the smaller size, but the room itself was first rate. We had requested a room with 2 double beds, but they were sold out that weekend. They brought in a roll away bed for us. The room (#144) we were given had a separate bedroom and living room. The fitness center is on the small side, but has everything you need. There is a larger gym close by, but it requires and additional fee. Our room had a view of the roof and air conditioner/heating unit, but we were not in the room except to sleep. The room is quiet and you do not hear any street noise. There are several Starbucks near by. Wi-Fi costs about $15/day, but you can avoid the charges by joining the President's Club (it's free). They have a business center that I did not use...there is a Kinko's around the corner. The bar downstairs is really old school. Please note that the hotel is currently undergoing a major renovation, however, that may work in your favor...room rates that typically run $350 or more, can be had for a much lower price. There is a wonderful laborador in the lobby, "Catie", that is available for walks and play. She is very friendly and was a former guide dog. She even has a book written about her.

Reviews.Title: “Grande looks yes, but a few too many issues”
Reviews.Author: Asta72
Reviews.Content: Rating: ItÂ´s a wonderful location, and its insides are truly grande (in a very old fashioned kind of way)! BUT service leaves a lot to be desired (especially the staff at breakfast and housekeeping in general). Plus their really shaky internet situation was a big issue for us, so the rating is a strong 3 for me. Hotel: The Fairmont Copley Plaza Hotel. It has 383 rooms and suites and was built in 1912. An important piece of fact for you people that really do your research in advance please do note that the hotel will undergo a massive renovation ($20 million) for their centennial celebration 2012!!! So maybe not a great idea to stay there until thatÂ´s done...But probably fab afterwards! It feels very large and spacious with itÂ´s grande lobby. A lot of gorgeous details everywhere such as intricatley ornate celings for instance. Location: Right smack on Copley square. It is a great location to have as a starting point for most things that go around in the city. Walking distance from super shopping (both a mall + Newbury st), the Boston Symphony Orchestra hall, a lot of churches of interest, and even more good restaurants. There are also a lot of museums (both for adults and children) within easy taxi distance. Room: We had 2 rooms, 502 which is a deluxe king room + 501 which is a deluxe double bed room for our stay. The neat thing if youÂ´re travelling as a large family is that a small child can sleep in their crib the hallway that the hotel makes out of part of the corridor! The only slightly bad thing about this solution is that the "extra" doors arenÂ´t exactly very tightly closed so there is a lot of noise/light coming from the corridor. The rooms are rather large, and very comfortable. Yes, the style is very old fashioned, so if you want mega modern and sleek then maybe the Mandarin Oriental is a better bet for you. The bed was insanely comfortable!!! We also liked the pillows and bedlinen. Storage room is adequate. The shower is located in the bathtub, and it only has a fixed showerhead, no hand held shower. These particular rooms do not face the park, so the view is of a wall. At first we were slightly disappointed at this fact... But we then thought that maybe it is actually better as the main streets outside are very busy and it doesnÂ´t look as if the windows are mega sound proofed. So something to consider! Lovely Miller Harris amenities! Service: In general good and courteous. You can tell that most of the employees are very proud to be serving their grande old dame. Especially the front desk/door men staff were lovely! Very helpful and friendly! Speaking of employees, they have a black Labrador Retriever in the lobby!!!! Her name is Catie Copley , 9 years old, and she is at work most of the time. She is a lovely and low key dog whom our 3-year old daughter adored. She is even available for walks if you wish which is a fantastic service to be providing!!! It really put a special touch on our stay to be greeted by a dog almost every day. Food: Nothing out of the ordinary. Breakfast was quite good, service nice but very much on the slow side and not always accurate. Private dining arrived almost on time, was good and we had no complaints. Dry cleaning: Nothing to remark on. It arrived before the deadline and ironed well. Internet: *Sigh* This was an nuisance... We had a lot of problems with the WiFi...It fluctuated like mad! One second we had excellent reception, the next none at all, and it continued in this fashion all of our stay making it very difficult to work in our rooms. They also charge quite a lot for it!!! So a great tip is to, for free, become a member of their Presidents Club and have it for free + a whole lot of other perks. Staff: In general very nice, courteous and helpful. Especially the reception/concierge/door men men and women very lovely! The staff donÂ´t always get things, or the right rooms, right though. Like for instance: * We asked for extra towels as the maid hadnÂ´t given us new ones in the morning one day. They brought us 2 pillows. * They tried to deliver clothes belonging to another guest. * Not sure how many times we had to ask at breakfast in order to get juice/tea/coffee to the right person and in right amounts. In fact breakfast is so slow that your tea will have gone cold before even the toast arrives. Just little things like that which makes you wonder a bit. In room dining: Nothing to remark on. Arrived almost on time and was good Gift shops: Multiple very nice upscale shops! Some gorgeous eveningwear and bags. DonÂ´t go into them expecting to get your magazine or snack fix though (which was a very nice feeling!), do that at the 24/7 CVS pharmacy across the square instead Things to do: There are a plethora of activities to do in Boston!!! We made sure that we visited their excellent Childrens Museum with our 3 year old. There is also a lovely Aquarium (make sure to go there early as it becomes crazy busy!) + the Museum of Science which was very interesting. Went to see/listen to their world class Boston Symphony Orchestra on several nights! Took lovely walks around the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “A Grande Dame”
Reviews.Author: REALGrunge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a grand old hotel that really makes you feel like you are one of the swells. The entire staff in general, and the doormen and front desk people in particular, treat you with the utmost respect and courtesy. The room that I stayed in was large and spacious and the bed was a joy to sleep in. What I really loved about this room was that it had a window that really opened! My only complaint, a minor one considering the age of the hotel (and, perhaps, that I am not used to how Bostonians heat their building?) was that the room was rather warm no matter how low I turned down the thermostat. However, it was remedied my simply opening the window. The hotel is a beautiful old classic beaux-arts building (a sister to The Plaza in NYC) with beautiful decor. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Canadel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fairmount for a wedding held at the Boston Library. The hotel was indeed very well maintained and had beautiful characteristics. The staff was efficient and I received my room with a hitch. I was very much looking forward to staying at the Fairmont based on their stellar reputation and the proximatey to dining and shopping..it was certainly geographically desireable. Her is the negative aspects of staying at the Fairmont Copley. (1) the rooms were the size of a shoe box...it had to be the smallest $250 a night room I have ever stayed in my life. In fact, it was so small that they could not even squeeze in a dresser to put our clothes away. Yes, the only place to put clothes was in a very small 3 drawer night stand......we lived out of our suitcase for 3 days. The closet was not much better, and we had a hard time hanging clothes as the safe is proped up to almost half way un the closet. (2) Our room was not cleaned for 2 days...we slept in everyday and I guess the maid service decided since we did not leave the room till 1 o'clock..it was too late for them to come. (3) this may sound somewhat trite...but, there was no coffee maker in the hotel room. I have never been to a hotel in which they did not provide this very small but important convenience. I would assume they prefer you to order a $5 cup of coffee from room service than provide their customers this convenience. When we checked out and received our car from valet, nobody helped with our lugage, but, once they saw me load the bags into the car they immediately came over for a tip...that to me was unexcusable. The breakfast was very expensive and the service in the restaurant was extremely slow. Our waiter never came over to refresh our coffee and our $25 eggs took almost 40 minutes to be served. Like I said it was a beautiful hotel and was centrally located. We know that the Farmont is a fantastic chain of resort hotels and that is why we were extremely dissapointed. Unfortunately for them...this one experience will not drive me back to that location. I go to Boston quite frequently and next time I will certainly be staying at the Lennox.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, BUT”
Reviews.Author: VTLongTimeTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is, of course, historic and beautifully maintained. The staff was overall good, but... The first night we were there, we were awakened at 3 a.m. by two men partying in the next room. We could hear every word of their loud, vulgar conversation (good thing their wives couldn't hear what they were saying about them.) We were about to call the desk when two women arrived, knocked loudly and called out "Room Service." The action started picking up and we called the front desk. Security came up and asked them to keep it quiet. Ten minutes later the sound level was back up and we called the desk again. When I asked if the parties had the room the next night, we were told they did but the hotel would be happy to move US. Seems to me they should have moved THEM. Security came up again and warned the group to keep it down. Security didn't leave this time, waited until the noise was back up and required the women to leave the hotel. Gee, I guess they really weren't room service - duh! We had not expected this kind of activity at such a classy hotel. Ruined one night's sleep, but they were quiet the following night.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff & service! Lovely dog-friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bluegrassdog
Reviews.Content: As very seasoned (and extremely fussy) travelers, we were reluctant to stay at this hotel because of our negative experience at the Royal York in Toronto. However, we were so glad we did. During breakfast on the first day there (my husband was at a conference, and I was there for pleasure), my husband commented that this is one of the best hotels we'd stayed at with respect to service. The restaurant staff went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable, without being overly doting. We loved the relaxed but professional attitudes. For the next 4 days, this was proven to be true. From the Concierge/Bell Hops/Door Staff to the Front Desk to the Restaurant/Bar to the Housekeeping, the service was exceptional. It was warm and friendly, without any of the artificial pretense in many other high-end hotels. The staff was happy to chat and be friendly, and clearly enjoyed their jobs. The room was lovely, spacious and clean (again, this is very important for us-- we are very fussy!). Even though the hotel is old, the rooms are elegantly furnished and very comfortable. The Oak Bar is among the nicest hotel bars we've ever seen. Stunning woodwork, beautifully designed, cozy, bustling, and comfortable. Most importantly, our little yellow Lab was very welcome. We travel with our dog all the time, and this was among the best dog-friendly hotel we've stayed at. Terrific stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: AmyMiddlesex
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 day break in Boston with my daughter and we stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza. We opted for the Gold floor and I can honestly say it was worth every penny. The staff, food, accomadation, in fact everything was first class. Soft drinks and breakfast are included if you book Gold which can save you quite allot of money! And we got our moneys worth! I cannot recomend this hotel highly enough. The food in the Oak room was amazing (although a little pricey and we only ate there one night!) and the staff could not do enough to ensure our every need was met. Cocktails in the bar are a must. All in all its just perfect. Minutes from shopping Mals and trains and taxis are called with a very loud whistle for you! I would stay there again in a heart beat. My bed at home is nowhere near as comfy! I plan a visit back there soon. I would highly recomend this hotel to anyone who wants a little luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service - rooms were a bit snug”
Reviews.Author: Nads82
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very classy feel and the historic architecture is worth the stay. The location is incredibly convenient to most everything. Staff were very friendly. The rooms were nice, but a bit small in terms of space. This is my second stay at this hotel and I will likely continue to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Never again. A horrible experience.”
Reviews.Author: Jhkcle1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 627. The bathroom was from the 1940's. There was no heat duct in the bathroom and the temperature was probably 60 degrees. The closet in the room was even colder. I called the management inthe morning and they sent a portable heater to the room. They said its an older building and they will be doing some remodeling. Sorry for the inconvenience was their position. When blow drying my hair, the circuit breaker blew out. 15 minutes later they reset it. Again, sorry for the inconvenience, however now I was running behind schedule. As an accomodation, they took the breakfast charge off the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely way to spend a winter weekend”
Reviews.Author: nmv712
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at this lovely hotel in late February. The staff, in all departements, was so welcoming. Including the resident dog! Our room was beautifully maintained and appointed. We enjoyed lunch upon arrival. The Oak Room is warm and inviting. The location is prefect, near public transportation, however the surrounding area offers many shops and restuarants. We ended our evening with a nightcap in the Oak Room Bar. It was lively, but we were still able to have a conversation. There was live music later in evening. Needless to say I was not ready to leave the next day. We are all ready planning another mini get away.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Whitby1964
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Copley for one night when we first arrived in Boston to commence a business trip and liked it so much we booked to stay one night at the end of our visit too. The hotel is undergoing some renovation on the front facade so the Mapquest directions from the airport, in the dark and snow, were a bit confusing as we couldn't see what we expected to but it didn't matter. From arrival we were treated beautifully and we would not hesitate to return next time we visit Boston. Lovely rooms, great internet access, good restaurant recommendations. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Feeling a bit Tired”
Reviews.Author: pm85
Reviews.Content: First - great location. You are located 1 block from Newbury avenue, for great shopping, and minutes from the Copley Mall. If you are looking for a 'Boston' experience, then you have a great location and very nice hotel. The downside - The hotel is not great for kids or for folks looking for a lot of space. The rooms are beautiful, but small and really ornate. You are across the street from the Westin and can easily enter the entire Copley system (i.e. no need to walk in the snow to reach the mall and other Copley hotels). My kids love Katie (the Copley mascot) and the great people. The gold level is very nice and the gold level concierge, breakfast, and evening cocktails are great. The rooms just feel a bit tired, so I'll probably look for other options (maybe Fairmont Battery Warf, Nine Zero on Beacon Hill, or the Intercontintental on the waterfront)

Reviews.Title: “Steeped in Tradition”
Reviews.Author: jumbos
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is gorgeous, and the rooms have an elegant charm. Our room was very clean, but the carpet had a burn mark and furniture corners were chipped. Bed was moderately comfortable and our room faced the "inner courtyard" i.e. other hotel rooms. Service was friendly and effective. Parking was $42 with off-site valet. Location was unbeatable. Overall, a pleasant experience from a charming hotel in need of an upgrade. I would not pay full price for the room based on my experience. WiFi is free if you sign up for the Fairmont President's Club

Reviews.Title: “Wedding of the Year”
Reviews.Author: hyheidi
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay and over the top wedding w/all that we had hoped for.When arriving after driving thru a snow storm for 5 hours the bell men where very friendly and helpful.Room was bigger then expected and the bed was SUPER.The bath room was new and big enough for a party. Room service was friendly and on time. The concerige Vincent was excellent.Very helpful and even walked us out to show us the stop for the Hop on Off trolley.He gave us excellent recommendations for brunch on Sunday.Wedding was a movie set in true classic style.Everyone that worked on this event should be recognized.Very impressive. Especially the wait staff....Oak bar was alot fun and the oysters the best. The Saturday brunch in the Oak Room needed more professional management. Slow and unorganized.I am guessing that there was a challenge there that am,because it did not represent the Fairmont to its best. Thank you for everything we will be back.LOCATION<LOCATION<LOCATION

Reviews.Title: “Tattered OLD world charm, unbeatable location though”
Reviews.Author: kowkowzeiss
Reviews.Content: Two nights. Hotel front entrance currently undergoing renovation. Absolute mess outside but little disruption to inner workings after hours as far as I could see, only annoyance was having to enter through side door. I did not buy the old world charm here at all. Old world charm? Try Peninsula HK, or FS Paris, or Bristol etc. This is tacky and run down. Reminds me of Claridges London before renovation. Checkin superb, professional, courteous and knowledgable. Jefferson was front staff on various occasions. This young chap should be commended. Also allowed me to get another room was not happy looking at second floor air con vent. Bed felt clean and quite comfortable. Mattress must be newer than other furnitures in the room (thank God they updated what counts...). Carpet typical patterned affair but just feels worn out... Bathroom clean. In room dining 20 minutes late, nearly missed meeting. Oak Room restaurant was good value. Great service too. If travelling alone you could do much worse than eating here. Great access to shopping with the whole Copley Square complex stone's throw away (of course you could do Westin or Marriott).

Reviews.Title: “History in the Heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: meritagebc
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel for it's location, history and elegance. The rooms were appointed in true Fairmont fashion. Fairmont President's Club amenity was a bag of the most amazing salt water taffy. I would say by far the best from Fairmont I have seen to date (great local amenity). Clean and comfy rooms - interesting city views. My love for this property really stopped at the historical aspect. I found the hotel staff with the exception of the bell staff ... to be extremely pretentious. As a tourist, I found the concierge to be unhelpful and judgemental. As the highest tier of their loyalty program, I didn't feel any love from the staff here that I am accustomed to. Rooms were charming yet lacked basic amenities such as tea and coffee. I thought that was a bit strange, as Fairmont prides itself on their teas - strange not to see it represented in the room. For the right price, I would recommend this hotel, but there are many better options in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, front desk staff was very rude”
Reviews.Author: Low09
Reviews.Content: Checked in to the hotel for our 1st anniversary. The girl checking us in was horrible, barely said 2 words to us and seemed annoyed we were bothering her. Later in the stay we over heard her saying she was transfering to a different department, no excuse to do your current job poorly. The room was clean and very nice, view was of the AC unit but didn't mind since the unit wasn't loud. Disappointed with the ala carte sunday brunch, went to another hotel for brunch instead. Room service staff was fantastic and so was the menu. Catie Copley is the most adorable dog! She is a great addition to the lobby especially if when you have Ms. Personality at the front desk. Concierge was very distracted, halfway through helping us he stopped and was getting information for someone else, we waited 5 minutes before he returned to us. The female concierge was the greatest, she deserves a raise. Doormen were very friendly and were very helpful with directions.

Reviews.Title: “A few misses but otherwise very nice.”
Reviews.Author: ctmkilday
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and our room was nice. We hung out in the Oak Bar in the evening and enjoyed the band. I ordered a gin martini which was great, but I got a ceasars salad that was unbelievably bad. My cousin ordered the lobster roll and it could not be recommended either. The next morning we went down to the lobby looking for coffee and were told that we had to go around the corner to Starbucks-it was 10 degrees out there! I also had hoped there would be a newspaper outside my room, but I had to get that at Starbucks too. For me these issues aren't deal breakers, but I was a little surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: alimanyas
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at club levels of many 5 star hotel. fairmont Copley Plaza is certainly up there. Service is fantastic, people are nice and caring. Hotel although older physically but is well maintained. Gold club levl staff are well trained and know how to traet and pamper their guests. Fitness room is smaller in size. They could use a bigger area. Bell staff and Valet Parking people are well trained. Overall we had a fantastic stay. As a matter of fact we stay there 3-4 times a year and now our neighbors are doing the same.

Reviews.Title: “There is something in it but I would prefer a modern comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Seemann11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good from the point of history, the building is old, the lobby is beautiful, great location and view (I was lucky and got a room with Plaza view). But there is nothing here, no pool, no sauna, a poor gym, no nothing. The rooms are small and definitely need a good renovation. The ventilation is bad, you can smell the restroom in the suite. It is great to come

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious old hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelers1960
Reviews.Content: There is something to be said for the charm that is radiated by those hotels that were around during WWI - the Fairmont Copley Plaza in Boston is definitely one of them. The grandeur of the lobby, tastefully decorated for christmas, is difficult to surpass. The front desk staff was first rate - helpful, polite, professional, quick, intelligent - a rarity nowadays. The room was spacious and clean, but the decor definitely tired. The tiled bathroom floor was cold and - together with the bathtub - certainly evokes memories of the first half of the last century. Yet, the shower was luxuriously strong and warm, making up for the otherwise uncozy feel of the bathroom. Two caveats: This is, as I said, an old hotel. The heating system, though thermostat controlled and very quiet, did not cope with the cold December weather. I was never able to get the temperature in my room above 69 degrees - usually it hovered around 65 degrees, with the thermostat set at 70 degrees and the fan blowing non-stop. Secondly, this hotel accepts pets, as at least one dog made it's presence known by barking day and night in one of the neighboring rooms. Not good for my allergic nose - I was congested and sneezing during my entire stay. If you are looking for an olde, historic grand hotel and don't mind a somewhat chilly, greyish-brownish room, you'll love this place. If you need top-notch luxury, this is not it. Oh, and they definitely need to get rid of those clowns (aka doormen) standing around the doors and chatting with each other while ignoring people who want to, quickly, come in from the cold and have to navigate around them. 50 % of the time I still had to open my own door since they were plain not paying attention. (Knowing Boston, they are probably unionized and related to the mayor and can't get fired).

Reviews.Title: “Superb.”
Reviews.Author: tvlohio
Reviews.Content: Stayed for almost a week in one suite and a couple of queen bed rooms - ask for the rooms overlooking Copley Square to enjoy a nice city view. The staff are superb - helpful and attentive. Although this is an historic hotel, it is extraordinarily well-maintained, and the one bedroom suites are huge. Other rooms are pretty nice sized as well. Restaurant is a bit pricey but very good. Location is excellent for tourism and business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MissyCup
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great local, beautiful and clean rooms. Friendly staff and great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A Well-Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 22Peripatetic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is typical of the Fairmont chain: A hotel run by professionals, with friendly but not intrusive staff, good food and drinks in the restaurants, and nicely decorated and clean rooms. You can walk from the hotel to the Museum of Fine Arts, Northeastern University, the Prudential Center, Symphony Hall, the Public Garden, the Common, and good shopping. If you want to go farther afield, there are T stations nearby. All in all, what an urban hotel should be: a convenient refuge when one has had enough of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: ccjhawk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a Saturday night at the Copley Plaza and were more than favorably impressed by by our experience. When making the reservation and requesting a quiet room, I mentioned that it was a special occasion...our 45th wedding anniversary. Upon checking in, we learned that we had been upgraded to a Gold room and were wished a happy anniversary by the desk clerk. That attention to detail (a box of chocolates was left in our room after dinner with an anniversary card addressed in calligraphy) as well as the expert helpfulness shown by all staff marked our entire stay. The location, the "old world" ambience", and the beautiful Oak Room restaurant are certainly pluses, but it is the impeccable, outstanding service that sets this hotel apart from others. We have stayed in many fine inns and hotels over the years and this ranks right up there amongt the top. Expensive? Yes, very...but definitely worth it for a special splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JimmyJ29
Reviews.Content: Came to this great city on a business trip and we were booked in to this great hotel. Staff are wonderful so friendly :) would recommend it to anyone..

Reviews.Title: “felt like a palace !”
Reviews.Author: saradurban
Reviews.Content: stayed with my husband for a meeting excellent location,service,ambience really enjoyed my stay very opulent interiors! staff at concierge were extremely helpful .pleasant,polite and courteous at all times realised ther were no complementary coffee/tea facilities so i requested these and was given such immediately at no cost also requested turndown service every evening and staff obliged really an exquisite hotel with outstanding service will stay here anytime and will recommend to others i rate this a 5 star if not better!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised: friendly service, good value”
Reviews.Author: smckToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: Especially after reading some of the recent reviews, our decision to book a room on the Gold floor of this Fairmont seemed misguided. In fact, we were really pleased by our experience, on all fronts. Our room was traditionally decorated, but nicely done. The concierge desk staff was friendly and helpful in terms of checking-in/out and advice. The complimentary breakfast buffet, evening hors d'ouevres and honour bar in the lounge (which includes a library, living room and dining room) were excellent value. The location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Property in Need of Renovation”
Reviews.Author: brbiii
Reviews.Content: Reserved a room on the gold floor for a four night family stay - given very postive past experiences with Fairmont Gold. Rooms were clean, large, but badly in need of renovation. Furnishings, carpeting, etc. all outdated. Air handling is poor - common room / hallway air very stale and stuffy. Lighting was somewhat dim. Service in gold lounge / desk was clearly understaffed and appalling. For a long period of time no staff was on hand to attend to guests during evening - garbage cans were overflowing, food trays hadn't been replenished, tables had not been bused, and guests were complaining to each other etc. Expected more from premium paid for a concierge floor. Lobby front desk staff was excpetionally friendly and helpful. Catie Copley (on site hotel dog) was fun draw for kids. Location great. We decided to checkout after only one night.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, all that glitters is not gold................”
Reviews.Author: Madush
Reviews.Content: We booked the fairmont gold and had high expectations. We expected the workd after a previous stay at the Fairmont Battery Wharf - one of the best rooms we have ever stayed at. the Copley got so much wrong and so little right. First, they did not have the king room that we booked and paid for on the gold floor. They were not very apologetic. they offered us a downgrade to a queen that was not eemn made up and half the size. they next offered us a non gold room, the room faced a building site with somebodt using an earth driller.......horrible. We asked to speak to the duty manager, Brigitta. They said she would call. she never did. The room we ended up with was faded glory, all the way back on the "gold" floor. Carpets had seen better days as had the plasma TV's. they say this hotel is the sister of the Plaza hotel in NY. The plaza just had $500m spent on it, they must be dreaming. This hotel does not deliver and they need to learn to better serve their guests. Avoid at all cost and choose Fairmont Battery Wharf

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable beds, a cute dog named Catie! (travel agent review)”
Reviews.Author: Jooolz1976
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I stayed at the Fairmont Copley Oct 13 - 16th/2010 We were given the deluxe room (Room 363) which was fantastic! Their restaurant the Oak Room won the best steakhouse in Boston and the bar side is absolutely stunning! Definitely pop in there for a drink! The building itself is gorgeous. Built in 1912 I believe - around there. It's right across the street from Trinity Church , the Boston Public Library, and Copley Square. The metro station is only a block away and Boston's transit system is so easy to use and cheap! The location can't be beat - you are right downtown with easy metro access to all the other touristy hot spots! It takes no time to get around in Boston - we even walked a lot of it! The metro takes you everywhere including Cambridge (great town - we got to see Harvard), the Aquarium where you can catch ferries to other places like Salem (that was a good day!), and to the airport! I was seriously impressed with their metro system. Far more superior than ours back home. If you ever need a cab those are cheap as well! It was $9 to get from Cambridge back to the hotel - not too shabby at all! If you stay here there is a good chance you'll meet the resident dog Catie Copley. She is an older black lab who has her own dog house outside and an area for her in the lobby. She is such a sweetie!! There is even a book about her that you can get in the gift shop called Catie Copley :) The room was quite large and very clean and very quiet. We had a view of the street and of the Boston Public Library. The bathroom is all marble and it's quite large. The massive giant head is great and made for wonderful good pressured showers! The beds were out of this world! They were so comfortable - it was hard to get out of them in the morning. I was tempted to steal their pillows as they were amazing (kidding, I would never steal those - but tell me where I can buy them!!) Don't fall prey to their overpriced room service menu or their Refreshment Center. Read the fine print. They charge a re-stocking fee, a tax, and a %18 percent surcharge. If you want them to take away the basket of tempting goodies they'll charge you $25 for that as well. There is a 7-11 nearby as well as many pharmacies so get you snack attacks filled up there. Consider yourself warned. All in all that was probably my favorite Fairmont stay so far - really nice hotel! I think anyone and everyone will love it! Contact me if you have questions! Thanks for reading :) Julienne

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: BondFan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a fairly central spot within easy walking distance of tram stops and shopping areas. Check in was quick and efficient. The rooms were a bit "olde worlde" for my own personal preference, as was the hotel in general, but it may be to others tastes. The room itself was clean with a new HD flatscreen TV. The bathroom was also adequate. The hotel put on food for our conference which was of a good quality - though we didn't actually eat in any of the restaurants. The gym facilities are adequate - though a bit on the small side given the size of the hotel. Although i didn't personnaly use the internet (not complementary), feedback from my colleagues suggested it was a very fast connection. Overall, a good hotel if you like period features, situated in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tedieboy
Reviews.Content: First the good points, a wonderful old building in a great location, but it's geared up for corporate & weddings, there's no where to relax as a tourist, the price's for drink & food are extortanate, they boast of the best steak house in Boston, that's ok if you want to pay $150 each for a 2 course meal and a couple of glass's of house wine (we chose not to)

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler
Reviews.Content: What's not love about this hotel?? Gorgeous, spotless room, lovely staff, fabulous location and a friendly adorable dog in the lobby. Had 2 rooms, both were great. Thanks for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Columbus5683
Reviews.Content: The Gold Floor was incredible and the Staff even more so. We were addressed by name each time we entered the lounge! The staff exceeded our every expectation -- which was quite high considering that the hotel is on the pricey side. We've traveled quite a bit and usually stay on the Gold, Club, etc. floors because of the conveniences they offer. The Copley Plaza's has been the best by far with its attention to detail and wonderful selectionof breakfast/brunch offerings, afternoon snacks, and late night deserts. WILL RETURN (in a heartbeat).

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: lbznyc603
Reviews.Content: Attended a wedding at the Fairmont and got a fairly decent rate as a wedding guest for two nights here. What an elegant hotel! Stayed in a King room and it was spacious, classy, and very comfortable. Location was great, right in Copley Square. Within walking distance to all the shops on newbury street and the prudential center shops. Oak Bar in the hotel had excellent drinks and service. Bathroom was slightly odd shaped, toilet in a weird position in the corner and two closet swing-like doors that weren't good for privacy. But aside from that, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow.”
Reviews.Author: cmcfong
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a gorgeous well maintained property in the ideal location for seeing Boston. Shopping, great restaurants and all the fun of Boston are at your doorstep. What puts this hotel over the top is service, friendly, informed and very polished. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TheBatties
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the evening on the 30th August, staying into September for a total of seven nights. And we loved it! Mr Batty and I were treating my brother and sister-in-law to this holiday as a celebratory present so we wanted something special - the Fairmont Copley Plaza certainly delivered something special. This is a truly wonderful hotel where every single person tries hard (and succeeds) to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible, and in a very friendly way. Talking of comfort, I'd have to say that the beds were probably the most comfortable beds we've ever slept in in a hotel, with 'proper' pillows :) Our room arrangements were perfect. We'd asked for adjacent rooms and we were given 501 and 502 which are at the end of a corridor with a second door, effectively making the two rooms into a suite. We all loved the Oak Bar, and it was great to relax here with a Samuel Adams after a busy day. Also loved the way they serve the martini! And what can you say about Pasquale? Bless him! He was our server when we dined in the Oak Room - what a character, oozing with old-fashioned Italian charm - he really made our evening something special. Our meal in the Oak Room, by the way, was superb as was the marvellous Amarone. As other people have already said, the location of this hotel is excellent - very handy for the Trolley Bus which stops right outside - and is great for the Prudential Centre, Newbury Street, the Copley Plaza, and all the other many attractions. And with many great restaurants within walking distance. The harbour and acquarium are very easy to get to too. We really can't dredge up anything negative to say about this hotel, however hard we try. Our stay was as wonderful as we'd hoped, if not more, and we would definitely love to stay here again (and I'm sure we will as we love Boston, and now so do my brother and my sister-in-law). The only 'bad' thing about this hotel is that it is expensive; as we had to use the telephone quite a lot we were somewhat alarmed at the $4.50 charge just to make a non-local call, likewise the charge for wi-fi in the room. Hence, I couldn't give Value a higher rating. To finish on a positive note, we'd like to thank the Fairmont Copley Plaza for such a wonderful stay and we definitely hope to be back before too long. Oh, and would someone kindly give Catie Copley a hug for me? She's so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: JenLGH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and while it was a bit of an expensive treat, it was a fantastic experience. Staff were super friendly and helpful, location was just perfect (about 10mins walk from the start of the Freedom Trail, a pleasant stroll to start the day) and the rooms were spotless and plush (although the shower looked a bit dated). The dog in reception is a nice touch that we haven't seen anywhere else, she is a docile and gorgeous rescue dog - you can even take her for a walk if you want to! The restaurant was very overpriced, so we only ate breakfast in the hotel once (the waiters were a little odd too, couldn't decide if they were being over friendly or rude and patronizing), the other days we wandered out and found cafes. Overall though, those negatives were only blips compared to the quality of the rest of the stay. We thoroughly enjoyed staying here and would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Plush hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghAnna
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Copley is situated within walking distance of Boston Common, Shopping Malls, Church, coffee houses. The service was excellent and the concierges were extremely helpful and friendly. Nothing was too much bother for them. It is quite a grand hotel with weddings and conferences a feature but this did not interfere with our stay. There are plenty of eating places close by if you don't want to use the hotel dining room. Beautiful wood pannelled bar which was a haven! Only gripe is having to pay for wi fi.

Reviews.Title: “awesome dark wood”
Reviews.Author: TonyT13
Reviews.Content: oak room full of flair from something like Casablanca

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable elegance”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiKid97
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old but has aged gracefully. We stayed on the gold (club) floor where the breakfast and refreshments were both good and plentiful. We needed two rooms so they gave us 401 and 402 which both open into the end of the hallway. There is another door that closes off the end of the hallway so we could leave both doors open. The rooms themselves were comfortable and charming. The decor is a little faded but remains tasteful. The bathrooms have the low-flow toilets that don't work very well and the shower pressure is low. The location is superb and one can easily walk to a wide variety of Boston attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Can You Top This?”
Reviews.Author: travellots747
Reviews.Content: This is one of my all time favorites. Shopping at your finger tips and the best museums are a short walk away. All the staff at the Copley are friendly and helpful. The gold floor with it's library and complementary breakfast are the best ever. This floor also offers a wide variety of extras. The Oak Room reataurant is a must if only for lunch but the dinners are to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Dame”
Reviews.Author: jerrymsf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night between connections. We had a huge room on the top [6th] floor with a king bed and large flat screen tv. Small bathroom but all the necessities and marble tile lined. Fast easy check in and out. Great location. Don't miss the Public Library across the street. Fabulous old murals. Excellant service from the bellman who told us how to ride to Quincy on the T to see the Adams homestead. Head conciege discussed the Kingston Trio and Charley on the MTA. Wife loved the the lab [Katie] as she mised our dog. All in all will go back next time we are in Boston next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Lousy Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: W_on_the_Road
Reviews.Content: Beautiful building and great location. When I booked the room, I paid a "surcharge" of $15 for a "King Bed." Turns out that's just a "request." If one's free I can have it, if it's not, I get the smaller bed.. but they DON'T refund the request fee, or whatever it is. Great location, and knowledgeble staff..
