Great restaurant and beautiful building! Small rooms, but that is Boston. I travel a lot, and am used to "nickle and diming" by big hotels -- comes with the territory. But this "room request fee" is new to me.

Reviews.Title: “Grand and unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: IneffableTX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and another couple, stayed at Fairmont Copley Plaza one night before heading to another city on business. The hotel was in a terrific location (close to Newberry Street shops and restaurants) and near a beautiful old church and the public library. The hotel itself is just grand (almost 100 years old). It's so refreshing to have a hotel that's not a chain and not like every other hotel you see. The service was good, the rooms were much larger than expected and certainly large enough, and the internet price from the hotel was very competitive for it's class and location (paid approximately $200 night). The location is also on the route of the hop on and hop off, narrated trolley tour that goes all around the city (Old Town Trolley - I think it's called). You can buy a ticket from the concierege and use it for two days, hoping on and off at sites you want to spend more time. Also included in the ticket is a harbor tour on a medium size ferry type boat. It was so enjoyable and beautiful to see the city from the water. Finally, the Oak Bar in the hotel was first class and from days gone by. Worth the high price for a drink. They had some pretty creative choices, too. This is a great place to stay for 1-2 nights to see Boston. (As an aside, the hotel has a black lab that lives in the lobby and has a dog bed and a book written about her. Very cool story.)

Reviews.Title: “An old favorite has gone downhill...”
Reviews.Author: AldenDfw
Reviews.Content: We have been going to this hotel for 30 years and had our wedding receoption here. After a lapse of 4 years we returned to a hotel with sloppy maid service, carpets and really, really overpriced room service for the quality. The exercise area lacked air conditioning durng this extremely hot week. Concierge desk slow and unhelpful. What a disappointment. With rates at $300+ for an upcomng conference, we are sure there are better options. Especially disappointed that the "Fairmont" touch seems lacking here!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - will go back!”
Reviews.Author: bedrock49
Reviews.Content: Great place - beautiful and in a great location. Jefferson is probably one of the most polite, helpful and service oriented front desk reps that I have ever encountered, what a nice guy! The fairmont Copley is honestly an amazing hotel with great history and charm. My room was clean and pretty big - so much nicer than the Westin across the street words cant describe it. If you want to go 4 star - go Fairmont. I wish I could comment on the food but I did not go to the restaurant - but it is beautiful. You will not regret your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: nmallinger
Reviews.Content: Just spent four days at the Fairmont Copley Plaza in Boston. What a fantastic hotel! The rooms were lovely, the location perfect, and the staff was the friendliest and most accommodating that I've ever come in contact with. The conciereges went out of their way to be helpful. I can't imagine staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: flickerings
Reviews.Content: Was contacted by a rude staff member because of a typo on my CC expiration date when making my reservation. Dealt with other rude employees who wouldn't even let me speak before transferring me to voicemail. Room was disappointing and the lobby smelled really bad.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Done_with_shoveling
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Copley Plaza is truly a great Boston hotel. Great history, cool old bar and yet an updated room with all the amenities you want for your stay to feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Grande hotel with lots of class, if you can afford it.”
Reviews.Author: PJGerace
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a central location and convenient to great restaurants and bars in the Back Bay area. The hotel isn't for those that want a modern hotel, but it has alot of class, charm and an "old money feel." The employees were friendly and helpful. I reserved a dining room for a party of 13 in the Wine Room portion of the Oak Room restaurant. The food was excellent and the service was unequaled at any restaurant I've ever been to. I've taken customers out to dinner dozens of times per year for the last 15 years in restaurants from San Franciso to NYC and the service at the FCP was unequaled. Gold level breakfast is superior too. Just be ready to pay for a ridiculous parking rate and a room rate that's about $100 more than popular business chains.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: pqowieuryt
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Boston Symphony suite on the Gold Floor. I got a great online price. It was worth it. I had no complaints. Professional concierges. Outstanding housekeeping. The room was very comfortable, well-decorated and well-maintained. Rooms were huge. The Gold Floor lounge is a very pleasant and handy convenience. They got the bill right! I wasn't nickled and dimed at every turn, which made me feel unthinkingly pampered. Hotels never seem to get that, but the Fairmont does, at least on the Gold Floor. Room service selection was a little limited, but not terrible and not overpriced. Plus Boston is such a great city. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classical, Elegant Hotel w/Some Minor Hiccups”
Reviews.Author: Viking78
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Fairmont Copley Plaza-Boston for a conference. As a whole, the hotel is very classical that reflects the elegance from the early 20th century. I thought the staff was very friendly--check-in and check-out were smooth, any concerns/questions were handled promptly and sufficiently. My room itself was small overall (including the bathroom; especially the closet), but had enough room to roam. The only issue was related to the air conditioner and thermostat in the room. The temperature was set as low as 40 degrees, but for some reason, the room had a very difficult time flushing out any heat and humidity. The engineering staff did their best to try to correct the situation, but with any classic building, the concern cannot always be remedied overnight. I suggested to the front desk at check-out to shut down the room for a couple days to try to get the thermostat and air conditioner back in working order. Other than being uncomfortable at times, I understand the complexity of this issue since the building I work at is over 100 years old and has no air conditioning period...just good old fans that work hard to flush out any heat/humidity depending on the air flow outside. I did not eat/drink in the hotel restaurant/bar per se, but had breakfast in a separate room with my conference acquaintances. Overall, I thought the food was very good. The hotel has a couple shops, but I did not visit them. Catie Copley was in the lobby a couple times, but was resting from the intense heat. She did seem to be visitor friendly, however. Overall, I thought the hotel was good and would recommend it to the business traveler or tourist looking for elegance. I joined the President's Club and got the complimentary internet service; and the staff members as a whole were attentive. The only amenity that I would like to see added is a pool, which plays a major factor in my hotel selection for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Old school luxury at the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: retro6
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a 4 night stay here with my husband and one year old. Impressive reception area lead to high expectations...unfortunately we found the room quite cramped by the time we got the travel cot in. Also, room service and breakfast in the Famous Oakroom was overly expensive. On the upside, we really liked the traditional style and feel to the place. It felt like the couples and families we met here had been coming back for years. In terms of location, it was perfect for us- close enough to nice shops and restaurants on Newbury street and great shopping in Copley Place and the Prudential centre.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a quiet, comfortable, quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bartonfields
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for the start of of our USA and Canada tour, it is ideally situated on the edge of the city center area, so only a 5 min walk to Boston common. We were traveling to NYC by train, so it was perfect with the train station just around the corner too. Only one minor criticism, house keeping managed to "throw away" some expensive skin cream I bought for the trip !?

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Henryboy
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to the Boston area, and this is the first time I have stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza. Yes, it is beauftiful when you arrive, but the first words out of the valet's mouth were Yeah, that will be $42 a night to take your car. Really!? I travel a lot..and that price is outrageous..especially since I was staying with a rate of $167.00 a night...it does add up! I was greeted by a wonderful staff, and when I arrived in my room, I found they put me in a room that was for handicap acess, which I did not request or need. I could not hang up my clothes in the closet due to the bar being low, and the shower was for wheelchair access...great for a wheel chair,but for me, it was water all over the floor! I also went to grab a robe...which was well worn, almost threadbare, with lipstick on it from the last guest....even the towels were thin and needed replacement. I proceeded to log onto my computer to finish some work, and I was forced to pay $14.00 for 24 hour access!! Really.????.even the small inexpensive hotels never charge....I was shocked..in all my travels I have never had to pay! Then when I went down to the business center to print out my boarding pass for the next day flight...I had to swipe a credit card to use the computer! I feel like I was nickel and dimed to excess...and when I came back from breakfast my room had been cleaned..there was no fresh tolietries...and the water glass I had by the bed the night before was still there, and the ice bucket was left with the melted ice, and the top on the floor!! Yeah...great attention to detail for a luxury hotel! I have always stayed at the Back Bay Hotel down the street, but was lured by the $40 price difference...which as you can read was sucked up by valet and internet access in no time..never again will I stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on a prime location”
Reviews.Author: Maria55113
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Fairmont Copley Plaza Boston. My previous was in Jan. 2009. Both experiences had been very positive. I loved their friendly staff rarely found on deluxe hotels. My queen bedded room was perfect for me, lovely furnishings. I enjoyed the large mirrors on the closet's doors and the plush robes/ towels. Being my second stay I did not have to pack my own toiletries knowing their Miller Harris toiletries were there, waiting for me :-) (You can purchase them at their gift shop) The restaurant service was very good and so the room service. Food was excellent on both sites. I truly like the hotel location. Concierge service was great and I loved the restaurant suggestion. If you have walking issues ask for a room near the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class & Central”
Reviews.Author: BullitU_k
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Boston for 2 nights whilst on a road trip and rate this hotel as one of the best, front desk were excellent and attentive & went out of their way due to the room allocated being not quite ready for us & offering us a very welcome complimentary bar drink, would most definately rebook if I visited Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Always top notch!”
Reviews.Author: vanderluyden
Reviews.Content: It was my fourth time back at this hotel (gold floor, the best!) and every time it surprises me with its excellence! The room was pure luxury, with all the state of the art facilities, food was really good from breakfast to evening canapÃ©s and I really appreciate the all day coffee and cookies available. But what makes the real difference are the amazing people who work there, They remember you after months, they greet you, welcome you back and help you out in any way they can making your stay an unforgettable one with the perfect mix of luxury and warmth. I was travelling solo and they made me feel at home, thanks to you all.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: bzita22_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Grand elegant hotel, the entrance hall is stunning, spacious rooms, excellent location, good service, no complaints. It is an excellent place to stay when visiting Boston. If you want to have breakfast, book a package because prices are high when you have to order separately at the Oak room. If not, we had an excellent breakfast at Trident Bookshop and Cafe nearby (it is 3 blocks though). We had our foldable bikes with us which was very convenient and the concierge was very helpful with storing them every evening. Parking is pricey... 42$ a night for Valet parking. The house dog, Catie Copley, added extra charm to our stay and our daughters really enjoyed that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TVNewsRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for hip and trendy, this hotel is NOT for you. It is instead a classic hotel that sends you back in time with its elegance and charm. I stayed here for about a week for work and did not want to leave. The rooms are comfortable, clean and the service is fantastic. I normally find room service to be bland, but the room service here was sublime (tho a bit pricey!). If you're up early, try their oatmeal!

Reviews.Title: “Very posh but worth the money?”
Reviews.Author: spireman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights prior to cruising up to Canada. What kind of hotel in America doesn't have complimentary tea and coffee making facilities? Unless you want to pay room service prices you must trawl downstairs to make one yourself in a plastic cup and then trawl all the way back upstairs to the room. A very expensive hotel and certainly not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, good location, loved the breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: Ludovica40
Reviews.Content: I stayed a few days on a business trip. Good Hotel in a good location. Large room and bathroom (although with no great views). Loved the breakfast room in old Bostonian style. Wood everywhere, quiet and relaxing. Wonderful eggs and attention to dietary needs. The hotel bar is also very pleasant. I would definately choose this hotel again for another visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Rude”
Reviews.Author: northgoddess88
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my friends for my birthday. We were five girls who put in the extra effort to make sure we didn't stand out but because we were young almost all the employees were rude and unwelcoming to us. We were waiting in the Oak Room Bar for 20 minutes while the servers and managers looked us over and checked and rechecked our legal id's. They took so long that we took it upon ourselves to take our business elsewhere.Reception wasn't very helpful either, they made us seem like a burden to them. In fact, the only polite people in the hotel were the doormen, valet, and the maintenance man who fixed our broken shower. Over all the hotel is beautiful and the rooms were well kept but the lack of hospitality of the staff is a real turn off especially if you are paying that much for a room. I will never return to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was a beautiful hotel in the old style”
Reviews.Author: jelly17
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this nicely kept up hotel that has not been modernized to death but is stately and beautiful. They even have a dog to greet you. One thing however...for a luxurious hotel they nickel and dime you for computer access. 14.00/day for room use. Then I wanted to print out my airline pass but forgot my password and they wanted me to swipe my credit card so I could get onto the internet to retrieve it. No I couldn;t use any of the hotel computers etc...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value and very comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: DLS69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont last weekend (21st to the 24th) with my wife and infant son. Very easy check-in; upgraded to a King room from a Queen room with no hassles. The room was very spacious, clean and a crib had already been brought to the room for our convenience. During our three day stay, we found the staff to be very helpful, courteous and always available to assist; in particular the concierge, room service and cleaning staff. We have been to Boston numerous times and have stayed mainly at the Lenox, however, no rooms were available this weekend so we thought we would give the Fairmont a try and we were not disappointed. To be frank, I have read some of less than positive reviews of this hotel and emphatically disagree with their review. This elegant hotel is in a great location, has excellent staff and the rooms are spacious, quiet and clean (what more could you ask for?). We didn't eat in the dining room but our room service food (presumably from the Oak room) was excellent. No complaints whatsoever, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Boston and wishing to stay in the Back Bay area. Forgot to mention......the beds are very comfortable!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flunie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 days with teenage son recently. It is very well located in central Copley square, only 1 block each from both the Green and Orange lines of the "T". I should add that the subway is the best way to get around Boston. Anyone willing to compete with the aggressive drivers is nuts. The hotel is old and ornate, with a beautiful lobby, but it's aging and the Deluxe room we had was a little tired and faded. The bathroom was small with a door that would not fully close and the walk in closet had a defective light that they could not fix. The hotel was busy and noisy with lots going on like meetings, proms, etc. so be prepared. I also thought the staff, particularly the concierges were not that friendly or extremely helpful. The hotel has one very formal restaurant and no casual coffee shop, so we ended up having breakfast at a Starbucks on the corner. Bottom line: We paid a discounted corporate rate so I was happy with the value received. But I would fell differently if I had paid the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I have come to expect from a Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: newengland10
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel online, reserved and confirmed a King Deluxe room. We've stayed at this hotel before and know that these rooms are quite nice. Greeted with a smile by desk clerk, who handed us keys. When we got to the room, it was very small with one queen bed. Went back to front desk, spoke to a different clerk who told us there were no king deluxe rooms available. No explanation or apology for why we were not told that the room we'd reserved was unavailable upon initial check in. He offered us free breakfast if we'd just stay in the standard queen at the same price for the king we'd reserved. Meanwhile, I was eavesdropping on the conversation the first clerk was having with another guest, who wanted a room change due to loud AC unit. She offered to show this guest a different KING SIZE room which was available at the other end of the hall from her original room. Clerk said he might have a king for us, but would have to check with his manager. We asked him to please check, but suddently he simply produced a set of keys to a deluxe king room. This was a nice room, but it was a handicapped room. No mention of this fact by the desk clerk. Did he think perhaps we wouldn't notice? The shower has no lip or edge, the water simply drains into the middle of the bathroom floor. I prefer a tub and shower, but was not inclined to complain until I realized that we had been given only two towels. Yes, two. If I need to wipe up the bathroom floor after using the shower, then I need more towels. Bottom line, we felt we had not been dealt with fairly. Honesty really is the best policy. If the clerk had explained when we first checked in that there were no king deluxe rooms, offered an apology plus a discount to the going rate for the room they wanted us to take, we wouldn't have been so annoyed. This is classic bait and switch, which feels out of character for the Fairmont Copley. We spoke to a manager who did apologize and offer a free stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: LozzM
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be comfortable , and the staff very friendly -The Bar had a really good atmosphere although a bit on the pricy side.

Reviews.Title: “Underpar service for busy business traveller, very limited room service”
Reviews.Author: NomadicNina
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times and most recently in March, 2010; I love the location. but I would not stay here again---there is absolutely no room service in the wee hours, and I am a business traveller that is ready for my coffee at 5am. I am a woman who does not want to traipse the streets at that hour. I spoke with the front desk and eamailed cusotmer service but for two months my comments have been ignored. I was with male colleagues who also wanted late night food, and were equally dis-ssatisfied. If this hotel wants to attract busy business travellers, they need to modify its in room- dining to 24/7 like all other top notch hotel programs.

Reviews.Title: “Loveable but flawed”
Reviews.Author: happycamperNewYork
Reviews.Content: It is easy to love this hotel, from the excellent location, delicious food, glorious public spaces and gracious staff. The staff did a good job of providing free bottled water and keeping guests informed during the recent water crisis in Boston. But I soon grew tired of the peeling wallpaper in my bathroom and the lack of soundproofing in general. One can hear every sound that comes from neighboring rooms and from the hallways in particular. There were only two hangers for women's clothing in the clost and one hanger was broken. Shame on guest services. And guests should not have to move furniture to find an electrical outlet but that's what is required to charge your lap-top, etc. The outlet in the bathroom is positioned too close to the ornately framed mirror. Watch out for the layer of dust while you crawl around under your desk.

Reviews.Title: “A must if you're staying in Boston”
Reviews.Author: MSkinner
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Boston (did the Marathon) and stayed for 5 nights at the Fairmont Copley Plaza. Cannot say enough good things about it. First, if you plan on running the marathon next year, do what you can to stay in this area - and the Fairmont, in particular. It's 50 yards from the finish line, it's where they hold the press conferences, the awards, etc. It puts you right in the heart of the marathon action. Even if you're not doing the marathon, this is a great place to stay to see Boston. It's location is just perfect. Just steps away from 2 different subway lines, within walking distance of the Hynes convention centre, Fenway, the original Cheers, excellent shopping, fabulous restaurants, etc, etc. It's just not the location - the hotel itself is excellent. Staff are great (thanks Jim Carrey the concierge for great Sox tickets at face value!), the restaurant / bar serves some incredible food & drink, and the hotel is steeped in history & luxury. I think I saw somewhere it's a 4 star, but I would be surprised at that - we've had the pleasure to stay at some of the nicest hotels in the world, and this is a 5 star all the way. The only drawback we could comment on were the rooms, and I hate to even put it in a negative light. They are a little small for what we're used to and the walls are definitely a little on the thin side (but the bathroom area is great and the bed is extremely comfortable). But, you have to remember, this hotel was built 88 years ago, so smaller rooms and thin walls are something you just have to expect and deal with. One last thing, when you go, be sure to give Caitlin Copley a scratch behind the ears. She's a gorgeous black lab that stays at the hotel by the concierge. You can sign up to take her for a walk, if you want. Other than that, Boston was amazing. It was our first time there. The people were great, there was always something to do and see, and we can't wait to go back. And when we do, we're at the Fairmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous historic property with miles of charm”
Reviews.Author: Catbody
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two days for a conference which was also held at the hotel. The lobby, restaurant, and ballrooms are astonishingly beautiful with all the details original to the 1912 building intact. My room was enormous with a lovely grey and red marble bath. The staff were unfailingly nice (although were a bit distracted in the restaurant) and I was charmed by many of the thoughtful details; for example, there's a hotel mascot, Catie Copley, a black lab and you can arrange with the concierge to take her for her evening walk. The fitness center is small but adequate and you can arrange to use two larger gyms in the area for a small daily fee. The room service menu is better than most and breakfasts are very tasty and the room they're served in is not to be missed. The hotel is located close to charming Newbury street with its many shops and restaurants and there's a park with a small lake just a 5 minute walk away. I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the solo Boston Marathon traveller”
Reviews.Author: FrqntTrvllr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while in town to run the Boston Marathon. Since I was a single woman staying alone, I thought I'd splurge and stay at a high-end hotel. It was the best decision I could make! The hotel is breathtaking- I know Fairmont's usually are, but this one stood out, perhaps because it was in such a picturesque city. Furthermore, the hotel was perfectly located in Copley Square- literally steps away from the marathon bus pick-up, finish line, the expo, the green line subway (which connects to the airport blue line), downtown Boston, and the various night-life on Boylston Street. My room was rather tiny, but it was a 'singles' room so that was too be expected. Service was great. The only complaint I have about this hotel, and this is my complaint everytime I stay at a Fairmont, is the internet. You'd think if you're spending a premium to stay there, the price would include free wi-fi or at least free business centre usage.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning, beautiful hotel with great service!!”
Reviews.Author: BlessingsWisconsin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely loved the historical looking hotel, great attention to detail with great service. We stayed on the Fairmont Gold level. I am so glad that we upgraded because it was well worth it. The staff there were great and friendly from the housekeeping, waiters, doormens, front desk (gold level) supervisors Brad and Sara...Thank you so much for excellent service. Oh...the Oak Room was fantastic...the food was wonderful as well as the service (absolutely 5 stars service in my book)!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, with a feeling of home”
Reviews.Author: shabone
Reviews.Content: My stay on the Fairmont Gold floor at the Copley Plaza was incredible relaxing. The warm, inviting lounge and attentive, caring staff made for a wonderful luxury experience with a homey feel. The staff prepared for my visit well before I arrived, making learning a new city exciting and easy. Their recommendations never failed. The room was beautiful and the bed, one of the most comfortable I've ever sleep in. The decor suited this old, iconic hotel. I felt like I was living in a piece of history. Fairmont Gold has a feeling of Four Seasons meets Cheers. It has all the perks of luxury, with quality customer service, but made me feel like Iâ€™d gone home.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, historic hotel, but double check your credit card statement”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltheworld
Reviews.Content: We stay at Fairmonts frequently and chose to stay at The Fairmont Copley Plaza for a mini holiday weekend. The exterior and lobby of the building are beautiful. Built in 1912, the hotel retains its historic charm. It is in a perfect location for those exploring Boston. The front desk staff was warm and friendly at check-in. Being President's Club members, we were upgraded to the JFK Suite. Pictures of the Kennedy family graced the walls and books on their lives filled the bookshelves. This room would appeal to any history buff. The location of the room was also a plus; being a corner suite, it had windows facing Copley Plaza in the living room and bedroom, as well as window onto Dartmouth Street with a view of the Boston Library. The room was beautiful with a lovely entryway, living room and bedroom. I loved the marble fireplace and big, original windows. The bathroom however definitely needed updating. (E.g. The pipe leading ot the showerhead had tape on it to prevent leaking. It didn't work.) Also, the carpet looked like it needed a thorough cleaning but had not had one in years. Here's where the real trouble started... In the morning, we went down to the Oak Room for breakfast (part of our weekend package.) Although there was a buffet provided we were told by 3 people (waiter, host and woman at the front desk) that we could instead chose to order anything from the menu. We had 2 (mid-priced) breakfasts, coffee for me, juice for him and a side of berries. Everything was delicious and we checked out happy with a nice stay. A few days later however, we checked our credit card statement and saw $100+charge from the Fairmont on top of our room charge. The customer service rep we spoke with told us that we had a maximum of $70 to spend on breakfast and we went over. (Um, shouldn't there be a $30 charge on the bill then?!) We relayed the information we had received from 3 different people at the hotel and she took the charge off. There was a second erroneous charge on our bill as well! We were charged for items from the mini-bar. (Neither of us even touched the $7 water bottles on the desk nor did we see a mini-bar in the room!) Both errors were fixed, but only because WE caught in the error in the first place and spent 40 minutes on the phone with customer service. Ugh. The hotel is beautiful, but the erroneous credit card charges were ridiculous. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Copley Square if not all of Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: jjw36
Reviews.Content: I just finished a 12 month consulting assignment in Boston and the Fairmont Copley Plaza had been my home for the last six of those twelve months. Previously, I stayed at just about every other hotel in Boston including the Westin, Marriott, Back Bay Hotel, Sheraton and Hyatt. My only regret is that I did not begin my stay at the Fairmont Copley Plaza sooner. The hotel is very historic and incorporates its history throughout, unlike the other chain hotels where the rooms and common areas look very similar from city to city. The guest rooms are very clean and well appointed and the Fairmont bed is one of the most comfortable beds that I have ever slept on. Beyond the accommodations, the staff at The Copley Plaza is the best I have ever experienced. The people behind the front desk, concierge, and door men all go out of their way to make you feel welcome and make your stay as enjoyable as possible. Lastly, the historic Oak Bar and Oak Room are one of the treasures of the hotel. Martiniâ€™s are served in a carafe of ice and draft beerâ€™s are served with a warm soft pretzel. Overall, I recommend any trip to Boston include staying at the Fairmont Copley Plaza and I look forward to the opportunity to visit the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: SteveJames15
Reviews.Content: As you enter through the main doors you are greeted by the doorman who welcomes you, as you enter you are met by a 40 foot hall covered with chandeliers, very impressive. The receptionist could not do enough to ensure we where welcomed to the hotel, we had a complimentary upgrade as it was my partners birthday. We were on the second floor, the room is very spacious with a queen size bed, a beautiful marbled bathroom, a 32 inch LCD television, and a walk-in wardrobe with a built-in safe. The room also has the minibar which was well stocked but unfortunately was very expensive for example a bottle of water with the equivalent of five pounds. The only downside, was that you could hear guests returning to their rooms, this was very noisy, and we got woken most nights. In the hotel lobby was the restaurant, I'd definitely recommend the stake and I would say that this was quite expensive at about Â£30, I think our total bill came to just over Â£100 for two drinks and two meals. The hotel staff were extremely helpful, definitely ask the concierge for help when looking for a restaurant or somewhere to go in the evening. On our last night we went to Grill at 23 this supposed to be one of the best steak houses in Boston unfortunately our experience was one of extreme disappointment. The quality of the food for such a high end restaurant was unbelievably poor and even after complaining the best they could do was to tell us that they would not charge us, if you are looking for a good steak I would suggest you stay in a hotel and go to the Oak bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Trakstar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ver nice in a great location. The hotel has the old look grand look to it. It's very neat. The rooms are a little small but they were nice. Flat screen TV with decent size bathroom. The front desk staff was excellent. They were so nice. The women that worked back there were so courteous and helpful. Gave great recommendations of where to go eat. Though the breakfast is a bit stiff if you do the buffett. I'd go around the corner to the Starbucks and grab something there. The hotel dog was awesome. I have never seen a hotel dog before. It was so cute. It was a black lab and just sat there in the lobby. So well behaved. It's great to see something different. The dog even had it's own kid's book and scrap book. Pretty neat. But overall the hotel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it so much, Im going back again!”
Reviews.Author: scottishgirl21
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Copley in September 09 as part of my birthday weekend. Firstly the only and I mean only negative thing I have to say was the location of our room. We did ask for a room away from the cleaning area etc and we ended up flat bang straight across from it. When we told reception they were prepared to move us immediately but we couldnt be bothered packing up and moving so we stayed. The cleaning people were slightly quieter in the mornings after that, I say slightly! Our room was so spacious and the views were great too. I liked the fact I could open the windows and let the lovely breeze and sunshine in! The staff at the hotel were very very nice - our concierge being exceptionally friend. We liked the idea of the hotel looking very posh and swish, but they had room for the hotel dog at the reception. Nice touch. Dont listen to people who moan about this hotel being stuffy etc. Its not like that at all. I will no doubt reconfirm this when I get from my weekend away this coming weekend. Watch this space!!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: dwrenth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a wonderful weekend in Boston. Although the weather was rainy, we had the most incredible time at the Fairmont Copley Plaza Hotel, aptly known as Boston's "Grande Dame." We were greeted by a professional and friendly front desk staff who wanted to make sure we had everything we needed for a pleasant stay. Each staff member we encountered during our stay, whether in the restaurant or lounge, on the elevator or simply walking by in the hallway, greeted us warmly. We travel quite a bit, both for business and pleasure, and found the staff at the Fairmont Copley Plaza to really go the extra mile in how they treat their guests. Each time we've stayed there, our accommodations have been outstanding. The rooms are well-appointed with beautiful furnishings and well-stocked toiletries. Just walking through the lobby area is a treat with murals, chandeliers, and incredible architecture all around. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Aging Giant”
Reviews.Author: twohappytravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copley Plaza for a medical meeting last fall. It has a beautiful lobby and guest services were okay for restaurants reservations, tours, etc. The room was clean, but very small. The bathroom was ridiculously small with a toilet on an angle which made it difficult to find at night! The TV remote didn't work as well as the TV. There was no internet service in the room, either wireless or ethernet. Everyone was in the lobby trying find a place to sit to use their computers. We were there for five uncomfortable nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: philaveller
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable stay at the Fairmont Copley Plaza. We booked a Deluxe King Room, which was actually quite big.. the room only, not the bathroom! The bathroom was one of the smallest I have ever experienced. There was only one sink, the toilet was squashed into a corner which hardly allowed you to sit on it properly. There was no space to leave your amenities, we actually had to store them outside the bathroom. The water of the shower had to run for around 2mins before it got warm. But the room was nice and big, very comfortable bed, good entertainment TV and comfy chairs to relax. The whole room as well as the whole hotel are in the old traditional style, which we really like. Try out the Oak Room for breakfast or even for a steak, it has charm. The location of the hotel is right at Copley Square, right where all the upmarket shops and restaurants are. It can't be any better. The staff was friendly and helpful. If we ever go back to Boston, we will stay at the Fairmont Copley Plaza again!

Reviews.Title: “Good 'ole hotel, great location, cute dog”
Reviews.Author: Ramatash
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Copley is one of those grade old hotels that every big city has. The rooms are a little small, but they've been renovated with the expected amenities. I had a 'larger' room that was still on the small side. So make sure you try to upgrade to get a decent sized room, but this is often the case with big city old hotels. The location can't be beat. i'd stay here over the newer Westin, Marriott or Sheraton in the area. The service was a little under par for a Fairmont. But the Fairmont Copley has something that no other hotel in the area has - the beautiful dog (black lab) who hangs out in the lobby to greet guests - what a sweet dog.

Reviews.Title: “Classic flower, showing signs of wilting.”
Reviews.Author: Larryort
Reviews.Content: Starting off, this historic hotel is still impressive when you arrive at first. Beautiful exterior and lobby, elegant (if not a bit cramped) wood-paneled elevators, and the Oak Room restaurant that wreaks "old money". We got an upgrade to a Deluxe room which was around 400 sq ft (quite roomy). We noticed though that the bathroom was quite small given the rooms size, but that wasn't a big issue for us, although it might be for larger people. I was a bit surprised though at the details, ie. the shower curtain was old, and cheap (out of place for the marble bathroom), the shower was low flow so I never really felt like it did anything (Seinfeld anyone?), the room still seemed to have its original fixtures from 1912 (doors and chandelier). The closet door didn't even close completely. Don't get me wrong, the room was very clean and the bed was sumptuous, but overall it seemed like it was overdue for a refurb. Flat screen TV was fine and there was sufficient drawer space for a short stay (lacking for one longer than 3 days). Staff were all great. Kudos to Dragana (PM Concierge) and Mitchell (? AM Concierge) for their fine recommendations. Check-in and out were swift and efficient with a smile. As for the I read about the additional charges, the property is not geared for the budget minded traveler. It's a full service business hotel where you're getting prime location, amenities and service. Quick tip- If you're not keen on paying the $40 day parking, there is a garage at 100 Clarendon (the next block directly behind the hotel) that offers a $27 day rate if you show them a copy of your hotel bill when you take the car out. All in all we had a great stay and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't, if you're the one paying.”
Reviews.Author: KenLee38
Reviews.Content: Reserved through 1800hotels, got a good rate, and probably a larger room than we had actually paid for -- birthday trip. After that, the watchword was "Their hand in your pocket, constantly." Had we been eating at their Oak room [very pricey] from outside, the in-advance coat check was $2. Internet was $13.95/day. The mini-bar and a snacks tray were well stocked, with anticipated prices, PLUS tax, PLUS a 10% restocking charge. The feeling everywhere was that the welcome was extended to one's wallet. For a hotel in a chain with world-wide presence, the over-all feeling was not world-class. Not a big thing, but decor seemed more nouveau riche than elegant or classic. Overall, far more pleased with the Mandarin in Kuala Lumpur, and the Jefferson in Richmond. Would not go back to Copley Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: sholland9409
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a night stay here for my Birthday. We were able to take our puppy which was so great. The hotel staff were all amazing and very helpful. Our room was beautiful. A nice mix of old world charm and newer ammenities. I loved the chandelier in the room. The bed was so very comfortable as well. There was a wedding going on that evening so we brought a glass of wine down to the elaborate lobby area and had a nice time people watching while waiting for our dinner reservation at the Oak Room. I cant forget to also mention Catie the black lab that is famous at the Fairmont. She is such a sweetheart and our dog loved playing with her. Great location as it was only a few blocks from Newbury Street and also right across the street from the Pru. The only negative I have to mention is the noise from people in the hall until 4am. We were on the same floor as wedding goers so that was not so fun.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel - so-so staff”
Reviews.Author: jaimeeg
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed five nights at the Fairmont Copley Plaza while in Boston for a conference. We arrived very late at night due to airport delays, and our check-in was efficient. Sarah was the desk clerk working when we arrived, and she was very friendly and accomodating. When I got to my room, I was pleasantly surprised to see the size and decor. Unfortunately, I was given a handicapped accessible room with a big walk-in shower and no bathtub. I phoned downstairs to inquire about the possibility of switching rooms, and this was done within 10 minutes. I was moved to a room that had a seperate sitting area and bedroom. It was nice enough, but the bedroom area felt a bit closed in, with the bed facing a wall. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated, but they are definitely not luxurious and show some signs of age. For example, the door frames in my room had some paint chipping off, and the carpeting in the bedroom area was showing signs of wear and tear. The rooms do not have coffee pots, and I discovered the next morning that getting coffee in the hotel is not easy. They put out complimentary coffee near the restaurant, but that doesn't start until 6:30. When I asked the desk clerk about getting a cup of coffee earlier, she told me that I could either wait until 6:30 or I was welcome to walk across the street to Starbucks. Most of the staff I encountered at this hotel were less than friendly. I noticed that if you engaged them and tried to start a conversation, they would respond. But, I feel that few, if any, went out of their way to be friendly first. The concierge, Jim, was one of the most unfriendly people I encountered during the stay. When I would ask him questions, I felt as if it was really bothering him to have to answer me. Another concierge (John, I believe?) was very nice and friendly. The doormen were nice, again if you spoke to them first, but none went out of their way to be friendly. Overall, the hotel is beautiful on the exterior and quite pretty inside. It's centrally located and easy to get to most anything. The staff seem to feel that they are there for some other reason besides customer service, and I felt this was a serious flaw for an otherwise nice enough hotel. I would most likely choose another hotel if I were to go back to Boston. I guess I am a bit simpler and would rather stay somewhere with a friendly staff and easier access to coffe in the morning - yes, coffee is very important to me in the morning!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VacaRae
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very elegant New England/ Boston feel to it. I have been to two weddings at this hotel over the past two years and each time I've been there it's been elegant and luxurious. The service here is excellent and food is great. We stayed in the Boston Symphony Orchestra suite and thought the room was spacious and gorgeous although the bathroom was on the smaller side (typical of an older hotel). I was in the Presidential Suite as well with the bridal party and that room was ENORMOUS and BEAUTIFUL... The only thing that we got a good laugh at was that Gorbachov (sp) used to stay in that room too :). The hotel is in a great location a block from Newbury Street and a short walk to Boston Common. In terms of luxury hotels in Boston I personally prefer the Four Seasons but the Fairmont Copley wins the award for old world charm.

Reviews.Title: “If you want an elegant Boston experience”
Reviews.Author: meredithj
Reviews.Content: This is a top of the line hotel- the staff was there to cater to you. The main entrance and lobby is beautiful as are the hall wyas on each floor. Our Standard room was small, but with all of the beautiful furnishings, it was very cozy. I can't imagine having a bad view out the window in any room as this is PRIME location for shopping, food, and events (just walk across the street for Copley Square).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rrobinhhalk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference, the staff were amazing. The rooms are very clean and quite large for Boston accomadations. Beds were comfortable and bathrooms were spotless. This is not a new modern hotel though.. it's Boston old school with modern updates to the rooms. Great location. If you have the time and money this is a great place to spend it.

Reviews.Title: “Did I stay at a Fairmont?”
Reviews.Author: theresorttraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not what I had expected. When you enter the lobby it is not bad but avoid going into your room. The room had a very strong odor coming from the hall and the room was horrible. The doors in the whole room were cracked and rusted. The bathroom had many problems as well, there was gum on the floor and there was a ton of mold. If you take a shower it will take an hour just to rinse off the soap. The water preesure was very low and the shower head looked like it was supposed to be in a motel than a four star hotel. The location is pretty good but other than that this hotel is not good.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service and room”
Reviews.Author: twingris
Reviews.Content: my family stayed here for one night after our ski trip to stowe vt we really enjoyed our stay in the fairmont gold room we had booked from the moment we pulled up at the door the staff were professional and friendly our car was wisked away by the doorman and we went up to the fourth floor gold check in we were given a tour of the fairmont gold area which is stunning with a library and lounge area with a roaring fire also a kitchen with free canapes and coffee soft drinks ect the room was great too and our bags arrived within minutes . next morning was suprised to be greeted in the main lobby with a "good morning mr harding "..which made us all smile . they kept the car all day while we visited the city and when we returned at five the car was out front waiting all the cases had been packed inside .and we where all set .as they say..wonderfull stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: scoremedia
Reviews.Content: In the course of covering the Winter Classic at Fenway Park, we chose the Fairmont Copley Plaza over the Westin, the hotel designated for media and are so grateful we did. We were fortunate enough to enjoy the concierge service of Fairmont Gold and our every request was granted quickly and pleasantly. Can't say enough about the customer service for all facets of the hotel and the almost 100 year old building is kept in an immaculate state. Indeed, the Fairmont Copley Plaza is our only choice for future stays in Boston and should be on every traveler's short list.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel which lives up to its history”
Reviews.Author: GeoffB
Reviews.Content: We couldn't fault any aspect of our stay. Stayed in a Gold Suite, which was huge, and had a great view of Copley Square.Staff were without fail friendly, courteous and professional. Enjoyed a wonderful breakfast in the Oak Room, where again the staff were most welcoming. We have now stayed in a number of historic Fairmont hotels, and we love them - they do a great job of retaining the ambience of the building, and upholding old-fashioned standrads of service, whilst offering all the comforts one would expect in a luxury hotel in the 21st Century. A difficult balance to achieve.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded all expectations - Gold staff & concierge, amenities, cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: person1Boston_MA
Reviews.Content: Title says it all - sincere thanks for an over the top outstanding experience in every way! Staff had a "whatever it takes" attitude with a genuine interest in making our experience top notch. Coined a new word - Braditude...Brad (concierge) is a true asset to the Fairmont family. Enjoyed the tasty appetizers and hearty breakfast, well appointed lounge and sitting rooms, games, internet access and spacious room. Very convenient location. Clean and well kept. Would do it again in a heartbeat - a great value for the $!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay --- with a couple of 'nits”
Reviews.Author: Puttyj_9
Reviews.Content: First, the good. The Hotel is absolutely beautiful, and was done up in its usual Christmas splendor. The front desk, valet, room service and housekeeping were superb. On Christmas Eve, we had a light dinner at the Oak Bar before heading to Services at The Trinity Church -- the bar was busy, so that should be taken into consideration, but we felt we were rudely treated by our waiter. It put a damper on an otherwise beautiful stay. The only other issue was that we really missed a coffee maker in our room --- Room service for a Pot of Coffee was very expensive. We will stay again, because the overall experience was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel; exceptionally rude staff”
Reviews.Author: SBrantley
Reviews.Content: The title of my review says it all. This is a beautiful, grand old hotel. It's very impressive. The rooms were large and very clean. Beautiful marble in the bathroom. Flat screen tvs, internet hook-ups. Lots of charm. And then you go into the lobby and have to deal with a) someone at the front desk or b) someone in the Oak Room Bar. Rude, snotty, sullen and downright nasty about sums it up. Neither my husband nor I could believe that such a beautiful "grand dame" of a hotel has a staff as rude as the conglomeration of thugs at the Fairmont Copley Plaza. Not sure what's going on there but, if not for the staff, this place would be a home run.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chi_54
Reviews.Content: In terms of location, the Copley Plaza is in the perfect spot. This is especially true in the summer when there are summer markets in the square. The hotel has nice rooms and is reminiscent of a time that has past (although the rooms have all been updated and are complete with modern amenities). This is particularly true in the lobby as well as the Oak Room. While the hotel is very nice, I would not go so far to say it is anything out of this world (hence the 4/5 stars). However, if friends were going to Boston, I'd definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grande old hotel in great shape”
Reviews.Author: travelsavant
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Copley Plaza is a beautiful old hotel that is kept in very good condition. Stunning lobby and the room I was in on Gold floor was great: very large, lovely furnishings, beautiful bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: NYGirl37
Reviews.Content: This hotel harkens back to days of elegant travel and sophisticated service. To my surprise I was "upgraded" to the Gold level which has a separate check in on the 4th floor. My room was VERY tastefully decorated, but as the hotel is quite old, the rooms are small. The bed was one of the most comfortable that I've ever slept in, however, the room temperature climbed during the night to 75, even though I adjusted the thermostat numerous times to 66. I opened the bathroom window and resolved the heat issue. The 4th floor lounge is wonderful - the complimentary snacks/offerings are worth the price of my room ($289.00 per night). The lounge honor bar was fairly impressive as well. Aside from the free snacks and inexpensive booze I loved the SERVICE. Everyone greets you in such a friendly manner, it makes you want to slow down and soak it all up.

Reviews.Title: “It may be good enough for the Labrador but...”
Reviews.Author: Britontherails
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a good location in the wonderful city of Boston. It is over-decorated in the public rooms to the extreme (which I happened to enjoy for the camp value) and the general appearance of the place is good. My room was very comfortable. Good quality linen on the bed, nice bathroom. Ipod dock. More comfortable than many hotel rooms. But it was also very small, which I didn't like - especially as a business traveller spending more time in the room than I would if I were on holiday. The cable was useless too - with very limited channel selection. All this would have been fine but what really left me annoyed was the desk staff. They were hopeless. Very young, and clearly in need of training (they mastered 'Hello Mr ____' whenever I walked by, a curious feature of upper level American hotels which always leaves me unnerved - what's wrong with 'sir'?). I checked in at about 5pm only to be told that my room wasn't ready and I'd have to wait an hour. This is pretty poor form for 5pm by which time the rooms should really have been turned around - especially with a check in time of 3pm advertised. Did they offer me a free drink in the bar with a newspaper whilst I waited? Somewhere to sit? (bear in mind it was FREEZING outside) Anything at all? Nope. Even the worst B&B in the world would give you a cup of tea and the local paper rather than send you out onto the streets. I returned in an hour and the room STILL wasn't ready. So I waited in the lobby on a chair, still not being offered any apology or refreshment, but able to make eyes at 'Catie Copley' the hotel's 'Canine Ambassador' (that's Boston soi-disant-posh for 'dog'). I was clearly considered a huge annoyance for arriving at 5pm - two hours after my paid for room was meant to be available to me. All I wanted was a shower and a gin. Eventually I got my room, but there was a difficulty with payment as it was meant to be handled from the UK by my office. We had failed to send things through properly. Fine, I put the deposit on my card and waited for payment to come through from London. This caused all manner of problems - I had a form faxed through to the hotel. They didn't get it. They said they didn't have it at the desk. I could SEE IT WITH MY OWN TWO EYES FROM IN FRONT OF THE DESK. They still maintained it wasn't there and refused to let me point out to them where it was. Eventually after having finally communicated its location they were able to process things, but it was like something from a 60s farce. Admittedly there was lots of stuff going on at the desk and the duty manager was stressed (which she seemed to blame on me) but really! I am unfailingly polite to hotel staff. I know that often if something is wrong it's not their fault. And it wasn't. Fairmont clearly haven't spent the money to train their staff in any level of crisis management - or they haven't employed people with enough experience to work at a managerial level. The upshot? When you have this many headaches to deal with you suddenly realise, that the gym is rubbish, there's no sauna/steam room (pretty standard in 'luxury' hotels now), the public areas amount to an overdecorated lobby, the breakfast costs $30, and the internet is so expensive that you need to take out a mortgage in order to use it. When all these add up you think, 'yes the shampoo is worth nicking and the sheets are made of natural fibres, but why am I here?'

Reviews.Title: “Great Concerge!”
Reviews.Author: kenken2190
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is just awsome. Like Plaza Hotel in NY. Not modern but this is historical building.. Room 623 on the corner of the top level (6th) was special room namely, Science Musium Suite. They are kindly upgraded my collegue's room and the view from the window was so nice. Moreover, Concerge staff Vincent was so nice and he is the man!! You should ask anything to him! He may look like a kind of machine attitude but so quick and efficient. Japanese Restaurant Oishi was also awsome! Thanks Vincent!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and charming Bostonian hotel”
Reviews.Author: scubadoll
Reviews.Content: Coming from Arizona, I loved the charm of this old hotel with its beautiful lobby full of carved gold moulding, big mirrored doors, and even the darling dog that greets you at the concierge! The room itself was rather small with a very small window that opened over the busy streets of Boston. However, it was clean and the bed was nice. What I particularly liked was the location. Copley Plaza offers a very extended mall that even has an enclosed bridge to cross over to another mall. If you are an avid shopper as myself, you will love this mall....everything from Barneys to Neimans. Wear comfy shoes as it is A LOT of walking. We had an amazing meal at the Oak Room as well. I was in awe of the dark wood that had extensive carvings throughout. Excellent service, live music and martinis. For 3 adults and 1 child our bill was $500 but well worth it. If you don't want to spend that, at least sit and have a nice cocktail in the bar. I really felt like I was in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: tomtravel
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive staying here after reading some of the reviews on Tripadvisor. I used Priceline to secure a room at a really good rate. To my surprise, the room was really nice and seemed to have been recently freshened. Everything was clean, well maintained, quiet and attractive. The room is a little small, and the bathroom even smaller, but for the rate I paid.....I feel it was a good value. There was no view, but I expected that up front. The hotel is from a bygone era. The public spaces and the rooms are very grand. Every staff member was very friendly and helpful. The location cant be beat, close to all kinds of shopping and entertainment. We had wine in the Oak Room, which was great. I feel the prices were not too bad for a hotel of this caliber. All in all....I would come back to the Fiarmont.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amazing Amazing Service!”
Reviews.Author: Abbey1980
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff knew my sister and I were checking in early. (Our flight arrived at 9 AM and the hotel check-in wasn't until 3 PM). Unfortunately, our room wasnt ready for us, but we never felt like we were put out in any way. The staff was incredibly nice, professional, and bent over backwards for us. The concierge gave us free trolly passes ($75 value) and coupons to enjoy throughout the city. We loved seeing Catie Copley, the canine ambassador, she was so sweet. After we were able to check into our room we casually mentioned that we were heading to the red sox game that evening, but first we wanted to take a nap. About an hour before game-time we received a knock on the door. They brought us a fresh plate of fruit to much on while we were getting ready for the baseball game! The staff member even mentioned that they were hoping we'd be up from our nap! As you can imagine I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Boston. The memories we have of that ONE day supercede the rest of our vacation. Thank you Fairmont Copley!

Reviews.Title: “BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: yorkie90
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and enjoyed the hotel very much . It was as I expected well run , staff superb untill breakfast .the breakfast would not be served in a 2*hotel ,we had to ask for everything eg my wife asked for bacon and toast, dry toast arrived followed by cold bacon asked for butter . I asked for fried eggs well done ,2 runny cold eggs were presented .Coffee was rationed ,we were made feel as though the staff could not be bothered except for the60dollar bill which came with the eggs. that said Iwould stay again but eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great locale”
Reviews.Author: Anniekn
Reviews.Content: While in the Boston area visiting family, I treated my mom and I to a fancy hotel on our last two nights' stay. The Copley was an elegant, older hotel and really felt like a special experience. The service was amazingly friendly and prompt. We arrived in Boston early, way before check in time, and the front desk took my cell phone # to call us when the room would be ready. In the meantime, we stashed our bags and set out on foot, headed through the the Public Garden, Fanueil Hall and wound up in the North End where we had an amazing (and cheap!) Italian lunch at a charming place called Bella Vista. We took the "T" back to Copley, it was all extremely easy and convenient - the Fairmont is in a nice location. The hotel room itself was great - super comfy beds, nice linens and very roomy. The marble bathroom was enormous. One thing I have to mention is the room service, which we ordered a couple of times. I've never stayed at a place where the room service was so prompt! Our food at the Copley was awesome, fresh and nicely presented, and not horrendously expensive (the creamless tomato soup is exquisite). My one complaint (minor) about the hotel is that the walls might be a tad thin and we were treated to the squealing, screeching kids next door, who were probably extremely loud anyway. Didn't hear any other noise from other rooms/guests during the rest of the stay. Also, it's a little dark - small windows and not a lot of natural light, but that's hardly a deal breaker in my book. It is also a very expensive hotel - but that's just what hotels are in a large city like Boston. I felt like the service, the ambiance, the overall comfort of the rooms and the location of the property was well worth the price. (One other great tip - if you desperately need an Internet fix and don't want to pay the wireless charges at the hotel, Boston Public Library is across the street and offers "express" computers with Internet access for 15 minutes at a pop.)

Reviews.Title: “Squanders great potential”
Reviews.Author: AdaminDC
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Copley Plaza has a charming, historic building with attractive common areas and an ideal location. If the owners/managers put some money/effort into the hotel -- particularly the guest rooms -- it could be great. Alas, no. The rooms do not feel luxurious, they feel dated and in need of renovation. A good deal of noise can be heard even in interior rooms due to thin walls and guest room doors that slam loudly. Service is very uneven, ranging from extremely helpful to utterly indifferent. Significant refurbishment and some sorting out of staff are needed. As it is, there are better choices at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “"Throw-back" hotel offers charm but also aged facilities”
Reviews.Author: Rock_of_Boston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a couple nights during the first week in September. We had the following observations: -The lobby and facilities are charming and have an elgance of another era (the "guilded age"). -The rooms were relatively small and the bathroom old, but overall the room was nice. We liked the flat screen HD TV and also the air conditioning (which was both effective and quiet). -We also note that the hotel's location is premium - right near Trinity Church and the Boston Public Library in Copley Square. Despite the fact that this is a very noisy area (in terms of traffic), we had a very quiet room. If you are noise sensitive, request an interior room. You will not have a great view but will have a tranquil setting. -The restaurant, The Oak Room, is also elegant but quite expensive. We did not eat there, but it has a good reputation. Many people like to go there for cocktails. -There was some problems with our key being de-magnetized due to the fact that we place it in the same pocket with our cell phone. We understand this is a common occurrence with their key system. -I would point out that we obtained the room from PriceLine, which allowed us to stay for only $119 per night, an unusually low price even during the week (we were there on a Tuesday and Wednesday night). We think the hotel might not be worth paying full retail, which is $280 to $400 per night. This was for a room with a queen size bed - it would have cost us another $30 per night for a king size bed. -We also want to say that the bedding is very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Harvard CMES should use Westin or Marriot”
Reviews.Author: conjuror88
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Copley's location is great and accessible to food, shopping and the airport. The hotel is old and is badly in need of an upgrade/renovation. It is too bad Harvard always used them instead of the Westin or Marriot which is just beside, and newer.Front desk staff is aloof to requests and checking in the room is always delayed in the numerous times I have been there (8) this year. The last stay I was moved 4 times, the first room had dirty toilets; second was noisy from the construction; 3rd was at the very end of the hotel and the aircon/toilet was defective and finally we got a decent room. Cleaning staff is very helpful the front desk should take lessons from them in customer interaction. Being a Fairmont President's club member does not help in terms of being able to check in early, better rooms and the like you would expect from a hotel of this stature.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning but could use some fine-tuning on service.”
Reviews.Author: agapes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 2 friends for an all Girls Weekend. We were able to get a really good deal at $130 a night through a promotion from work (plus valet @ $42/night). For that price I wouldnâ€™t think twice about staying here again, however there were a few issues we had. There were 3 of us staying in a room with a king size bed and at check in they offered to bring up a cot with no extra charge. We checked in around 6PM, by 10PM we had to call the front desk and ask if they were bringing it up because it still wasnâ€™t there. I also called a few days before to request a mini fridge, when we arrived it wasnâ€™t there. On the second day they didnâ€™t really clean our room, they gave us fresh glasses and soap but they didnâ€™t make the beds, change our towels, etc. Again, we had to call the front desk to ask them to come back. To be honest, all these things didnâ€™t really bother us, we were there to have fun and it wasnâ€™t a big deal, but I can see how paying $230 a night and getting service like this would be a little annoying. On a positive note tho, the staff was incredibly friendly, the hotel was beautiful inside and out and most importantly, the location was perfect. We were able to do a great walking tour of downtown Boston, starting at the Trinity Church, which was right across the street, through the Boston Common, up Beacon Hill, through Quincy Market and eventually making our way to the North End for some great Italian food & pastries. Overall, I was quite pleased, and as mentioned, I would stay here again but Iâ€™m not sure if I would pay more than I did.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, except for the Oak Bar service”
Reviews.Author: on_cape
Reviews.Content: It seems as though there is a continuing theme of this property. It is very good overall with the majority of the staff achieving expectations. And then you have the Oak Bar...poor, poor service. The waitstaff seemed as though they really didn't want to be there and they were just going through the motions! If I were the general manager of this property, I would really look into this continuing theme of poor service in this one area of my property. It is great in every other aspect and it's too bad the one part can ruin it for the rest of the great employees.

Reviews.Title: “great location classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ritchieFlintshire
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights as a fairmont gold guest.what an experience for an extra $100 a night.absolutely amazing .the whole 4th floor given over to gold with its own check in ,lounge,breakfast room and enough gorgeous hors d'ouvres in the evening there was no need to go for a meal if you didn't want to.the personal attention was wonderful and we felt like film stars.fab location on copley square next to the hancock sky scraper so impossible to get lost anywhere in town.great city super attractions(old ironsides excepted #they ought to go to bristol uk to see ss great britain to see how it should be done).we especially enjoyed the beacon hill area almost devoid of tourists but a lovely part of town.thanks brad you and the team were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with lovely decor and good service.”
Reviews.Author: Ishapupper
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Fairmont Copley Plaza. With the exception of a check in person who was quite snooty (perhaps she was having a bad day?) and misinformed about our reservation (she insisted we had been upgraded which was news to us since we had purchased a Deluxe room) the staff were wonderful. The black lab "living" in the lobby is an interesting touch. As mentioned, we had a "Deluxe" room which was large, and elegantly appointed. Although the room was on the 2nd floor and right off the elevators (I think the nasty girl at the check in counter purposely put us as close to the street and the elevators as possible) there was virtually no noise coming in the room. Concierge and doormen were great, but service at the Oak Room bar in the hotel (which was close to empty at the time we were there) was very slow. The Back Bay neighbourhood is great - but so were all of the Boston neighbourhoods we visited during our four day stay. What a great city! We were a short walk from one of the remaining Filene's Basement stores but I was very disappointed. Instead of the amazing one of a kind bargains I expect from there, it has turned into a duplicate of Marshalls. And Salem? Oh my. Reminded us of that awful Clifton Hill street at Niagara Falls. Bunch of tourist garbage, but without anything spectacular like the Falls to make the trip worthwhile. Ferry ride over to Salem and back was nice though. Food in Boston is OK - great Italian restaurants in the North end - but mostly seems to be restaurant chains or places catering to the student crowd.

Reviews.Title: “I would do the same trip over again!”
Reviews.Author: travellover1006
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay with the Fairmont Copley Plaza. We checked in quick and easy, and had a fabulously large room (609). It accommodated our family of 4 very comfortably. We had a tray of cookies and strawberries left on the desk, but it was not for us. I assume it was for the previous guest from the day before, but they immediately came up, removed it and replaced it with our own snack and water. The children got to walk the hotel dog (Catie Copley), which was one of the highlights of the trip. The hotel was in a wonderful location (back bay) off of the windy water, but among great restaurants, a park and great shopping. We learned to use the T the first day, and the T stop was right by the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel and location for visitors to Boston. It's just so easy to get around the city wherever you are staying, but the Fairmont Copley Plaza adds a high class element to the trip!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic business experience...”
Reviews.Author: mcd802
Reviews.Content: From top to bottom, this hotel is the perfect location for conventions. Ideally placed, grand, and more than hospitable for not only transient guests but for the business world as well. I recommend this hotel for either.

Reviews.Title: “The classiest place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: stephenodonnell
Reviews.Content: I spent a month in Boston with my family. Me on business, them on holiday. We spent the first part of the holiday at the Liberty (very good) but it wasn't until we got to the Fairmont Copley Plaza that it all came together. Copley Plaza is the best located hotel in Boston - deep in the middle of everything. The ambience is fantastic. Old world charm. Brilliant (stunning) service. The Oak Room is legendary - cocktails like no other, and the best steak I have ever eaten anywhere. Yes the hotel is almost 100 years old (opened in 1912) but it has such deeply imbedded class that this just shines through. I am a real Fairmont fan anyway but the Copley Plaza just reinforced that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service Indifferent, Rooms Tired”
Reviews.Author: Sungirlxxxx
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Got a decent rate using a friends and family code. Check-in: Staff not pleasant or welcoming. Rather indifferent and cold.In fact only the doormen were pleasant. Room was on the third floor, but adjoining to rooms on either side, so not ideal. I suspect becos of the cheaper rate(which was still far more than other 4*stars in the area) we were put in this room. The person on one side was obviously a night owl and then the traffic and trucks etc started early on the Sat. morning so we slept poorly. Room service: Ridiculously expensive,.Quite frankly it was appalling and a rip off. We knew before we ordered what the prices were, but when one orders croissants(2 in an order), one does NOT expect to be sent 2 mini croissants, literally about an inch and a half long and half an inch wide. 2 teas, 1 order of croIssants and 1 order of English muffins was $35. I did not object to paying as I did not want to trek to a coffee shop , but this was just disgusting. There is bagel place across Copley Square and an Au Bon Pain nearby so for the next to days we went out for breakfast. needless to say for a 1/3 of the price we had way more food. Lobby is gorgeous, however rooms are rather tired and dated. Carpet musty . Paint peeling in places. Baseboards need a good wipedown. Bathroom: Large, but balloon valences in a sheer fabric and that do not close fully are Not suitable, especially when you are on a lower floor. Hopefully noone got a birds eye view . Tiling was kinda weird and not co-ordinated which also hinted that this was possibly a sub standard room. I cannot imagine anyone paying full price for it. Bathroom had ample towels, soaps etc. Room also had an iron/ironing board. Room safe. Free internet if you are a PC member, which we are. I have stayed in other Fairmonts, Banff, Lake Louise, Jasper, Bermuda and this was our worst experience. The tacky room service breakfast is enough to make me opt for another brand in future.The grand foyer, lovely old building and location is not enough for me to recommend this hotel Choose the Marriott, Sheraton or Hilton just up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Majestic”
Reviews.Author: madmaxmaniac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more like a palace than a hotel. The rooms were very well appointed and tidy. We stayed for three nights and the staff were more than willing to recommend things to do, see, and places to eat. It is a bit on the expensive side, but given that Boston is the most expensive city in the US, it is expected at any hotel. Perfect location for any tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to have a wedding”
Reviews.Author: Curdie
Reviews.Content: We held our wedding here last year. It is such a beautiful place to have a wedding. The pictures you see on their website are real--the function rooms really look like that, beautiful, opulent, like a fairy tale. We had an hors d'oeuvres reception in the Venetian room, which then opened into the Oval room, where we had dinner. We took pictures in their grand lobby, and most of the guests stayed at the hotel as well, as they offered us very good rates (almost 1/2 the usual rate). Another friend got married at the Grand Ballroom, which is like a scene out of "Beauty and the Beast", but the room was far too big for us. The food was good at the wedding, and the service was excellent. We asked them to raise the temperature of the room (b/c it was January), so everyone (mostly from out of state/country) was warm and cosy. The wedding coordinator was OK--she did everything we asked her to, and didn't miss anything, but she was so difficult to contact while we were planning the wedding. It seems she is overworked and has too many weddings/events to coordinate, but the least we expect from a wedding coordinator is that she reply to emails in a timely manner, which she does not. We stayed at a suite, which was grand, large, and very comfortable. I especially like the large closets, the fluffy bathrobes, slippers, and the good quality soaps and shampoos (with cotton balls, and all amenities) in the bathroom. All the other guests seemed to enjoy their room too. For tourists, this hotel is centrally located in the heart of Boston, and is walking distance to lots of food, shopping, and sights. It's also right near a T stop (public transportation). We really enjoyed this hotel. It has such character and charm, and is so luxurious. They even have a dog in the lobby that you can pet and take out for walks. How can that get any better?

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: JamesII
Reviews.Content: This is one great hotel. My wife and i stayed here from August 5-10, 2009 and I cannot tell you enough about how great this place and these folks were to us.
