The first nights we stayed we were in just a standard room (which was spectacular by the way) and we then moved into the Gold Room on the 4th floor (which is well worst the upgarde I tell you). THis hotel is fantastic and the location cannot be beat. The staff are friendly and unfailingly polite. You are steps from Trinity Church and Boston Public Library. The Beantown Trolley stops at the side door. You are steps away from a branch of the Legal Seafood Restaurant chain. This is a great hotel in a fantastic city. Go!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Gold Level”
Reviews.Author: fundatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting the Boston area with our two teenage girls. We reserved a gold level double/double and we could not have been happier. Check in on the fourth floor was terrific. The young man who checked us in sat down with us in the lounge with a local map and gave us tips on sights to see and transportation. Our room was gorgeous and spotless. The room was very large with a small but well equiped bathroom. The location of the hotel on Copley Square was perfect with lots to see within walking distance and easy access to the "T". The only small snafu occurred when we were informed that the green initiative which would allow us to park our Prius for free at the hotel has been discontinued as of August 1. Tamara, the manager on duty, remedied this situation and we were not charged for parking. The breakfasts on the gold level were unsurpassed in my many years of "club level" travel. The quality and variety of the breakfast foods was outstanding from yummy yogurt parfaits to the fresh salmon. The club level employees exhibited some of the best customer service skills I have ever experienced. If you love old world luxury and outstanding customer service, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Lies”
Reviews.Author: Mblaca
Reviews.Content: Book into the Fairmont Copley Plaza at your own peril. As I have stayed at this hotel many times before, it saddens me to write this review. But after being so audaciously lied to by the manager, I have no choice. My son and I attempted the check in in the early afternoon. I knew it was early and fully expected to have to leave our bags with the bellman and come back later to get our room. Instead, we were told that the hotel was already fully booked for the evening and we were offered the alternative of the Fairmont on the Boston Harbor, several miles away. (Why they thought that would be acceptable to a party booking into Copley Square is beyond me and shows the compete ignorance of the management, but thatâ€™s a side issue.) Iâ€™ve been â€œwalkedâ€� by hotels before. Itâ€™s usually late at night when the hotel has filled up with new arrivals â€“ which is no less pleasant, but at least understandable. As it was early afternoon I told the manager that I did not believe that they had not one single open room. She said they had none and that they expected only three more check-ins that day, all of whom would be walked. This was absurd â€“ what hotel in a major city has only four check-ins a day? But hereâ€™s the punch line. Another party arrived behind us. The manager shooed them over to a private part of the desk and checked them in! So much for no rooms at the inn! Lord knows how many others were checked in after we left â€“ I bet at least a dozen. Why my prepaid reservation was not honored I do not know, but it was not because they had no available rooms. When the property manager lies so blatantly about a simple matter like being overbooked, it makes one wonder what other deceits are being made to paying guests. Bottom line â€“ this was classy hotel in a great location. While itâ€™s still in a great location, the most generous thing to be said about its management is that they lie to their patrons. Why, I do not know. Yes, after protest, they put us up at a hotel nearby and got our luggage and car there too. But I didnâ€™t pre-pay for a reservation at the Fairmont in order to be lied to and walked. Next time Iâ€™ll just book into the lovely hotel they sent me to and forget about this once great Boston hotel. PS â€“ The bellman was the only sympathetic soul in the house. He single handedly made sure that our bags and vehicle found their way to our new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful 20th Anniversary visit”
Reviews.Author: dttclayton
Reviews.Content: This is an extraordinary hotel. It is not only beautiful and exquisite in it's design and interior, the service is the best ever! We arrived early, but not a problem. We were upgraded to Gold that gave us a superior King room with many, many amenities. The attention to service and care was impeccable. We were treated like a VIP. The room was wonderful and the bed was the greatest! Location was the best around. We could walk most anywhere and if we wanted to go farther, we took the subway. Thank you so very much, Fairmont Copley staff, for a wonderful 20th Anniversary visit. We recommend this gorgeous hotel to everyone who enjoys a luxurious and restful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but this hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: TeddyBTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights from Friday to Monday. Arrived hotel at about 11:35AM and room was not ready. Returned at about 2PM and was assigned a room. Booked a deluxe room which is about 100 sq. ft. bigger than than the standard room. This hotel is 100 years old and although it has obviously been updated over time, it is showing it's age such as the noisy air conditioner and small closet. The bathroom is small too. Amenities of this high 4 star hotel are surprisingly basic. There is no coffee making machine in the room and also has no free Internet access. Even the 2-star HI Express has those. The bathroom amenities are limited to the standard shower gel, shampoo and conditioner. My room and furnishing were otherwise in satisfactory condition. Sound insulation was not very good and you can hear people walking pass. Room service for a continental breakfast is US$21 plus US$4.50 "delivery charge". This is the first time that I saw a "delivery charge" for room service. Staff were generally friendly and helpful. My room has only one tiny window, probably reflective of the design of the era when the hotel was built. The location of this hotel is directly across from Copley Square and is 5 minutes' walk to the Copley T station and 10 minutes to the Prudential Shopping Centre. However, I think the Westin and the Mandarin Orient are superior by their connected walkway to the Prudential Centre which is helpful in foul weather. Valet parking is US$42 per night but there is a public parking garage immediately behind the hotel. All in all, this is an okay hotel if you find a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel-great breakfast & evening snacks”
Reviews.Author: grabec
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. The rooms were spacious, great maid service and best of all......great breakfast and evening snacks. Every day was something different and most unusual. Beautifully presented and really good. The last day we were there I think they changed their coffee paper cups from large to small, however, only complaint. Very centrally located and the concierges were awesome. I would recommend this place highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: AllyL
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Boston many times but usually stay at the Lenox. This time we booked this trip through a price comparison site as we were also going to Cape Cod for a week and this hotel was on as a special deal. I knew that it was in a great location and the reviews were quite good. When we booked we knew that it was just a standard room and expected it to be quite small. When we got there the receptionist told us that we had been upgraded to a king size room which was a great surprise. The room was huge with a big bathroom and one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in but the best thing about this hotel was the service which was excellent. Everyone was really friendly and nothing was a bother even when my husband locked us out of the bathroom at 11.30pm. Plently restaurants nearby. Trinity Church on the door step.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our high expectations in every way! Lovely Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: ohrcllc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one of the most special birthdays I have ever had. We called while driving into Boston to see if it was possible to check in early, and was greeted by a cheerful professional who typed a few things and then said, "Your rooms are ready Mrs.____. Happy Birthday." That was about 1pm. Then they were able to accommodate our preference for rooms when we arrived. To have that upgrade, they made us comfortable in our childrens' room ( a very nice room), and had ours ready and directly across the hall (simply lovely room) by the time we returned from a walk around back bay. Moments after we went to our room, champagne (and sparkling water in case we were not drinkers) and fresh fruit arrived at our door with a birthday card and a gracious gentleman delivering the tray. Every person with whom we interacted was a professional who took pride in surprising and delighting guests. They all had a wonderful way of being there with exactly what would make the moment special, at just the right moment, without being even slightly obtrusive. Excellence in service that surpasses what we have experienced in any of our favorite hotels. The rooms were comfortable with great attention to detail (beautiful architectural details,very comfortable beds, an iron-- finally a luxury hotel that let's me chose if I would like to refresh my own blouse, cozy robes, dimmers on the chandelier, a charging port...). I haven't been able to put my finger on what is different here. All of the things I have listed, we've experienced other places, but this was more special. It is formal and relaxed at the same time. No trace of stuffiness, which was refreshing, but every detail is lovely. The location, by the way, is perfect as well. This is a place you can count on for a memorable and enjoyable celebration.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - if not for housekepping”
Reviews.Author: Infiniti
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Copley Plaza is in the middle of -you guessed it- the Copley square area of Boston, probably Boston's nicest neighborhood. We choose it not only for its' location but because this legend was by far the most affordable upscale hotel in the area (even booking through their website) We thought the deal we got might have been too good to be true and that they would park us in some third-rate dingy room or something, but that couldn't be further from the truth... From the moment you step out of the taxi you feel like royalty, starting with the friendly doormen, and the lobby was the most ornate I had ever seen. Check in was friendly and efficient. We had orignally booked two rooms, but we could only realize if we needed both when we got to Boston. We explained the circumstances to the clerk and she was happy to cancel one room despite the 24-hour cancellation policy. Even the hallways of the hotel was something special, keeping with the huge and ornate theme. Now in most hotels, when you enter your room, you enter in a narrow corridor with the bathroom on one side and the closet on the other. Not so with this hotel. Here, the space that the bathroom and closet would normally take up is freed up since they're both moved to the side of the room, thus creating a 'standard' room that is in reality like the 'deluxe' rooms of other hotel chains. Of course, all the furnishings were beautiful and the bed was extra-comfy. As an added bonus, in addition to the compuslory collection of dowdy lamps, there was a realy nice functional chandelier as the main source of light! The bathroom was a bit tight, but was extra-modern and had a wall of storage cubbies. However the bathroom was also where our main complaint stemmed from - the housekeeping. The first warning sign was a collection of long hairs left by a previous guest on the bath mat. But then, as our stay went on, toilitries would not get replinished our would just sometimes disappear! One evening we arrived at the hotel to find our toilet paper had been taken away and not replaced. While the housekeeping issue was quite annoying and unexpected of a major hotel, given how amazing the rest of the stay was I am more than happy to give this fine historic establishment a 5 and I would recommend it to anyone staying in Boston for any purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BiscuitSlough
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza for 3 nights from 8th July 2009. Very nice hotel and well located. Stayed in Room 136 on 1st floor. The only problem with this room was that it backed onto the generator at the back of the hotel and made a terrible noise. We did ask reception to be moved to be told that each room faced the same way (which was not true). However, we stayed in the room and funnily enough either got used to the noise or just didn't notice it after the first night, so if you do go make sure you ask whether the room is at the back where the generator is. Overall the room, service, cleanliness etc could not be faulted. Did not eat at the hotel as lots of eating places around. Hotel right next to Trinity Church and the Library. If you do visit Boston, the two things you must do is the Duck Tour which lasts one and a half hours and is very enjoyable and informative. This costs 60 Dollars. The other thing is the unofficial Harvard University Tour which is done by students of the University. Again great fun and very informative. A tip is usually given of 10 dollars per person at the end of the tour. Quincy market is the place to hang out during the day and at night where there is the famous food court, street performers, shopping etc. Find Filenes Department Store for discounted designer shopping, it's a must and also visit Little Italy. We visited firstly during the day which was very quiet but a very different story at night (absolutely heaving with people) there are 184 Italian restaurants to choose from. We ate at Piccola Venezia but be warned the portions were huge. Also very beautiful is the public garden which is on the back of Boston Common, both must be strolled through. All in all a great city break. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but just a tad off.”
Reviews.Author: Bruinsguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont for several days during our transition from one condo to another here in town. The hotel is in a central location. Easy reach of the T... Or just walk to where you need to go. My partner and I booked a Fairmont Room for $289 a night which we felt was reasonable for Boston. Our room was rather small, but typical of a city hotel. Furnishings were definitely showing their age and the carpeting was quite strained. As others mentioned, our view was of a dank interior "courtyard" which offered little privacy. All in all, the room was fine, but seemed to miss the mark of what we expected. As we were relocating we opted to splurge on room service breakfast each morning. Basically, the menu offered typical generic hotel fare at a premium price. Again, the food and service were basically fine, but not exceptional. One complaint that we did have was with the fact that we were told by Reservations that the hotel had a nice workout facility. This was not the case. The workout facility was comprised of a small, poorly ventilated fitness room with outdated equipment. Also, it is worth mentioning that the hotel does not have a swimming pool or spa services. On several occasions we ventured to the Oak Bar for a change of scenery as the weather was not cooperating. Again, the service and apps that we had were fine, but off the mark. Menu was rather uninspired, especially in a city with so many amazing places to eat. Service was adequate and they got the job done. For the price, expected more. Tip: Venture to the Franklin Cafe in South Boston... worth the taxi ride over. On the whole, a nice hotel in a great location, but I know that there are better in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: auntxenna
Reviews.Content: Stay on floor four if you can, well worth the extra money. Breakfast was supplied and evening kibbles also supplied. Room was great with the best coffee we have had in all the hotels we have stayed in. I can't say enough about the professional staff and service provided.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: SFRookies
Reviews.Content: My stay at this property was extremely pleasant and the usual first class Fairmont hospitality. My room was very spacious and spotless and did not lack for any comforts to make my short stay pleasant. The bed and pillows were heavenly. The service I received from the staff was what I have come to know and appreciate as impeccable Fairmont professionalism. The property itself is older with tons of character to add to its charm so if your taste is urban chic, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY AND STAFF IS NOT THAT FRENDLY.”
Reviews.Author: eric1234Milwaukee_wi
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Boston for a work trip. When we checked in they tried putting us on the first floor which was in the basment over looking a brick wall. Aftercomplaining and having to pay an extra $80 a night they moved us up to the 3rd floor over looking the some of the park. The view was ok but not realy worth the extra money. The staff there had a pretty pissy attitude from check in to check out. When ever you asked them for help it was if you where being a pain to them. Also dont bother using your alarm clock unless you are looking to wake up before 7 am. Every morning the cleaning crew would knock on our door to try to clean the room and would come back every 15 minutes to try again even after we put out the do not wake sign. Over all the hotel was average and would not recommed the place for the money, there is a good reason why they are ranked just average on this web site. If you are looking for a great hotel keep looking this is not the place!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous experience, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: wdangl
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into the beautiful lobby after a long journey we were treated like royalty. The staff were fantastic throughout our stay, nothing was too much trouble and we felt like we were among friends. The rooms were spotless and spacious. We were on the 4th floor with access to our own sitting room equipped with a real fire and books, newspapers, DVDs and CDs for our own use. Snacks and soft drinks were available to us all day so we saved a fortune on the cost of bottled water, cokes etc - well worth upgrading to a Gold room to benefit from this service. We had free unlimited access to the internet, two PCs discreetly tucked away in a quiet area of the sitting room. Breakfast was included and we enjoyed hot and cold buffets, something different every day. Room service was value for money, quickly delivered with complimentary iced water. The beds were luxurious - I shared a double room with my daughter and we had 2 double beds with pillows we sank into. My daughter called our stay our "Pretty Woman moment" with reference to the luxury of the room, service and complimentary drinks, toiletries, robes etc! This hotel has a history to enjoy too - since 1912 every US president has stayed there and it also has its own resident dog - Catie Copley who has a book written about her. Guests can take her out for a walk, which we did! The hotel is in a great location - the impressive Boston library is across the street, the Hancock Tower and 2 shopping Malls are a couple of blocks away. The tour trollies and buses leave from just across the street and CVS drugstore and Wendy's are close by. On the day that we left, the staff offered to make us up a box of cookies to take with us on our flight! Overall, this is the finest hotel I have ever stayed in for warmth, friendliness of the staff, amenities, location and cleanliness. If you are going to Boston or know someone who is, please let them know about this fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Atmosphere - Apart from the Prostitute!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: flyingscot1982
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is in a great location. If you are arriving at Logan Airport don't take the expensive taxi as we did as you can buy a 7 day T pass(underground ticket) for $15 that will take you right to the hotel (taxi cost about $36 from Airport). Just Jump on the Silver Line Bus which will take you to the underground station and go to Copley and when you come out of the station it's right in front of you(I would recommend buying a T pass anyway as it's the best way to get round the city and takes you to nearly all the tourist sites of interest). Check in at this hotel is easy and staff are friendly and courteous. The rooms are very nice and beds are very comfortable. All in all it was everything I expected from this class of hotel and I wasn't disappointed. The only criticisms I would have of the room is that the TV is at the side of the bed so is awkward to watch and there is no sofa or chairs in the room apart from a desk chair so you have to sit on the edge of the bed all the time to watch TV. We stayed in a Queen room so maybe worth paying a bit more and getting a better room with chairs etc. Bathroom was spacious and very clean. The negatives of the hotel were first of all the internet access - I can't believe they don't have free computer use for guests - I checked my email for less that two minutes and it cost me almost $7 - that's unacceptable in this day and age. Also, in the Oak Room Bar at the hotel there is a sign saying that there is a dress code - this did not seem to apply to the prostitute who was openly "touting" for business wearing very little one afternoon much to the embarrassment of many of the people in the bar including family groups with children. She was very drunk and shouting and swearing and doing some fairly obscene things with one "customer" in open view and the staff did nothing. This is not the sort of thing I'd expect at a Fairmount Hotel - Pretty Woman it ain't!!!! The Oak Room is also mega expensive for drinks so better going to a local bar or jumping on the underground or even going to the Shop across the road (especially if you're drinking Guinness as they only have it in tins anyway and you can buy a crate for the price of one in the Oak Room)

Reviews.Title: “over promised and under delivered”
Reviews.Author: Enigma1985
Reviews.Content: I was most upset at the treatment that I received at this resort. The staff were snooty and unresponsive. Many major problems with the room that didn't get fixed upon request and forced out of the room by annoying housekeepers at 8am, then at 9am, then at 10am. Not worth the amount they charge AT ALL!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel and great service for Christmastime”
Reviews.Author: zippypeep
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here overnight on Christmas Day. My birthday was a few days away so when I placed my reservation I signed up for the the President's club. When we arrived we were given a free upgrade (we had requested ahead of time). When we got to the room, there was a bottle of champagne and box of chocolates with a birthday card from the manager. It was a very nice touch. The room was impeccable and very large. Our king size bed felt like an XXLarge bed - it was huge! The sheets and pillows were incredibly soft and the bathroom was very large and very clean. The bathroom amenities were all Herman Miller and there was plenty of shampoo and conditioner! My only criticism of the bathroom is that you couldn't pull the shower curtain all the way around the tub, even though the bar for it was there, it was just a little weird. There was a wide screen tv and two comfy chairs next to a non-working fireplace. The view was also very nice - see the pic. I believe we were in room 629, it faced copley square and the church, see the pics. We had a reservation for the Oak Room downstairs and I stopped by the bar early to get a small bite and a drink. It was a little slow at the bar in terms of service, it was Christmas and they seemed short staffed. Dinner in the Oak Room was delicious and the portions were large. The service was fantastic and we never felt ignored. Our table was in a small, more private room in the restaurant. The main dining room was busy and a little too loud for me. Maybe because it was Christmastime and the hotel was not that full so I did not hear doors slamming from the other guests at all at night like some other tripadvisor reviewers did. Our room, however, was across from the door used by the cleaning crew, so I did hear that door close a few times the next morning. By the way, there was and still is some construction being performed to the huge windows on the Dartmouth street side. The windows are to the Oak Room restaurant, but they just closed the curtains and we didn't notice when we were inside. If I were staying today, I would not request a room on the 2nd floor dartmouth street side, it is not a great view and the construction might be a problem in terms of noise during the day. Overall, I was satisfied and really felt like I was away on vacation a lot longer, that is how a beautiful hotel like this makes you feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Services for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Montreal2009
Reviews.Content: The concierge service was great (Jim Carey) and he was helpful in securing NCAA tournament tickets for us! There is also a great dog in the lobby who adds to the great experience. Location is central, near shopping, bars, parks, major neighborhoods, and sites. Rooms and ambiance are older and temperature control was difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jamieleigh514
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel for just a fun weekend getaway. We absolutely LOVED the beautiful lobby of this hotel and the food was absolutely amazing. They served little baguettes with a soft blue cheese spread. I'm not sure what kind of blue cheese it was, but I've been craving it ever since!!! The location of this luxurious hotel is just minutes away from Quincy Market and not far from the aquarium. We liked our room and the service was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Older Hotel in Fantastic Location -”
Reviews.Author: VegasPisces
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my own for two nights in February 2009 for a conference and was extremely pleased. The location is fantastic - it is right off of the Copley metro stop and directly adjacent to the Marriott, which is connected to a large shopping mall. Also, just a short stroll away (even on a chilly Boston winter day) from Boston Common and the Historic District. My room was rather large and well appointed. The bathroom was very roomy and the shower had great water pressure. The bed was extremely comfortable and I slept like a baby. The only less than glowing comment I can make relates to security, or rather, the appearance thereof. Since this is an older hotel, they don't have a system in the elevator where you need to use your room key to gain access to your floor. Also, while the room key was the standard modern card model, the door handle itself was still rather old fashioned and ornate. While this certainly fit in with the overall theme of the hotel, the result is that my door never seemed to close with a tight seal and I had the impression that breaking into the room wouldn't be all that hard if someone were so inclined. Overall, though, my stay was very enjoyable and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gudgeb
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel that lives up to all the hype from other ratings. The hotel is immaculate and the service was first class. Room sizes are huge as are the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Boston - Go for Fairmont Gold”
Reviews.Author: faarias
Reviews.Content: Great location and beautifully furnished. I always try to splurge and stay in a fairmont gold room. Service is excellent and goodies in lounge are great. This is my favorite place in Boston; try the Lobster Benedict for brekafast in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and service.”
Reviews.Author: Kbryant
Reviews.Content: Nervous after reading some of the reviews but very happy with stay. I am a President's Club member and booked an Only One Way Winter Rate Fairmont Queen at $239/night. Upon arrival was upgraded without asking to an interior signature king room which was very large and decorated very nicely. Bathroom huge with separate tub and shower. Very clean. Old feel with modern updates. Public areas so classy. Katie Copley pretty darn cute. Oak Room bar and restaurant spectacular. Sunday lunch great. Across street there is an Au Bon Pain, various shops, Legal Seafood, salon/spa (at Westin), Starbucks. Excellent location. Within walking distance to many things and I don't like to walk! But was easily able to. Top notch. Definitely recommend and would return. If you get a room that you don't like, get another.

Reviews.Title: “The accommodation and service lived up to the promise of this impressive hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lhasabelle
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and myself were fortunate enough to experience the Fairmont Gold floors of this well positioned hotel. The service was exemplary with many helpful suggestions for dining and sightseeing from Nic in reception and the marvellous Stephen who attended to our every need whilst we enjoyed our breakfast in the Gold Lounge. Service and food were second to none. Right across the road was Copley Plaza which was a maze of shops, restaurants and had a convenient train station. We must pass on the recommendation of the Atlantic Fish Company Restaurant situated not far from the hotel which serves excellent lobster!

Reviews.Title: “Boston's Best! Really!”
Reviews.Author: Vuittongirl
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel...great location, rooms, staff and service. Have stayed several times before, however this time it was a "girl's" weekend. Room was fantastic for two ladies who enjoy their own space. Two beds, plenty of room, high ceilings. Really, this was the least expensive room we could book so we were delighted...as we were across from Copley Plaza and we planned to do a little bit of shopping. Received a welcome fruit basket...don't really know why, but guess it's because we are repeat guests and we thought it was a nice touch. It was horrid weather the first night, rain and sleet...common Boston weather and the bellman made sure we had umbrellas to take with us. Came back the first night around 11p and the Oak room bar was quite busy, however got a table and enjoyed a nightcap and some snacks. Oh yeah...before I forget, the black lab in the lobby was very sweet....yes, that is a real dog! We stay at the Fairmont in Quebec city often and they have a mascot also. Seems to be a theme at Fairmonts, don't know. Haven't stayed at too many of them. Love pets though and any place that has one in lobby is a place I'd be happy to call home! Ps...Booked this direct with the hotel. Don't ever do the Priceline thing like the person who was reviewing the hotel before. I honestly think they don't travel much... Oh yeah, have stayed at the Westin Copley, Hyatt Harborside, Holiday Inn, Le Meridien, Hyatt Cambridge and Sheraton...they're nice in their own ways, we're going back to the Fairmont Copley.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: sassy8484
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful, but the most impressive part of this hotel is the staff. My mom and I stayed here when she came up to visit me from Florida. She's very picky, and they met her standards ;-) quick response to all requests and remembered us every time we came back to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: SaratogaJon
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service. Really all you could ask for in hotel. We stayed on the Gold level and really enjoyed our stay. We were in Boston during a major snow storm, so the location across from the mall entrance (Westin) was really convenient. We've stayed at the Fairmont in Boston many times and it continues to please.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: city_of_champs
Reviews.Content: I live in the Boston area, but my boyfriend and I were going to a New Years Eve party in Back Bay, so we wanted a hotel we could get back to easily. There was a bad blizzard so there was alot of snow on the ground. I drove in straight from work, The Valet helped me with my bags and took care of my car. The valet handed my baggage directly to the bellman, so I didn't even have to worry about them at check in. Check in was very smooth. They gave a us a complimentary upgrade from the standard Fairmont room to a deluxe room. Great I always appreciate a comped upgrade. (I have stayed here in the past in the standard fairmont room, and it's a nice room) The deluxe room was actually a suite and it was awesome! There is a sitting room with a desk, two arm chairs, an ipod docking station and a TV. There was also a decent sized closet in that room. The bathroom was very large. The vanity was a decent size, but not huge. There was an extra shelf to the left of it that was very handy as I was getting ready for a formal party. The bedroom was a good size considering there was a seperate sitting room. The bedroom had king sized bed, a large flat screen TV and an ipod docking alarm clock. There was a second good sized closet off the bedroom as well. The hotel staff was fantastic. My boyfriend had to work late and didin't arrive to the hotel to get ready for the party until I had already finished getting ready and left for the party. The front desk had a key waiting for him, so he could get ready as quickly as possible since he was already going to be late for the party. The concierge was helpful giving me directions to the location of the party about a 10 minute walk away. They have on past visits helped me with dining recomendations as well. After the party, my boyfriend had enjoyed the party we had been at a bit too much and the doormen was great. He helped my boyfriend back to the room and made sure we got in ok. I was embarassed about the state my boyfriend was in, but he was very professional about helping him. When I woke up, a list of all the charges to room had been placed under my door for my review. Everything on it was expected and fair. My car was waiting for me in as I had called the valet like they requested 15 minutes prior to when I wanted to leave. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. 5 stars, I will be back for whenever I need to stay downtown. All in all, I was very pleased with my stay. My only vriticism would be the view from our room. We looked out over the roof of another part of the building and into other rooms. I really didn't care since we got a free upgrade to the bigger room, but if I had come from far away and was staying for more than a night, I may have been disapointed with it. My only other regret is that we didn't get to take advantage of any of the great facilities the hotel had to offer. Boston is a great city and the location of the Fairmont in Back Bay is perfect for exploring. If you are visiting the area, be sure to head over to the north end. It's adorable and the restaurants are incredible. La Cantina Italiana is my favorite. Ask for Tarick and Evan for your server and busser. They are the nicest guys around.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to have a holiday”
Reviews.Author: Baltzan
Reviews.Content: We returned after 3 years to spend a few days between Xmas and NY's. We used our platinum benefits and were given a BEAUTIFUL suite overlooking Copley Square. The staff are great,loved the Oak Room bar and dining room(for breakfast) but nothing is cheap especially when you are Canadian. The lobby is gorgeous especially with festive decorations, speedy elevators, a very effective front desk staff...all made for a wonderful stay. We returned for 1 night Jan 1st, all was good except our deluxe room had NO view, could be depressing

Reviews.Title: “loved the fairmont - especially catie the canine concierge”
Reviews.Author: dottie dog
Reviews.Content: This is a great fairmont -- loved the historic hotel, beautiful lobby, nice restaurant and bar, clean nice room, but above all loved being able to sign out Catie the Canine Concierge (big lovable black lab) for a walk. Great hotel, great service too.

Reviews.Title: “Perect weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: CarolATL
Reviews.Content: Loved the Fairmont! The room at the Fairmont was clean and beautiful.....it felt as though we were staying in an old mansion. Book the Gold Room level if you can. The service was amazing and it was so convenient to have breakfast, snacks, and drinks right at hand. My husband requested a different pillow.....housekeeping brought 5 different kinds for him to choose. I would absolutely stay there again and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Copley!!”
Reviews.Author: MALUV2Travel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Copley for a wedding. The event itself was beyond belief; everything was perfect and the staff could not have been more attentive. The room was small but spotless with a beautiful bathroom and a delightfully comfy bed. Great location; right around the corner from Newburry Street shopping. Just loved it there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Good Experience at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: kalexia123
Reviews.Content: This is a mixed review. I would recommend the hotel for its location, generally attentive staff, its ambiance, and a few other things. We traveled as a family while my husband attended a conference and I came with the baby. We arrived after a red eye, having paid for the day before ($300 night) to ensure the room was ready, which it was, including the crib. Nice. I had inquired if there was a refrigerator -- needed to just store a small bottle - and they put in a small refrigerator in the room (nice intentions) but there was already a mini bar fridge in the room, thus making it unnecessary, especially since it broke the second day. We were not able to get the Club level, which probably would have been great given the other reviews, and we had a fairly small room, especially since there were two refrigerators (again, thanks, but just the mini bar would have worked). The bed was comfortable and there was an iPod stereo which was nice. Okay, the negatives...room service. Because of the 14 month old, I had to order room service a few times and we had problems with both the quality of food and missing items (which were rectified). So, if you can avoid it, don't order room service. Also, it is an older facility and so the heating conditions vary. I had to open the window (and it was really cold) so the the room could become more climate, but this wasn't an ideal solution. The only other negative is that there wasn't always a doorman, which was difficult when I was returning alone to the hotel with a stroller, but there was always a lot of foot traffic so someone generally opened the doors for us. What I really liked about the hotel was the concierge, Jim, and his black lab, Catie, who is at the hotel during the day. They are fantastic (and you can buy a book which goes to charity). The staff always gave me good tips on shopping, as well as restaurants, which is so important. Also, the Oak Room is an old style bar which is nice to enjoy a drink (sans enfants). The other positive is that the hotel is close to a Hertz and it is near the highway ramp going to New York, where we went after being in Boston. The only other tip is that if you join their club you can avoid the daily $15 internet access charges. All in all, the Fairmont is a good hotel, and probably great if your room is large and well situated and you don't have to order room service.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Floor Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: onthemaptravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Gold Floor (club floor) at the Fairmont Copley Plaza in Boston when we went back for Parents' Weekend at my daughter's college. It was fantastic! As an owner of On The Map Travel, I stay at plenty of great hotels. This Gold Floor experience was one of the best because the club rooms were elegant, cozy and felt like home (if you lived in a mansion!). The service was excellent; the food they put out for breakfast, lunch snack, cocktail time and light dinner was good and varied every day. It's not that much more per day to upgrade to this level - but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - only two minor quibbles!”
Reviews.Author: NYCFrequent_traveler
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Fairmont Copley Plaza was a fabulous change from the usual business hotel. The renovated rooms are lovely - mine was very big on the corner, with a nice desk area, large flat screen TV and a fireplace with mantle. The bathroom was also nice and new, with a deep bathtub - a real plus! The people who work at this hotel were also exceptionally nice and helpful and everyone at my company loved Catie the Canine Ambassador - who has her own business cards. Two slight quibbles with the hotel - the first was the dinner we had in the Oak Room when we first arrived. Looking for a light supper, we ended up paying extortionate amounts of money for substandard fare - particularly the sandwiches. Secondly, when renovating the hotel they should have made a bigger fitness center rather than pushing you to the health clubs nearby with their hefty fees. There were three running machines and two ellipticals, in decent condition, but v. busy at peak times. Apart from those minor things - the location, staff and rooms were all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Central Location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: verymodest
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights while attending a conference in Boston. This is an excellent hotel. It is a very typical Fairmont experience with excellent service, great food and confortable rooms. The rooms are well equipped including high speed internet and hdtv. It is very clean. There is a lot of history throughout the hotel, which was very interesting. The location of the hotel is the biggest highlight for me. It is very well situated, just two blocks away from Newbury Street, where there is some of the best shopping in North America. It is walking distance to a lot of great bars, pubs and restaurnats. Above all, it is right next to two different T subway stops, so it's just a hop and a skip to get anywhere in the Boston area, including Cambridge, Freedom Trail, etc etc. The only drawback is that the hotel is perhaps slightly overpriced. However, if you find a great deal, this is a fantastic place and it does earn a "highly recommended" from me.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional, old-Boston experience -- excellent place”
Reviews.Author: triptraveller
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a traditional, old Boston experience, Fairmont Copley is the place. The lobby and public rooms are in the "grand-style" with marble columns and panelled walls. The rooms for meetings and events are truly beautifull. The sleeping room was more than satisfactory: very good furnishings and window treatments, comfortable bed, and the newly remodeled bathroom was luxurious, with separate bath and shower areas, bidet, and excellent soaps/amenities. Food was good -- and the atmosphere of the Oak Room is quiet and comfortable. Service deserves special mention: the staff show attentioin to the comfort of guests -- and express a genuine hospitality. Much appreciated. The Fairmont Copley Plaza is not inexpensive -- but it offers tradition, comfort, and hospitality throughout that go well beyond that of most hotels (including those in Boston!).

Reviews.Title: “Fab!”
Reviews.Author: peaj01
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a beautiful city! We were lucky enough to be upgraded to 'Gold', which they call a 'hotel within a hotel'. It was this which made our stay extra special, we got a free breakfast every morning of our stay, and all snacks in the kitchen free and cheaper drinks than in the bars. The staff were very friendly and courteous. The location is perfect for exploring the city, we walked EVERYWHERE! make sure you have comfy walking shoes! Felt very safe. Would definately go back to this hotel again as it was in such a perfect spot! Catie Copley the hotel dog can be taken out for a walk if you're missing your pooch!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will return!”
Reviews.Author: joanas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gold Level, so can only comment on my particular stay....When I arrived there was a problem with there not being a doorman to take my bags, so I was rather upset...The management practically tripped over themselves to make up for it....A beautiful pecan crusted brie, crackers, fruit, and bottled water brought to my room etc..Call from the manager as well as a note...After that initial problem, absolutely nothing was a problem after that...The personal attention paid to you is just wonderful. All of the concierge were first class all the way. The kitchen with anything that you would want all day was divine. The room was cleaned very well everyday. The hotel itself is gorgeous, and the lounges and rooms on the gold floor, with breakfast every morning, and trays of hor d'oerurves in the evening, along with a bar, is well worth the extra money that the Gold dictates....My room overlooked the Trinity Church and the Square...and the room itself was beautiful...Only one thing needed improvement and that was the cable reception, and the fact that 2 of the remotes would not work most of the time...I, personally, did not care about the television, but if my son had been with me, he absolutely would have...Overall, it was a splendid experience, and I will definitely return...Thanks Fairmont Gold Staff for making my trip to Boston, just that much more special!

Reviews.Title: “Lavish, comfy, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tanvandriver
Reviews.Content: This old hotel has been refurbished to be super-comfortable, with only minor lapses (so-so water pressure in shower, slightly disorganized restaurant). The staff, however, were uniformly helpful and friendly. Fodor's describes the decor as "over the top", and we would agree (both deer heads and cherubs in the Oak Room dining room, marble and mirrors and gilt and floral carpet everywhere!). But the exuberance of the decor doesn't dim the fun, if you're in the spirit of the place. The location was perfect for a Boston weekend, and we enjoyed our stay immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain, overall positive experience1”
Reviews.Author: GStarr19
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal on travelzoo.com and booked it through the hotel's actual website. Upon arrival, they accidentally gave us a room key to an occupied room. We went back to the front desk and they immediately upgraded us to the Gold level which is the club level floor. It included a really nice (and free) breakfast. The room was clean and quiet. It was spacious though could certainly use some updating. Overall - bed and room was comfortable. The bathroom was nice and included an oversized tub which we enjoyed. Great location too! We recommend renting bikes and riding over the bridge to Harvard. It's a beautiful ride and definitely a good work out too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: akiwisgirl
Reviews.Content: After doing some research online and checking out other hotels my husband and I decided this hotel looked the best. We specifically wanted to be within walking distance of Newbury St. and they are within 2 blocks. This hotel was the 2nd most expensive of the ones we compared, but it looked so beautiful we decided it was worth it. It was! The hotel lobby is gorgeous and the whole hotel makes you feel like you've gone back in time. Our room was small (perfect for two people without a ton of luggage), but we knew that going in and it we didn't intend to spend a lot of time in it so it didn't matter. My first impression of the room was that it was very clean, which is something most hotel rooms do not do to me. Even the bathroom was sparkling and I'm usually most wary of those. Also the bed had to be most comfortable bed we ever slept in. We were totally in love with it after the first night. We had forgotten to ask for a late check out so we called down to the front desk and we told it wasn't a problem. Overall the staff was exceptionaly friendly and accommodating. When we realized my husband forgot his razor, it was immediately sent up with some shaving cream. We were only booked for one night but the second day we were having so much fun we decided to extend our stay. Even though we had checked out, when we called to book again we were treated as though we had never left. We even got the same room again. Only a few minor things worth being aware of. Our room was near the elevator and it seemed that hallway noise came straight in through our door so that woke us up a bit in the morning. Second, the tub in the bathroom connected to the sink with a small counter, no glass. The shower curtain didn't close the whole gap (it ran along one side and the end) so you had to choose which end to let the water escape from. And lastly, the parking seemed expensive ($42/day) but I suppose thats fairly standard for city rates. Overall we loved staying here and are already trying to work out if we can stay again when we have to be in Boston again in October. For its central location to Newbury and Boylston streets with the shops and restaurants it just can't be beat. Also the Oak Bar is absolutely stunning and worth a drink or two in there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, nice hotel but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here form 5 nights from the 18th to the 23rd of August, and I have to say, the location canâ€™t be beaten:- Right on Copley Square with Newbury Street a block away, next to the Green Line â€œTâ€�, and downtown a few blocks away to the east. The Prudential Mall is 5 minutes away, and the Common the same in the opposite direction. Also on the positives, the room was pleasant, clean and relatively spacious, and it was a very comfortable stay (the bed was fantastic). The staff are pleasant, and the air-con was more than adequate. The room (ours was on the 6th Floor) had a large closet space, which meant your room didnâ€™t need to be cluttered with cases, and contained a safe box and iron/ironing-board. Right, the bad news: The room has an extensive supply of outrageously overpriced minibar items, but no coffee or tea facilities, which is a bit of a pain. A bottle of water in the room was $8â€¦ brings new meaning to the term â€œprecious waterâ€�. The cost of internet access is $14 a day, which is exuberant given internet access in a lot of hotels is free. If you are staying on the Gold Level (4th Floor) there is free WiFi, which we could access in our room and can be picked up in other areas of the hotel. Room service was a joke. We had to ring three times to get an order put through, and while the cost on the menu wasnâ€™t too different that other hotels in this range, the extra costs added on were ridiculousâ€¦. on top of the menu prices there is a 18% gratuity (which when forced on you isnâ€™t really a gratuity at all, now is it?), $5 delivery charge (so whatâ€™s the 18% for?) and tax. This meant we ended up paying nearly 35% more for the room service than the menu prices indicate. Fair enough, they tell you this on the menu, but it doesnâ€™t make the excess any more palatable. Naturally, we decided against room service other nights, and instead settled for stocking up on snacks from the 7-Eleven and CVS across the square. The hotel itself is quite impressive, the lobby and reception areas are more like a grand imperial hotel in Europe, and for location alone, I would probably stay here again, but my expectations would be a lot less, and room service would be off the list.

Reviews.Title: “Not Exceptional - but Not Terrible, either”
Reviews.Author: Mary-Loves-Paris
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Copley Plaza is a very traditional hotel with a grand Titanic-esque feel. Makes you think like you've stepped back in time in many ways - which is a little strange because they claim to have spent millions on updating recently. The lobby looks like the Palace at Versailles, and the staff was welcoming. I had high hopes. But then we arrived to our room... Our first room was adjacent to the service elevator. After hearing that thing run every couple minutes for nearly the entire first night, we knew we'd go crazy if we didn't relocate. Since we were staying at the hotel for another four nights, I expressed to the front desk the importance of switching to a quieter room. Seriously, I would have bailed and found a new hotel had they not been able to change my room - it was that bad. (The Westin is nearby, as is the Four Seasons).... I thought the hotel was full up, but staff was able to find something for us and even offered to move all our things for us. Thankfully, the new room (No. 582) was a huge improvement. It was ADA accessible so it was expansive. Bed was super-comfy and the room included bath robes, an iron and ironing board, and nice toiletries. The air conditioner was quirky, however: it didn't have automatic climate controls, so you either had to leave it on (which was a bit noisy for sleeping) or turn it off (which meant the room heated up while you were sleeping, causing you to wake quite warm in the middle of the night). Some other minor disappointments: no in-room coffee or tea; no seats other than a sturdy desk chair; and while they like to boast that the windows open for fresh air, you certainly wouldn't want to do so. If your room overlooked the street, the street noise would be too much. If your room was on the inner courtyards (as ours was), the noise from the massive air conditioners would be too overwhelming (we could hear them with the windows closed). Internet connection in the room was $14 per 24-hours of service. Your basic one-litre bottle of Evian water was $7 plus tax plus 10% restocking fee, and the half-bottle of Coppola red table wine in the honor bar was a whopping $16. I bet they don't sell many of those, since there's a CVS market and a liquor store right across Copley Square. Never did find the exercise room - location was not apparent. Breakfast in the Oak Room was convenient but quite spendy. Granted, it's the most beautiful room in the building - but you're paying for the civility of cloth napkins and attentive waiters. The food was okay, but there's an Au Bon Pain just a block away that can give you a good breakfast for half the price. Or stock up on packaged Entenmann's pastries and a bottle of Odwalla juice from the CVS and call it good. Now the good point: this hotel is in a excellent location for seeing everything. Newbury Street is just two blocks over and the river is just a couple more blocks beyond that... There's a metro stop for the Green Line just across the plaza (convenient for getting to the heart of downtown or out to the Museum of Fine Arts)... The Trolley Tour goes right past the front door of the hotel (buy tix from the Concierge)... And the Prudential Center for shopping and dining at Legal Seafood is just down the street. Some pretty good restaurants in the surrounding blocks - so while I wouldn't stay at the Fairmont again unless it was a smokin' hot deal, it wasn't too bad this time around.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: derbycityvisitor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 3 1/2 stay at the Fairmont. It is a beautiful old hotel and located in a very desireable part of Boston. We walked to Fenway Park and many local restaurants. The only complaint I have was the food we received via room service was not very good especially for a 4 to 5 star resort like the Fairmont. The quality of the food overall was only average to just above average. I do recommend staying at the Fairmont because it is well maintained and well located. The Fairmont also has the best concierge, (Jim, who has been there 30 plus years) He obtained great seats for us at Fenway and a Rod Stewart concert. If you want to get into special events in the Boston area, Jim is "The Man"!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing - Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: mcgorr
Reviews.Content: A very disappointing hotel. The rooms are plain and unimaginitive and are totally blocked from natural light by the highest building in Boston which is positioned next to it. The age of the hotel is noticable. Acomplete lack of public rooms. Only one bar which is dark and miserable, nowhere else at all for guests to relax. Noise from weddings on the 3 nights we were there was unbelievable. A companion found a FLEA in her bed. Staff smiled politely but were toally ineffectual. They just didn't want to know, were smug, huffy, snappy and useless in dealing with the public, from the bellman to the manager. Take my advise and avoid this place like the plague. I don't give bad reviews, read my others, but don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: pkrajsa
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience at the Fairmont Copley Plaza. We had two unique and beautiful rooms overlooking Copley Square - window seats and a fireplace. Cocktails in the bar were expensive ($17 martinis) as was breakfast but the service and atmosphere were extraordinary. Concierge and all staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful even providing complimentary champagne for our anniversary, and the location is stupendous. My teenage kids would like to live at the Fairmont Copley Plaza permanently.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: nyeze
Reviews.Content: Great location. 2 blocks to Newbury St. A block to Copley (green line) T stop. Superb service. Staff was friendly and welcoming. Got a deluxe room which is much bigger than the standard room. Still bathroom was small -- couldn't fit more than one person at a time. Valet parking is pricey $42 but you get in/out priv so it's pretty easy (need to notify about 20 mins before you want the car ready).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: NIwoman
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent and the entrance, lobby etc are really nice. However the standard room we had was small, plain and very disappointing and did not live upto the impression created by the rest of the hotel. Hardly any space and no seats and no in room tea and coffee. We travelled for 3 weeks across North America and this was the most disappointing hotel. Our first night, after a long day travelling, was a nightmare. Between the band in the ball room which went onto 12.30, then the sound of the noisy airconditioning in the room. When we complaint, we got short shift and it was suggested outright that we were looking for an upgrade! After making it clear that we were after a good night sleep not an upgrade we eventually got moved. At least the air conditioning was silent in the new room.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite home away from home in Boston”
Reviews.Author: lascolinas
Reviews.Content: This is THE BEST hotel for the money in Boston....This hotel reflects true Boston ambiance and it is in the heart of what I think is the best city in America........

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: evoltravel
Reviews.Content: My family and I arrived early in the morning at about 10am. Most hotels these days won't let you check in early, the Fairmont was the exception. Lisa the front desk "trainee" noticed we had children in tow, she asked for my number and told us she would call as soon as a room was available. We went across the street and had breakfast and when we were finishing the phone rang. Our room couldn't accommodate both a crib and a roll away so Lisa had our room upgraded. When we went to our room the crib and rollaway were already set up. Don't miss the Oak bar in the Lobby. My waiters name was Kirk and he served me the best beer in my life and kept my needy family happy. The beer comes with a hot soft pretzel hanging off the front on the glass. I will be going back to Boston in September and will be staying at the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience Overall”
Reviews.Author: LuvMyPug2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights -- our room although it had an ugly view of a courtyard was nice, clean and stylish. We really enjoy the location of this hotel given that it is easy to get pretty much anywhere from Copley Square. The lobby was a great meeting place for us and some of our friends who we met up with through out our stay. We had drinks at the Oak Bar which was a good experience even though the waitress wasn't really on the ball. Overall it was a classy hotel, with clean/stylish rooms and was a good experience for us. The staff were also very accomodating. One day I accidentally left the "Privacy" tag on the door while we were out all day -- when I went back to the room to get a couple things mid day (4PM) the room attendant heard me she came down the hall to see if I wanted the room made up. I told her I would be out for an hour and when I came back the room was all set. Normally this late in the day you are just out of luck getting your room done. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Under Whelming and Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: 06070tiffany
Reviews.Content: I travel to Boston fairly often for business and love the city. Normally I stay in the Financial District as itâ€™s close to my office and the airport. For this trip, I decided to stay in the Back Bay for a change in venue and The Copley Plaza offered a decent rate ($325 for a â€œFairmontâ€� room) through our corporate travel department and had rave reviews on tripadvisor. Hereâ€™s what I took away from my stay: Positive points: - Good location near shops and restaurants - Bonus FF miles w/stay - Free internet (if youâ€™re a Presidents Club card holder) - although the connection was painfully slow Less-than-positive points: - Tiny room with virtually no soundproofing - could hear people in next room/hallway and doors slamming at all hours - No view, fresh air or natural light! Window faced other rooms across a dingy â€œcourtyardâ€œ. Window opened but the restaurant exhaust fans were loud and spewed foul odors from below. - Sticky mouse trap under the nightstand - need I say more?? Granted â€œhistoricâ€� hotels have their idiosyncrasies but this hotel has more than its fair share. Would I stay at this hotel again? Probably not. The generic Westin across the street would be a better choice or in the Financial District the Boston Harbor or Langam are nice too. All in all left under whelmed by the lackluster Copley.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Boston”
Reviews.Author: chuckawala
Reviews.Content: Our stay was excellent here, we enjoyed the historic nature of the hotel. The bar was pricey, but it was quite a classic experience. The room was great, clean and spacious. We chose to dine nearby on Newbury street and did some shopping as well. The Charles river was only a few blocks away, which was a prime location for a run. The room rate was very good, which we got using the AAA rate. Some minor concerns, front desk did not always answer the phone, the parking fee was $40/nite, breakfast was pricey. I would suggest using the Starbucks or Au Bon Pan across the street. Staff was wonderful and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: traveladventures123
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, central location, decent fitness center, helpful and friendly staff, Catie (the canine ambassador!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Fairmont Hotel Boston”
Reviews.Author: Jenn65
Reviews.Content: My family enjoyed 4 lovely nights at the Fairmont on the Gold level. The room was nice and large and had great period details that really made the hotel and the room feel special. I would highly recommend the Gold level if possible. This added so much to our stay. We really felt that we could leave the room and have a little space to read the paper, enjoy a cold drink and have some extra quite time. The breakfast was good - and being able to have a access to waters, sodas etc all day was great. Especially since we were there during a terrible heat wave. The staff in the Gold level was great about maps and directions - and Nick especially got us some terrific dinner reservations.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE GOLD FLOOR!!!”
Reviews.Author: clairebear123456789
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic! We had a private check in on the 4th floor, everybody was really friendly. The room was amazing! I felt like royalty! They had complimentary breakfast in the morning, and they said it was continental breakfast so we thought it was going to be a basket of muffins, but there was a huge spread, they had eggs and meats and cheeses, breads and cereal, pretty much everything you could want. We really felt like we were valued, the concierge took extra time with us to show us around and make sure we'd have everything we needed. It was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Take the Gold Level”
Reviews.Author: gabbygrrl
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times and always book the Gold Level. Upgraded rooms, excellent breakfast included. Beyond the normal offerings. Wonderful honor bar system with top wines and Champagnes. The beds on this level are top notch...I didn't want to get up in the morning! Rooms are average, bathrooms on the small side. Great location near Copley. The Westin is across the street and is a perfect choice for the business traveler. But if you want "old school" charm and a step back in time, the Fairmont is a wonderful choice for a weekend get-away or a romantic break from reality. Again, pay the extra and upgrade to Gold service. Also parking here is very, very expensive. Try for an alternate nearby garage to avoid the $40 per night fee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Amazing Luxury hotel, little dated, but totally recommend it”
Reviews.Author: KiwiCowgirl07
Reviews.Content: We just returned from five nights at the Fairmont Copley Plaza. The location is just wonderful - by Trinity Church, the Boston Public, Library, Fenway Park, the original Cheers bar, and the shopping conencted by the Prudential skywalk. There is something for everyone. The hotel lobby is amazing - opulent and untouched since 1912 construction according to hotel staff. The first room was a little dated but in a charming way - gorgeous old wallpaper. However, our first room had a dreadful smell (chemical or plastic smell), so we asked to be moved the next morning, and we were taken care of. The second room was bigger, and had been updated with newer draperies and bedspreads and travertine in the bathroom. One small drawback: There are no coffee facilities in the rooms. As another reviewer noted, the tvs are old with few stations if that matters to you. The food at the hotel was amazing. We had lunch and dinner at the Oak Room - it is quite expensive but excellent food and service. The servings are huge - do not believe them when they say you need to order extra vegetables! We couldnt get through our meals. The desserts were to die for! We also ate room service which was also excellent, and several catered events at the hotel which were also amazing. There are fewer options for vegetarians, but if you eat seafood or steak, you'll be in heaven. Just bring a big appetite and credit limit. I was here for a conference and it was an excellent venue for our group. I would return here for a romantic trip, a girlfriend trip, or even with my kids (who would love the cute lab in the lobby!)

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money, but needs updating.....”
Reviews.Author: murdock110
Reviews.Content: We booked this room on priceline for $129. The listed price on Fairmont.com was $260+ a night. $129 was not bad for a great location as it is across the street from to Copley Place and the Prudential Center. Parking in the area is an experience. We arrived late on a Saturday, so I was able to park on the street at a meter, and they don't require to be fed on Sunday. If you can't find a metered spot park in a garage youself and walk a block, there are several in the area that cost around $20 for a night. Otherwise, the hotel charges around $30-$40 plus tip, and they'll take it to the same garage! I found our room to be old and somewhat outdated. There was a mousetrap behind the entertainment center (never good to know one is needed). The bathrooms were newer but the paint and tile job were not "crisp" as you might expect in a top tier hotel. This is probably not the right place to stay if you are travelling on business as there is a lack of electrical outlets. The bed was adequate, but not up to the Westin/Starwood heavenly bed levels that should be standard for a room in the $300 range. Overall, the room was o.k. for the price, and the location is hard to beat. I just would not have wanted to pay the $250 + tax and parking rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gsdc
Reviews.Content: It is still one of the grand dames of Boston and the hotel's Gold Floor offers incredible, personalized service as well as great food and drinks all day long. The location is perfect -- within walking distance of the Copley Plaza Mall and still within easy reach of Newbury Street.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, Convenient and Cool”
Reviews.Author: BizVacationTrvler
Reviews.Content: Normally, I would not stay at hotel this ridiculously expensive ($350+taxes) but since it was for work, everything else was booked, and the boss pre-approved the expense there I was checking into one of the nicest hotels in Boston. The hotel is gorgeous, rooms spotless and elegant without being overly gaudy. Lobby had plenty of seating for quick meetings or private calls. The bar soap/shampoo was top of the line! (With airline â€œcarry onâ€� baggage rules itâ€™s just easier NOT to pack those items and use the hotel offerings for these over night trips.) Being a young business traveler, and looking younger, the staff was a bit more relaxed with the formalities. The kindly noted that I dislike being referred to by my last name. I'm giving this a 5 star review b/c it deserves it. But I will note a few odd things that could have really annoyed some guests paying out of pocket. First, as I was washing my hands in the bathroom sink the water kept filling up. Apparently, the stopper came off from the hinge in the down position. I had to go under the sink and push it up. Second, the bedside clock (which was an iPod/mp3 docking and charging station!) was set to the wrong time. For the life of me, I couldnâ€™t figure out how to change the time! I got back to my room so late I just wanted to sleep in the compfy king size bed, so I used my blackberry for the clock during the night and requested a wake up call. For a business traveler this is a very comfortable hotel. Laptop/internet hook-ups in the room. But for all the money you spend (as a tourist) there is no free business center to check emails or even a free cup of coffee in the morning. Youâ€™re paying for ambianceâ€¦and youâ€™re getting it. But youâ€™ll also pay for everything else. (Except the complimentary NY Times left at your door in the morning!) Note: I did have a friend lucky enough to get this hotel on Hotwire over the summer for an amazing deal!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BDGALL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza for the final part of our honeymoon. When we arrived we were blown away with the amazingly beautiful lobby - if you choose not to stay here, it's worth a trip inside just to see it!! Catie, the hotels own black lab is a lovely addition to the hotel and has the run of the lobby. Check in was swift and friendly and we were delighted to have been upgraded to a superior room. Our room was lovely - an extremely comfortable bed, and although small, a beautiful bathroom. On our first night a member of staff arrived at our door with Champagne, chocolate covered strawberries and a congratulatory note from the hotel manager to celebrate our marriage! A fantatic touch. The breakfast in the hotel was wonderful and not too expensive (though this was helped by the favourable Â£/$ exchange rate!) We ate dinner in the Oak Room once - it was a fantastic experience. The meal, wine and service were wonderful. The location is perfect with a subway stop across the square and very close to to the fantastic shopping/dining on Newbery Street and the Prudential Center - we recommend taking the trip to the viewing platform in the Prudential Tower. I would recommend the Fairmont Copley Plaza to anyone visiting Boston who would like just that little bit more that simply somewhere to sleep. We will stay here again should we be lucky enough to visit the fabulous city of Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with Character”
Reviews.Author: telltales
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week with my boyfriend and could not possibly find a fault to report. The location right in the centre and between Trinity Church and the Central Library, cannot be improved. I believe we had a signature room which was nicely decorated and really spacious. We were originally given a larger room with a separate seating area but which faced an inner patio. The reception staff were happy to change us without delay into a room with a view of the square. Slightly more noisy as it is on a main road, but it almost ddidn't bother us as the double glass windows eliminated most of the noise. We did not try the hotel breakfast buffet as the only time when we decided to take breakfast there it was during the weekend when they do not serve the buffet. But the a la carte menu was good and we were happy with the food. We did not try the hotel restaurant as there are so many nice ones within walking distance that we wanted to explore. The hotel staff were always corteous and helpful as we've come to expect of the Fairmont chain and finally the hotel has true character. It was the appropriate choice for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Copley”
Reviews.Author: Mirthrindr
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at the Copley for 1 night on Saturday March 8 while attending a convention at the hotel. We reserved one of their â€˜hotel within a hotelâ€™ â€˜Gold Signatureâ€™ rooms and highly recommend this added indulgence. After checking several web sites, we found the hotels own web site actually offered the best nightly rate for the Gold Signature accomodations and number of booking options. The interior of the hotel is elegantly appointed and reminiscent of a bygone golden age of lavish and extravagantly designed hotels. The staff were equally as attentive and professional as the ambiance was sophisticated. The Fairmont â€˜Gold Signatureâ€™ level is on its own special floor (4th flr.) and provides a private check-in desk on the 4th floor just for guests staying on the Gold Signature floor. Amenities on this floor include a private, multiple room lounge area classically decorated complete with crackling fireplace and mantle, and a large pantry (the size of a standard kitchen). These rooms are all connected together in one area by doorways and create a sort of large square floor plan with each room decorated differently. One of the rooms was decorated in the style of a classic personal home Library and included books and a small collection of DVDâ€™s that Gold guests can bring to their room which all include DVD players. There was also a large closet sized room with two computer stations with fax printers and free internet. High speed internet access is also included in all Gold Signature rooms. During the morning and early evenings, the counters in the pantry are lined with a generous spread of complimentary food and drink, however, there is a significant collection of wine and liquor set up during most other hours of the day and evening. All food and non-alcoholic drinks are complimentary, but the liquor is an â€˜Honor Barâ€™ in which guests mix their own drinks from the well stocked collection of full size liquor bottles and are â€˜requestedâ€™ to write on a provided piece of paper any alcohol that they take which is charged to your room. As the pantry is unsupervised (except for the occasional staff person checking to ensure nothing needs refilling), they donâ€™t seem to police the policy, but do appeal to peopleâ€™s honesty in abiding by the honor system. At 5:00, the pantry was setup with a very nice number hors d'oeuvres including imported cheeses & crackers, scallops wrapped in bacon, spinach stuffed puff pastry, humus, prosciutto and cheese stuffed hot peppers, and many other items. Breakfast consisted of both hot and cold items including your standard breads, pastries, croissant, eggs bacon, home fries, smoked salmon, yogurt and granola parfait, fruits and cereals as well as other items. During all times of day there was an endless supply of juices, soda, and water. Several newspapers were also available for guests relaxing in the Gold lounge. Our Gold Sig King room was very nice and slightly on the large size for a studio room. It was not overly appointed, but was very nice and classically styled. The room included a nice Bose 'like' stereo system with iPod docking station on one of the night stands, a business desk with stationary, chairs and small round table, and amoire with enclosed standard TV (not Plasma or flat screen) and minibar. The Bathroom had a standard shower tub and rather small vanity sink. While nice, I expected a slightly more luxurious bath for the price of the Gold Signature accommodations, but it was still nice. The obligatory plush robes were of course there as well. At night, turn down service is standard in all Gold Sig rooms. When we returned to our rooms later that evening, the bedspread was removed and neatly folded in the corner of the room, slippers on the floor on either side of the bed, lights dimmed, and soft classical music playing on the Bose stereo. A small bottle of Evian water and small drinking glass were also neatly placed on both night stands. We did not experience the hotels one restaurant â€˜The Oak Roomâ€™, but we did relax in the Oak Bar late during the evening for some fine wine and conversation. The room was very classy and cozy with a live band playing classic tunes at an audible level low enough to partake in conversation yet loud enough to still be enjoyed. Martiniâ€™s were $20 a pop but that is about the norm in todayâ€™s ultra luxury hotel lobby bars. The last appointment that we rather enjoyed seeing and surprised that such a posh hotel would allow was Cattie, the Canine Ambassador. Cattie is the hotelâ€™s resident Black Lab and is a retired Seeing Eye dog living out the rest of her days greeting guests as they arrive in the main lobby area. She was very sweet and friendly, yet unobtrusive and never seemed to approach guests on her own but rather seemed to wait for guests to come to her. Donâ€™t know if itâ€™s still allowed, but the Copleyâ€™s web site states Cattie can actually be â€˜borrowedâ€™ for morning or daily walks by guests who miss their own four legged loved ones left at home. As I understand it, Cattie does not live in the hotel and goes home at the end of her busy work day with one of the hotel employees which I believe is now her owner.
