On a side note, this would be much more exciting an anecdote had we actually SEEN him, but there was a rumor through out the hotel that Tom Hanks was staying at the hotel on the Gold Signature Floor as well. Of course the staff were all tight lipped and denied any knowledge of his presence when pressed, but that is of course expected and a reflection of their professionalism. The next evening while watching the local news at home, who but Mr. Hanks himself was shown being interviewed on the news at the Boston Public Library which is literally across the street from the Copley, so there may very well have been some truth to the rumor that weekend. All in all, we will most definitely return to the Copley and the Gold Signature floor again and highly recommend it for a classy, extravagant escape.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate experience”
Reviews.Author: LynnMaine
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, but unfortunately our stay was marred by a theft. Our daughters purse was taken from the Oak Room even though we were the last customers to leave that night, so another patron didn't take it. The purse was gone in the morning. There are security cameras all around; but they don't bother to use them for security reasons such as this. I'm not sure what they are for; but whoever stole the purse must have known they aren't on, or aren't reviewed. The staff, except the Oak Room evening manager, didn't seem to care much about the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, historic hotel - Great Back Bay location”
Reviews.Author: FrankandBruno
Reviews.Content: We are always skeptical using priceline, especially in expensive Boston, but we were pleasantly surprised with the Fairmont Copley Plaza. The Fairmont is everything you want Boston to be, steeped in tradition, yet totally comfortable and inviting. The location is perfect, right next to Newbury Street, a multitude of shopping at Copley Plaza, and a short stroll to a toasty Starbucks. One warning, when walking by the John Hancock Tower (the tall glass buliding) beware of the extreme winds. Back to the hotel...very nice room details, comfy bed, great bathroom. I have two issues that must be discussed: 1.) The heating system...we could not turn it off. We were in a room with a fantastic view, but the windows would not open. The front desk quickly mitigating this with a fan. Annoyance gone! 2.) I hate when expensive hotels nickel and dime you....a bottle of water for $5?? Give me a break. Run next door to CVS and pick up some Poland Springs for $.99.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a tourist. V.comfy bed. Try the "Fairmont Gold"”
Reviews.Author: AusTravellerSydney
Reviews.Content: After browsing the reviews here, we decided to book a Gold Signature room at the Fairmont Copley Plaza for our 5 night stay in Boston in mid December and we were certainly not disappointed. As we had a long flight from Australia to Boston, we decided to arrange for a car to meet us at the airport. I called the hotel concierge a week before to arrange this and the driver was there to meet our late night flight which was most welcome after our very long day of travelling. The hotel was really well located for a tourist in Boston. Many attractions are within walking distance, a subway station is across the street and the Amtrak rail station is a couple of blocks away. We hired a car from Avis when we left Boston and it was also walking distance near the Amtrak station. The hotel is a beautiful historic building - only 6 0r 7 storeys high - with lots of ambiance. It reminded us of the Willard Hotel in Washington DC, where we have stayed previously. The rooms have all been renovated but still have that classic style rather than a modern look. Our room was a good size and the King bed was extremely comfortable. We slept very soundly during our stay. The Fairmont Gold concept is excellent. The whole of the 4th Floor is devoted to Fairmont Gold rooms and the dedicated concierge, lounge and breakfast room is based at one corner near the elevators. We had a room facing Copley Square which provided excellent views. The windows are double glazed, so it was very quiet. While the cost of the Gold rooms is more than the normal guest rooms, the inclusions make up for the difference. For example, the buffet breakfast with waiter service is free, the internet is free, overnight shoe shine is free and you have access to a large lounge area with an open fire, newspapers, games etc. The breakfast was excellent and it was very easy to walk from your room to the lounge area each morning. The Gold staff was delightful, friendly, personal and extremely helpful. For example, we locked our selves out of our room one morning and they prepared two more keys while we had breakfast, wrapping them in a huge red ribbon so we wouldn't miss them. The concierge even remembered our room number. Our experience at the Fairmont Copley Plaza was wonderful and really made our visit to Boston an enjoyable one. We would certainly recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a 4/5 star experience in Boston. We got an excellent rate online at the hotel's website and felt the rate was very good value when considering all the inclusions.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, extraordinary experience”
Reviews.Author: snoussi
Reviews.Content: I loved staying in this hotel. I was booked here purely by accident for the final night of a week-long business trip to Boston, and loved it. The service was top-notch, the room was plush, and the amenities left nothing to be desired. I would stay here again under any circumstances. I loved the room's decor and layout; the bathroom was stunningly designed (I even took photos for inspiration in my own home), and of course the hotel itself is remarkable to behold. The location is certainly convenient to many Boston attractions, such as the Public Garden. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient hotel with superb service”
Reviews.Author: Sylvainautourdumonde
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Copley Plaza is a magnificient hotel for its location, its building and for service. The hotel, a magnificient Renaissance building, stands in Copley Plaza near Boston Public Library, Trinity Church and Hancock Tower. Everything is within walking distance. The lobby is absolutely superb. Even if you don't stay at the hotel you should walk in ! So is the service from the door to your room ! Great Fairmont service. Check-in was courteous and rapid. The room, although this is an historic building, is modern (obviously renovated) and spacious with all marble washrooms ! The bed is really confortable. The desk though is a little tight for work. There is internet access in the room. You really feel like your living a good life when you stay there ! The fitness center is well equipped although in a small room. So fabulous historic hotel with modern amenities and superb service. I really enjoyed my stay at this Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Meheen
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the 'Gold' rooms - which means you have your own floor with its own reception and also a dedicated lounge for all the people on the floor. First impressions of the hotel were that the location was excellent - right in the heart of Boston and a very nice looking building from the outside. We walked into a massive lobby which did not appeal to me at all. It has a large busy railway station type vibe. Luckily we had our own check in on the 'Gold floor' - this went very smoothly and we were taken to our room (a double room for 2 people). We were very surprised by how tiny the room was! So we asked if we could change rooms and this was gladly done by the very nice and efficient lady at reception. We were taken to another room which was double the size! It had a few issues though. There was absolutely no storage space, the shower power was poor, and the TV was in a very odd position and very far away from the bed so we never even ended up watching it at all. However we had a great stay and the service was excellent - including the reception and room serice. I would definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “historic, great location”
Reviews.Author: soxskier
Reviews.Content: This is a classy hotel in a great location in the center of the city. We stayed here just for a one night getaway and we were happy. The room was very nice, large, incredibly decorated and clean. The steak house in the hotel is one of Boston's best and the dog that lives in the lobby is fun to play with. It is in a great location where you can walk to a lot of things and is near several stations and also the Amtrak/commuter rail station.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler34
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel. The standard room although renovated was still shabby in some detail. The room is uncomfortable other than for sleeping. No place to sit. Extremely over priced even at a discounted rate I received.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, very central.”
Reviews.Author: Molecatcher
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the end of our New England tour to celebrate 'molecatcher's' 60th Birthday! We had booked a room on the 'Gold' floor (well worth the extra) but were disappointed to be given an inside room with a view overlooking the central well and the noisy extractor vents. We were told that the hotel was full and we could not be moved for 2 days, but after our first sleepless night we threatened to check out unless an alternative was offered. The Gold Team were extremely helpful and came up with a delightful front room along with a bottle of wine on ice and a box of chocolates to celebrate the Birthday! After this faulty start everything was perfect and we had a wonderful stay in Boston. The breakfasts and evening canapes were outstanding with 24 hour access to free chilled soft drinks and an extensive honesty bar. There are 2 PCs in the lounge with free internet access in addition to WiFi for laptops in each bedroom. We mostly ate out but on our last night enjoyed a memorable meal in the Oak Room Restaurant (huge portions) beautifully cooked and well served. We looked into several other Boston Hotels but none were as elegant as the Fairmont and we would certainly stay here again on a future visit, happily paying the extra for the 'Gold' floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, superb location”
Reviews.Author: Willmo
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a good flight from London at about 2.30 in the afternoon, unfortunately our room was not ready, and would not be ready till about 4, 1 hour after it should have been. Not a great start but we were in an upbeat mood, so we went for a wander to get our bearings and pick up some brochures on the freedom trail etc. Arrived back at 4pm to be told it was 10 mins away from being ready. Staff were very apologetic and gave us frree drinks vouchers for the Oak Room and that they would come and get us once room was free. This they did and we were in our room at 4.15 ish. Room was better than we expected ( a fairmont room) a good size, clean and had that aged look without being old ( if you know what i mean!) The lobbey was very elegant, the dog (katie copley i think) pulled on the heart strings of my wife, and the service throughout our stay of 4 nights was top class. For a large hotel it still manages to be personel which is a credit to them. Location is superb. We walked everywhere and the start of the Freedom Trail is a lovely 10 min walk away at Boston Common. We had a meal in the Oak Room one evening and apart from being a lovely setting in the style of British Army Officers Hall, the meal and service was outstanding. Pasquelle our waiter was obvoiusly an experienced chap and it showed. Not a cheap meal , with wine and tip $300 but well worth it in our opinion. Would certainly stay at this hotel again. Loved Boston.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: stevefric
Reviews.Content: As I walked into the hotel the doorman was oblivious to my wife and I as he continued to talk with another employee in language that would be offensive to most people. That was the only bad experience had here. The Lobby staff were friendly and helpfull the common areas and function rooms are gorgeous. As this is an old hotel I was worried that the room would be cramped and out of style it was a pleasant surprise to find that that assumption was wrong. The room was large enough and very modern. The restauarant was very pricey but the food was good and the service even better. If you are celebrating a special ocassion and price isnt an issue thier restaurant The oak room is a great choice. After dinner we had a drink and listened to live jazz in the lounge it capped off a totally enjoyable evening. I would reccomend this hotel to just about any type of party.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller2408
Reviews.Content: A hotel in the grand old style, but with fantastic, unintimidating service. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The rooms were truly lovely, spacious, clean and luxurious. Breakfast was outstanding (too much of it really). You have a real feeling this is a special place to stay. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Copley was great, though you should know some things....”
Reviews.Author: annettemarice
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful Boston trip. It was our first time visiting in Boston and we wanted nice a upscale hotel that was in a great location. The Fairmont Copley is it! Wonderful Location!!!! We didn't have a problem walking all over the city and getting back to the hotel. It is blocks away from many restaurants, Newbury Street, the Public Gardens and Boston Common. It took us 15 min. walking to get to Fenway Park. Really GREAT location! The customer service was just perfect. John the bellman was a real sweetheart, the front desk accomodated our request for early check-in and late check-out. In room dining was great, a little pricey (average for this calibur hotel) and the food was good. There are a couple of things I think are important to note for those people who like to know what went "wrong". This is an old hotel. Don't expect roomy bathrooms or anything but a toilet, sink and small shower/tub. The closet is small. The iron leaked. There was no automatic turn down service, if you wanted it, you had to call and request it. For this type of hotel, I would expect this service. The sheets were a bit rough to me. I have slept in much softer, including my own. The shower curtain was a bit stained and the tv made a funny hissing noise. That is all I found to be "off" from another upscale hotel. We almost stayed at the Nine Zero hotel that has all new amenities. We are glad we didn't. The Fairmont is opulent and grand and for our intent for this trip, it was really perfect. When we take the kids, we will probably consider the Westin across the street. All in all, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Consistent Service”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravellerDub
Reviews.Content: We had to come to Boston for a medical appointment at the world renowned, Mass General Hospital. It was a 2 week long stay and can truly say the service and staff courteousness was very very consistent and genuinely nice and followup was always made by any request we ever had. The only inconsistency in service I can comment on is housekeeping, some days, we would get 5 hand towels, most days the shampoos/shower gels were not replenished, some days the kleenex box was not replenished. However, despite this in housekeeping, was always impressed that even though a couple times, we didn't leave the room until mid afternoon, the room attendants still managed to clean our room during the small window of time they had until their shifts were over. The staff were all very professional and unpretentious. Obviously very convenient location, and due to our long stay, we were able to find some inexpensive take-out bistros nearby for good but fast inexpensive food across the way at Copley Place and Prudential Center.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Catsize
Reviews.Content: Nice looking central hotel. Grandiose lobby and entrance area and rooms nicely done and spacious enough. On the down-side, we had to ask 4 times for the cot that we'd pre-booked to be brought to the room, the only lifts can be a very long walk from your room and the service for breakfast in the Oak Room deteriotaed over the 3 mornings from ok to very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is beautiful, but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: sailorgirlmn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza for 2 nights at the end of August for a meeting. Hotel facilities were beautiful and of historic significance. Check in was seemless. Rooms were large, but furnishings were a bit "tired." Bed was comfortable, rooms - facing back to central "courtyard" were quiet. Room service was pricey but food came quickly and was both good and still hot when it arrived! Meeting facilities were great. Food and beverage service was excellent - especially liked meeting "breakout snack" option that donated a portion of the proceeds back to a local charity! Great location, friendly and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Gold floor - Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Zawgyi
Reviews.Content: Best: - great location, great neighborhood for shopping, restaurants, strolling. One block from T and one block from Amtrak station at Back Bay. - great free breakfast in lounge. I think they say it's a limited service, but it's a big buffet. Hot dishes were usually eggs and potatoes. Bagels, english muffins, breads, superb croissants, pastries, coffee cake, smoked salmon, oatmeal, yoghurt, fruits, cheese, and more. Several fantastic staff are working very hard to refill coffee, clear plates, and make sure everything is going great. - free coffee, water, juice, and soft drinks all day. - free hors d'oervres every evening rotate through different Boston themes (e.g. North End = Italian etc...) - Great spacious room. Great bathroom. - relaxed atmosphere with a wide variety of clients. You don't feel like you have to dress up to go to breakfast, but you don't have kids throwing cheerios at you either. - free internet (ethernet) in room and two PCs available in the lounge. Wireless also supposed to be available. Not the best: - service was a little inconsistent. Gold floor staff were always smiling, friendly, and polite. As noted in other reviews, bellman/doormen don't seem to do much. Evening turn-down came late or not at all. Check-in/out seemed almost too casual. No paperwork, no questions. They just gave me the keys when I arrived and took them back when I left. - cable TV choices seemed a bit limited. Mostly news and sports. No disney, no nick, no bravo, no ifc and so on. - lounge has DVDs that you can borrow for free to play in the room, but the selection is pathetic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: Judy52
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay on the Gold floor of the Fairmont Copely Plaza. The service was outstanding! The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable. At any given time there were 3-5 concierges serving the Gold floor. They were extremely accommodating and gave excellent restaurant recommendations. The hotel was across the street from the "T" and 2 blocks away from the shopping on Newbury Street. What a location! The extra money to stay on the Gold floor is definitely worth it! We will look to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigsi74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the fairmont at the end of June for 4 nights. The hotel creates a good impression from the outside and this continues in the Grand Lobby area, although they could do with more doormen to greet guests as we had to struggle with our own luggage which wasn't great. The first room we were allocated was small, dark and smelled of cigarette smoke so we requested an alternative and were moved along the hall to a much bigger and better room. Although we did not eat in the hotel we did try the Oak room bar for drinks and we found it very pleasant. The location of the hotel is perfect for shopping at the malls and designer shops nearby and is within walking distance to almost everything in Boston you would want to see as a tourist. On the whole I would recommend this hotel if you can get a decent rate as the location can't be beaten and it really is a beautiful Hotel (if you get a good room!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location but thats all !”
Reviews.Author: EmsmumDublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights a few weeks ago with my husband and 2 kids. we usually stay at the Sheraton but that was fully booked. The location is great and staff were very helpful and courteous and the lobby is very grand but i wasn't that impressed. The houskeeping service was very poor. we weren't given any replacement toilet rolls or shampoo etc.You dont expect this in an expensive deluxe hotel. This is the first hotel in the US that I've stayed in that didn't have a coffee maker in the room. There was a $10 rental charge for one. there was a basket of cookies/sweets etc on display as part of the mini bar that I was afraid my kids would try to eat in the middle of the night resulting in big charges to the bill!! However according to the information folder there was quite a large charge to get all this removed. Restaurant very expensive. we went up to the Marriott in copley place instead and had great buffet breakfasts from some of the most helpful restaurant staff that i have ever encountered. We visit Boston every year and will stick to the sheraton or marriott next time

Reviews.Title: “Wow, a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusieWestVancouver
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at this hotel on our recent visit to Boston. The rooms are quite spacious and nicely decorated. Particularly outstanding are the concierge services with regard to directions, restaurants and obtaining tickets. All the staff were found to be friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: taffyandasil
Reviews.Content: After getting great price from Travelzoo, we were wondering what kind of room we would have. It was great. Staff could not be nicer and more helpful. Lobby is worth the price of the rooms alone. ". Location is great. Near public transpertation, and lots of things within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: acysb87
Reviews.Content: This hotel did all the big things right,but forgot the little stuff. I am a member of presidents club.Used an u/g cert for a suite.Received a very spacious corner room looking out at Trinity Square. King bed,renovated bathroom/room,nice suite attachment. Check-in staff,bellman,concierge(Sarah) Oak room restaurant staff,room cleaning staff all top notch and extremely pleasant. The Oak room restaurant provided us with one of the better meal experiences we have enjoyed in quite a while.Only issue was fruit flies, seemed to be everywhere in Boston. The little issues were ,no paper delivery in am,no turndown service on 2 of 4 nights(one came at 10 pm ????) and the water that should have been provided(all part of platinum membership) A little noisy.Windows are not soundproofed. I would definately stay here again,The location,city,weather, all provided an experience that says I want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great old hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jillmurf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night 7/19 as we were going to Fenway to see the Red Sox that night. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful and grand. There are beautiful flowers everywhere and I love the hotel's dog who sits in the lobby. When we checked in they would not honor any upgrade (probably because we got the room on priceline) so we were stuck with a moderate queen room. It was a very small room on the second floor with no view. It was very clean and the decor was nice but it was very small. That was the only draw back to the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful and the location is wonderful. The T is right across the street as well as the Hancock tower. They would not let us into the oak room for last call because they said that we were too late( 12:10) so we went across the street to the Westin. Overall a nice hotel but if you are looking for a nice room with great views of the city try the Westin across the street. It's rooms are much nicer,they have better facilities (they have a pool) and they have a very fun and lively bar that is open later than the Fairmonts.

Reviews.Title: “Go for a cocktail, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: percybs73
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here 7 years ago, and it was not good to go back. This hotel is a sad shadow of its former glory, living on a reputation its not keeping up. For the price go get a room at the Marriot/ Sheraton - anywhere that will be newer, just as great a location and cleaner/ newer/ quieter rooms. The plumbing is ancient - if a room above or near has a bath you can hear them turn off the taps, the rooms look tired and dowdy, and the hotel is more geared up for weddings - of which there were two the weekend we stayed than for travellers. Go and have a look at the ceiling in the lobby, have a cocktail in the Oak Room but don't stay here, its a waste of money, which is such a shame. There is so much better in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The "Moderate" Rooms are very bad!”
Reviews.Author: fhjasfh
Reviews.Content: While the Fairmont is a lovely hotel in terms of the excellent location, the lobby and room decor, beware if you end up in a "Moderate Room". This review is written for those who book the Fairmont Copley Plaza through a 3rd party vendor such as Expedia or travel agency, use credit card points, or end up there due to a bid on Priceline, like I did. If you check the hotel's website, you will see they offer more guest room classes than most hotels. I don't think the Moderate Room is even offered if you call Fairmont reservations directly, it is reserved for people who book through the sources I mentioned above. While the Moderate Room itself is decorated fine, a bit small (beware - queen bed only, no choice of a king or double beds), and the bathroom cramped, it would be bearable if it were not for the HORRIBLE SMELL. We were on the 1st floor (the hotel only has 6 floors) and there was a strong stench of sewer plus the smoke from adjacent smoking rooms permeate our non-smoking room. They actually have smoking and non-smoking rooms in the same hallway. It was not a pleasant night of sleep and we had a young child who smelled like a cigarette in the morning. The housekeeping staff even told my husband this was the worst wing of the hotel and we should have them move us. They were fully booked the 1st night, but upon request on the second night we were moved to a "Fairmont Room" with a king bed on a floor with no smells. I am sure that many guests complain about these "Moderate Rooms" and the hotel staff is used to moving guests to better rooms if available. What I find disappointing is a four star hotel such as the Fairmont even offers such rooms, albeit at a discount, to unsuspecting guests. These are second tiers rooms that are probably not even worth the discounted rate paid by guests. This experience has really turned me off of using Priceline and staying at any Fairmont properties. One other point, it was mentioned to me on more than once occasion by hotel staff that I used Priceline, why should they care, I am a paying guest.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the Gold Floor”
Reviews.Author: andrew02459
Reviews.Content: As with many of the US Fairmont hotels, this is a large ornate hotel built in 1912. The regular reception desk is almost a block long with the regular Concierge desk about half that size. We booked into the Gold Floor with its own check-in, Concierge and lounge and didn't regret it. The rooms are spacious and luxurious, and all the members of the Concierge team were very knowledgeable about restaurants and sites to see in Boston. A large buffet breakfast (with Boston Baked Beans among about 30 other things!) is laid out as is a large pre-dinner spread (including Vodka from Maine). The Concierge Manager, John, is from Ireland which seemed perfect for Boston and he knew all there was to know about what we should see. We've stayed at several other Boston hotels before, but would definitely return to this one...but only at the Gold Floor level. One warning: there is a $39/night parking fee. When we do it again, we'll let the Concierge get us a car once we're at the hotel, not arrive with one and pay for it to be parked.

Reviews.Title: “The gold in the entrance clearly hides a very poor service and bad rooms.”
Reviews.Author: DADYDOON
Reviews.Content: We are used to traveling all over the world and we always choose the finest hotels in the center of the cities. We came to Boston this year to attend our daughterâ€™s ceremony of graduation from Harvard Business School. We had reserved two rooms in January 2007, via our local travel agency in France Carlson Wagonlit. We had the following booking: from the 6th of June until the 10th of June 2007 (4 nights) for 1216â‚¬ per room without breakfast. It was specified on the booking that we wanted a non-smoking room. Choice of hotel During our previous stays in Boston, we were at the OMNI PARKER HOUSE. Having seen the beautiful entrance of the FAIRMONT hotel, we wanted to try it for our next stop in Boston. We booked the rooms as soon as we had the exact schedule for the graduation ceremony. The rooms Our local travel agency, Carlson Wagonlit had sent a confirmation email before we arrived and specified again that we wanted a VIP non-smoking room. 1/ At our arrival, we were surprised to be offered rooms in the second floor that were so strongly smelling cigarettes that we needed to ask to change rooms. 2/ We went back to the reception to ask for them and were offered new rooms on the 4th floor with an additional $70 per night !!!!! 3/ We naturally refused this arrangement and were finally offered two new rooms on the 3d floor. The roomsâ€™ windows were facing the interior of the hotel, while we specifically had asked for room facing the street in our booking! And the rooms were not side by side. Inside the rooms There was no plug for the ironer (we miraculously found one lost under the bed). No plug to fit European wires for our mobile phone (we had to ask the front desk to bring us adaptor). In one of the rooms, there was no armchair but only one chair in front of the desk. The carpet was stained (as in the corridor). In the bathrooms Having the restrooms inside the bathroom is very unusual for premium hotels and very uncomfortable. There was only one small sink. The bath was in very bad shape. The toilet flush was making noise for a few minutes after flushing!!!! The overall aspect of the bathroom was old and rusty. The noise We have been awaken at 6am two days in a row by water noises coming from outside rooms. The same noise occurred again at night. There must be a bad system of water plumbing overall. Service We asked for slippers for the bathroom and were simply told that there is none! The Business Center is supposed to offer internet access but was out of order. We had to ask for a computer to be brought in the room and wait for someone to bring it and plug it. The service has been charged 40$! Housekeeping is not well done: there are still old tissues on the corridors, meal plates from breakfast in other rooms for a long time, glasses on the floor etc. We consider that the high price for the room is not aligned with the bad quality of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “VERY pleased!! highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: 1stephbaker
Reviews.Content: after reading some older reviews about disappointed guests & god forbid mice in the room, I immediately called my husband to see if we could cancel. we couldn't-or at least, he wasn't going to! SO glad that we didn't. Its definitely worth the extra money (and you save it later!!) if you stay on the 4th floor Gold Club level. you will be treated like royalty-immediately we walked off the elevator and were greeted by name. They "gold club" is the hospitality or concierge area that includes a library with books & DVDs you can borrow, chess & scrabble set up, a private office with computer/printer/internet, formal living room, dining area & kitchen-the best part!! they serve breakfast (we're talking full buffet-not just continental), happy hour with appetizers & cookies before bed. Throughout the day you have full access to the coffee, bar & coolers filled with beverages, bottled water, beers, juices, etc. the only charge is for wine/beer/ cocktaails and its the honor system- $5 per drink (very reasonable for Boston!). considering we ate breakfast there every morning and also had drinks & hors dourves a few times in the late afternoon we definitely saved money and feel the upgrade was wonderful & well worth it! Also, it was great to stop at the concierge desk and get suggestions/directions/weather report/ reservations, etc on our way in or out. I honestly can say our stay was great and the staff was very friendly and helpful (on all levels-not just the 4th floor!).

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Writer46
Reviews.Content: This was a one night stay so my contact with the hotel was limited. I thought the front desk and it's President's Club Check in was a model of efficiency. My room was a rather strange one. I assume that when the hotel opened in 1913, this was two tiny rooms with a shared bath. As it is now configured, one of the rooms is a tiny two armchair and a desk sitting room, the other a bedroom with an armoire holding a TV and the minibar. The bathroom is between these rooms. A little odd and were I staying longer I would have requested something else. The bathroom is fine, the cleanliness unquestionable and the bed comfortable. I was pleased to see that one of the benefits of memembership in the President's Club is free internet access. Unfortunately, I use WiFi so much that I'd left my ethernet card at home and could not be connected through the hotel system. This led to an unfortunate use of the lobby work stations which are pay per use and I ended with a staggering $30.50 bill for 13 minutes of service and the printing a boarding pass. Buyer beware. There is no business center here and that I think is a major debit for this property.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by it's cover ?”
Reviews.Author: shark3132
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Copley Plaza ******************* My wife and I stayed at the Plaza during the last weeks of May. Externally impressive with its imposing faÃ§ade and location within Copley square, the hotel is worthy of its status as an American Heritage property. The gilded hallway leading to reception also gave the feel of quality, however at check in it became obvious that we could have been staying in any old city hotel. As we approached the desk the young receptionist switched to autopilot and autocue and asked her obligatory list of Yes / No book-in questions; unfortunately by now we gained the impression that we were no longer special, despite $600 per night. Our room was large and located on an upper floor with a view over the square. The room was clean, tidy and well serviced but lacked character.( I suppose like most hotel rooms but not what youâ€™d expect here). The decoration although fresh had a distinctly DIY finish, particularly in the marble bathroom. The walk in corner wardrobe was a joke, and Iâ€™d expect even the great Houdini would have had difficulty getting in and out of it successfully. The Oak room restaurant served up a decent breakfast and dinner - at a price. The Oak room bar certainly had lots of character and came to life in the evenings - this helped to relieve the general staid and lacklustre feel to the hotel. Despite our gripes which may sound a bit petty, we enjoyed our stay in the â€œgrand old dameâ€�, but would we stay again â€“ No - Weâ€™ve stayed in better. Would we stay in Boston â€“ YES - What a tremendous city.

Reviews.Title: “Still very good”
Reviews.Author: ArabianGirl
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Copley Plaza over 19 years ago when I arrived with my parents to start studying at Boston Univeristy. While it doesn't quite feel like the same grand old hotel anymore, my recent stay there with my husband was quite lovely. Our room was a very decent size (although for a 'deluxe' I did expect something a little bigger) and although the bathroom was small and we had no view from our window, neither put a damper on things. The staff was helpful and courteous and the location simply does not get any better. Katie, the resident black lab in the lobby, added an amazing touch to the whole place. She greeted us every day on our way in and out and posed quite happliy for pictures with her new book. I do have to agree with the reviewer who mentioned the weird smell in the room. We were constantly leaving our window open to get rid of it. Since we get a very decent corporate rate through my husband's company I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “I fell in love on this visit to Boston”
Reviews.Author: spurcell04
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from a "girls weekend" away together in Boston. This is a fine hotel in a wonderful location. Very close to major shopping areas as well as Newbury Street where we found many great dining choices. Hotel is also close to the subway which is cheap and safe. We stayed on "Fairmont Gold" for our three nights. This is the "club level" on the 4th floor. It does cost $100 extra per night to stay but is well worth it. Make sure to meet the club level manager,John, while you're there. He's somewhat like Irelands' answer to James Bond, most charming!! Room was clean and everyone was so polite and sweet, including the housekeepers, every morning! Good value for money. Had a drink in the Oak Bar which was unforgettable, felt very grand! I would strongly recommend this hotel, especially the Gold level if you can afford it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't feel like a four star hotel...”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler526
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I expected more from a Fairmont hotel. While the Fairmont Copley Plaza is situated in a beautiful, historic building, you don't really get much in return for the price you pay to stay in this hotel. The mini-bar prices are absolutely outrageous ($7 for a bottle of water!), and the internet fees are ridiculous ($14/day). Luckily, I am a member of their President's Club so I did not have to pay the daily internet fee. Though the hotel is in a great location and right next an enormous indoor mall, we were given a room with no view, and the furniture was rather old and musty looking. I expected a better room (perhaps with an actual view) for a President's Club member. I would not stay at this hotel again...I would recommend the Bulfinch hotel which is also in downtown Boston, cheaper, and nicer rooms without the outrageous prices!

Reviews.Title: “Negative Review”
Reviews.Author: travel_blurbs
Reviews.Content: In the three nights we stayed at this property, we occupied three different rooms, not by choice, of course. First, we found a large wet spot on the carpet, and asked to be moved. The new room ended up being smaller than the first one, but we stayed anyway. Second, our door key reader did not work, so we asked for help. After an hour spent standing in the hallway while the security staff tried to fix the door (we were given no timeframe for how long this was going to take), we were finally packed off to another room because they couldn't fix it. The bellman came by, handed us the new keys, and didn't even bother to help us with our bags. The only staff who expressed any level of concern for our comfort and inconvenience were the housekeeping staff; the security, front desk and bell staff were not helpful and lacked customer service skills. We will not stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “A Four Star Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: ACKLizard
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several hotels in Boston, ranging from 2 to 4 stars, and I have to say, I'll stay in the Ho-Jo at Fenway before I stay at this terrible hotel! First, the heater was pumping 80* into the room with no relief, and the window that should have opened did not. The bed was a double, not a queen-size, which is what we had paid for and even been told at the front desk we were supposed to get. The worst by far was when we tried to finally sleep- there was a loud obnoxious party across the hall. By 12:30 at night I had called 4 times to the front desk to do something about it. *Four times!* Security did not do anything about it, and by the final time, I went downstairs in my PJ's to tell them it wasn't being taken care of. Their "Four Star" security was just standing around on their walkie talkies while the party continued with the doors wide opened. I finally stated we'd be willing to switch to another room. So, at 1 in the morning, we packed up our stuff and had to move to another room. And the 2nd room smelled like something had died in it. Luckily the heater wasn't broken in this one, but the odor was horrible. We decided to make the best of it, because clearly telling the apathetic staff at this hotel that anything is wrong is a waste of energy. The next morning I spoke to the manager and told him of the awful experience. I told him if we wanted a party across the hall from us keeping us up at all hours of the night with a small bed and a broken air system in the room we would have stayed at a 1 or 2 star motel/hotel. But, instead, we had opted to pay hundreds of dollars to stay in their "Four Star" hotel for only one night. There was no mention of taking anything off the bill or comping our stay. All he did was offer up a free upgrade and free breakfast the next time we stayed at The Fairmont Copley Plaza. Which, of course, will never happen again. Save your hundreds of dollars you'll spend on this joke of a four star.

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed”
Reviews.Author: patientcat
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I just spent a week in New England and started our trip at the Copley Plaza. I had never stayed there before and now I will never stay anywhere else in Boston! I haven't enjoyed such truly outstanding, caring service, in many years. We arrived at 5:30 a.m. in the morning after a red-eye flight. We were assured that not only was our room ready for us (on the Gold floor), but we had been upgraded to a suite for our stay. The suite (the Boston Symphony Orchestra Suite) was a treasurehouse of photographs, posters, and scores from the Boston Symphony and a beautifully decorated suite with a view of Copley Square. Breakfast on the club floor is amazing. The first morning I went down very late and the lovely young server cooked us a beautiful breakfast to order well after normal breakfast hours. Similarly, our waiter the next two mornings not only served us beautifully but took extra care to find out what my daughters wanted to do in Boston and to give us map guidance, restaurant, and shopping suggestions; then inquired how we had enjoyed everything the next morning. Every staff person we encountered was outstanding. On the last day, as we loaded our suitcases into our rented car for our car trip through New England, the doorman retrieved our bags for us and then guided us across all lanes of traffic so that we could safely turn onto I-90. We also felt that Katie, the local black Lab, lent a sweet, homey touch to the lobby, which is elegant and relaxing. I just can't say enough good about this hotel! Now everything else will pale in comparison!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mainers
Reviews.Content: We had a special, low conference rate, so I assume our room was at the "lower end". Altho we did not have a view, the room more than met our expectations - large, nicely decorated, & clean, with beautiful marble bathrm, which was larger than expected. Location cannot be beat, walking distance to shops, restaurants, museums, public garden, Charles River. Altho no coffee makers in the room, Starbucks is just outside the hotel, and an Au Bon Pan is across the street. On the down side, the room was very hot and heat could not be turned down. We put fan on, and turned temp to "cool" but it still blew hot air. Ended up opening window, even though it was freezing outside. Also, bath was nicely updated, but lighting was poor. You really needed heat lamp on to get enough light. Not a problem in March, but might not be so pleasant in August. The gilded lobby is impressive, but very geared to conferences. No place to really sit comfortably and read, or have a drink. It was extremely busy with hotel guests waiting to check in, conference attendees milling about, and registration tables for different conferences lining the lobby wall. Too bad some of that luxury wasn't reserved for a quiet area where hotel guests could relax in comfortable seating, away from the conference action.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: Colorobo
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a solid choice for business travellers. Was attending a conference at the Marriot Copley and the Fairmont had a lot more character than the Westin or Marriot where colleagues were staying. Oak Room is a nice place for a drink in the evenings and the breakfast included with my room was good. Bathroom had been renovated, and tolietries were provided as you'd expect from at $300 night hotel. Only stayed one night, but would stay again on future trips to Boston. Downside was cost of valet parking at $39 per night. Room I had on 6th Floor #609 was right across from elevator, but noise didn't bother probably because I so was so tired.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Gold Level - Try it!”
Reviews.Author: BostonChic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a well needed night of rest, relaxation and pampering (we haven't gone away since having our 14 month old); and we certainly went to the right place! The Gold Level at the Fairmont was a real find. The staff catered to our every wish from making our dinner reservation to booking massages and delivering Champagne and fresh squeezed orange juice to our room for mimosas with breakfast. The Gold Level had a surprisingly elaborate spread of appetisers at the nightly cocktail hour including wine, cheese and shrimp cocktail, as well as a full breakfast including eggs, delicious breads and pastries, and fresh squeezed juices. We highly recommend upgrading to the Fairmont - Gold Level!

Reviews.Title: “memories interfered with judgement?”
Reviews.Author: carySc
Reviews.Content: I stayed again at the Copley Plaza because of memories of it in grander days. The lobby cafe is gone. The informal bar is gone. The picture of Senator Kennedy is gone. Much more of the hotel is given to meetings. The Club level lounge charges for a glass of wine and provides careful appetizers. The Club level concierges were, however, helpful and competent, and room service was faster than in the old days. Our window on Copley Square was the same size it has always been, but seemed tiny alongside the spectacular 180 degree vista of the Square and of Boston from an inexpensive corner "Junior Suite" at the Westin Copley Place, across the street. The Westin has an informal bar, an uncareful breakfast buffet, and an array of restaurants in the adjoing mall, where we mostly continued to eat while staying at the Copley Plaza. We would stay at the Westin Copley Place next time, perhaps walk across for a formal drink in the Oak Bar and to pat the great dog in the Copley Plaza lobby, but sadly leave the former grande dame to her conventions.

Reviews.Title: “What a place to grab a drink!”
Reviews.Author: tmarcone
Reviews.Content: I have traveled the world and seen many a bar in my life. The Oak Bar in the Fairmont Copley Hotel is absolutely amazing! Style, class and service are exceptional here. I recomend it for an after dinner cocktail while out on the town. The drink list is extensive, the service was great, the band was incredible and the atmosphere was A+.

Reviews.Title: “Decadent rooms!”
Reviews.Author: SouthAfricaCharley
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a deluxe room with a view of Coply Square and it was a great experience. The room was richly decorated--very elegant-- and super clean. The bathroom was brand-new and very luxurious. My only complaint is that it was difficult to hang long items like jackets/dresses in the closet because of an obstruction at the bottom of the closet.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Floor is a plus”
Reviews.Author: SussexCpl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in a Gold Signature Room. The Gold experience is well worth it. The service was great - both on the Ground and Gold Floors. Very good location - easy to get around the city from here. The Gold Floor is a real plus. The lounge areas and refreshments are a real treat after a hard day shopping or sightseeing. Breakfast was excellent. Only issue was a smell of sewage in our room at times. The Gold Floor receptionist was very sympathetic, but didn't actually do anything about it!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm, With Modern Amenities”
Reviews.Author: tiev
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here multiple times and love it every time. I am a Fairmont Premier member, and used a room upgrade certificate. We were upgraded to the museum of science, suite and WOW! It was gorgeously decorated and obviously quite spacious. It was a shame we were only there for a weekend getaway! Staff is always very accommodating and very helpful. Cannot beat the location, right in the heart of Boston. If you are coming by train the Back Bay Train station is located only a block away. Once again a wonderful stay, Fairmont will get my business again next time I am back in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel within a Hotel is awesome”
Reviews.Author: GreenStarfish
Reviews.Content: I had the fortunate chance of staying in one of the Gold rooms. What a great experience (except I did get a handicap enabled room which meant my bathroom was a bit too big and therefore drafty). The breakfast in the morning and the cocktail in the evening was great that they serve near reception. You have your own private reception/concierge desk for check in/check out. The hotel is also walking distance to loads of shopping - I did some serious damage. The bed was nice and everyone was super friendly. I'd love to stay here again, but my company paid for my visit so...

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel right in the center of of Boston!”
Reviews.Author: motutoopua
Reviews.Content: A very lovely hotel that is so conveniently located right in the very heart of Boston. Perfect for business and pleasure travellers alike, this hotel is just steps away from Copley subway station and within close walking distance of shopping streets and just across the street from Copley Place (a lovely upscale shopping complex). The hotel itself is beautiful, with an ornately decorated lobby and nicely appointed suites which are generously spacious. It made for a very comfortable stay and will definitely make this place our home again when whe are next back in Boston. We felt the price of accomodations here are moderate in comparison to value (in terms of location and room quality and size). In other words, a very good value for your money. Highly recommended for a delightful and convenient stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Mice love the Copley”
Reviews.Author: dcv1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the New Year weekend at the Copley Plaza. We arrived late on 12/29 and checked into room 218. Tired from the journey we showered and were ready to sleep, when my wife saw a rodent run from the wardrobe to the TV cabinet. At first I thought she was imagining things, but shortly after our little friend poked its head from behind the cabinet and did a number of mousy tricks. Horrified, my wife called the receptionist, who sent a member of staff to address the situation. The guy was lovely and his approach to mouse catching was rather comical. He was effectively trying to get the mouse out of its hiding place and into the corridor, in the process employing most of the reading material on the desk! Surely enough the mouse ran into the corridor â€“ mission accomplished for the jolly chap from Copley Plaza, who proceeded to advise us to block the gap between the door and the floor with a towel to prevent mice from entering the room. At this point we realized that this had not been a unique incident for our new friend. My wife diligently followed his advice and had me look behind the furniture whenever we returned to the room. I never heard from Copley Plaza on the incident, not a word of apology or reassurance that hygiene was at the top of their minds. Maybe they are too busy maintaining the ornate decorum to address such minor details. It was a good thing that my wife and I had stayed in dives before while living in Asia, as we did not allow the hotel to spoil our enjoyment of beautiful Boston. We will go back to the city but not to the Copley Plaza!

Reviews.Title: “loved the lobby”
Reviews.Author: blocky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the fairmont copley plaza in december on a four day visit to boston, on arrival we met with a porter who was not impressed with us offering to help with our bags, we were embarrassed that they were so heavy but the porter obviously thought we were trying to get out of tipping him!! He was quite rude and abrupt with us over this.. Other than this we enjoyed our stay here, location is good in a nice area. The hotel itself is lovely the lobby is very plush, the rooms were a bit on the small side but service etc was very good, the hotel restaurant the oak room is nice for a formal meal.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a little work”
Reviews.Author: njr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend stay at the Fairmont Copley. He had a conference there, so at the conference rate, the price of the room/quality of the hotel was good. I would not stay there for the full rate. The lobby is huge and ornate. It was festively decorated for Christmas. Several companies were having their holiday parties there both nights in the rooms off the lobby, which meant we had to navigate through large groups of smokers outside the hotel and smaller groups of somewhat intoxicated partyers inside the hotel. Our floor was a non-smoking floor, however, the smell of smoke managed to work its way upstairs so that our hallway smelled like smoke. I agree with a previous poster about the lack of shelves/drawers to put belongings and clothes. The bathroom was a nice size, but I though the towels were poor quality. The gym is on the 1st floor with adequate equipment. It's rather small and one thing I thought was odd was that there was no bathroom. The room is too small for a bathroom, but I figured there must be one next door. When I asked where the closest bathroom room was, I was told downstairs in the lobby or up in my room. It just seemed strange. My last complaint - the costs of in-room internet access ($13 or $14) and the charge for use of the computer in the lobby, but the kicker was that to print something out there is a $1.05 charge per sheet of paper. $1.05 per sheet of paper???? Please. I recently stayed at a Marriott Courtyard in San Francisco and there was free wifi not only in the lobby but in the hotel rooms. urthermore, I needed to print an important document and they printed out the entire 22 pages for FREE. I don't want to be totally negative. The location is great if you plan to shop. Also, the concierge and front desk staff were friendly and efficient. I've stayed at several Fairmonts and am usually "wowed" by my stay. This didn't quite live up to my experiences at other Fairmonts.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: travellinghopefully
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after having a disastrous experience at another Boston Hotel and being forced to move at 6 in the morning. What a pleasure the Fairmont is! They found us a room at 6am, in fact, stayed on the phone with me until they were sure there was a room ready! The room was beautiful and huge by any standard, the amenities elegant and the service impeccable. We stayed on the club floor for a few dollars more and it was well worth it. From the incredible buffet breakfast (lox, fresh pastries, eggs, yogurt, fruit, homemade oatmeal and more!) to the free wireless and the beautiful lounge, we felt pampered and cared for. The concierge anticipated our every need. The lobby is spectacularly gorgeous, and the location flawless. Ths is a wonderful wonderful hotel, up there with the best 5 stars everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Where Everybody Knows Your Name....”
Reviews.Author: PaneintheGlass
Reviews.Content: Our waiter Donny was so attentive... Sydney schlepped our fifteen bags to the top floor and the elevator had broken down...the doorman Ralph actually held the door open for us and wished us a good day, he even called me by name...." Sounds scripted, doesn't it? Fact is, Trip Advisor remains our first source for travel because it is one of the few places on the web that relates fairly truthful and accurate first hand reviews for hotels and restaurants with actual traveler's photos thrown in. Fact is, the Fairmont Copley Plaza remains one of the gems of Boston. We were last here a year and a half ago, and had that legendary room upgrade mentioned in TA postings from March 2005. A year and a half later, we had reserved a corner one bedroom suite and arrived to find that Keith Warren, who was previously Reservations Manager, had been promoted to Director of Revenue Management, and Brent Glashan, who was a front desk clerk, had been promoted to Director of the Front Office. With the recently renovated and re-opened Ritz around the corner about to be closed (again) in January since being purchased by the Taj Group of India... what does it say when you can return to a hotel a year and a half later to find upper management still in place with promotions. And, the kicker is, everyone still knows your name! This property continues to be our home and "great hotel" away from New York... a gilded Newport mansion that manages to remain warm and cuddly. We stayed in one of the newly themed one bedroom corner suites (the Boston Symphony Suite) on the Gold Level. The Gold Level offers separate check-in and concierge services and added amenities such as free internet access, a separate lobby and dining area, snacks and drinks throughout the day, premium liquor available on an honor system, hors dâ€™ouevres served in the early evening, and a wonderful hot breakfast served every morning. Oh, by the way, the Gold Level is an absolute must if only for the pampering and bantering offered by Stephen (with a ph) who will serve (entertain) you the ultimate breakfast in the morning. We'd return if only to be able to experience his manic brand of hospitality once again. If you see him, please tell him that he's been mentioned and made famous on Trip Advisor.com. He'll know who wrote the commentary. Please find some of our candid room photos attached. Needless to say, the Boston Symphony Suite was one of the more beautiful and comfortable suites we've ever stayed in. The entire hotel has been refurbished and renewed, and it shows with great attention to detail and comfort. Our thanks to the entire staff of professionals who do their jobs so well at the Fairmont. This is what the hospitality business should be, and always is at the Fairmont Copley Plaza. Better believe that we'll be back again for a fourth time, especially when my wife gets the urge for some more shopping on Newbury Street. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: kell113
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for 5 nights in the middle of October. We were upgraded to a Deluxe corner room on the 6th floor. It was a very spacious room with a fake or use to be a fireplace. The beds were great and the room was very quiet. The location of the hotel is probably the best in the city as far as I'm concerned. Major shopping and transportation subway is right at your doorstep. We mainly found restaurants near the hotel that we could walk to. If the weather is bad you would need a taxi...but beware. ... The taxi drivers in Boston drive you completely AROUND everywhere until they get an expensive taxi ride. We were ripped off about 4 times. Especially from the airport and going to the North End for dinner one night. Weather permitting, you can walk to Funeul Hall in about 20 minutes and I would recommend doing so. You see a lot of sights along the way. We also took the subway to Harvard and it was a piece of cake. Harvard was beautiful and we spent several hours just meandering around. Restaurants: Joes American Grill over On Dartmouth Street just a few blocks from the hotel. Very nice place and fairly inexpensive food for lunch or dinner. Smith and Wollensky in the back bay for steak. Beautiful and historic castle. We asked to see where they hang and age the meat...amazing! Great meal! We ate lunch at Stephanie's on Newburys and wasn't very impressed. We had Davide's for Italian in the North End and it was our most expensive dinner...but not worth it. The concierge recommended it. We had dinner at Legal Seafood and that was very good. We walked down to the Funeul Hall for lunch one day and that was fun! Skipjacks for seafood and cocktails. Very lively place......popular..make reservations. They have Miller Drafts for $2.00.....one half block from hotel. The Duck Tours looked fun but we had done a tour our prior visit. I would have liked to take the boat out to Cape Cod one day...just not enough time. 90 minutes to get there. Wanted to go to the JFK museum as well.......subway route....but we planned on going in the afternoon and ran out of time so go in the morning. There is a starbucks right next door to the hotel, but you can get a coffee pot in your room with coffee for your entire stay for $10 total. There is a 7-11 or Rite Aid across the street to buy water and a liqueur store next door to that if you want to buy beer to have in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice above average hotel in Boston....”
Reviews.Author: horseneck
Reviews.Content: Had a party at the Fairmont, booked 2 rooms. Unless you get a great deal on the rate, it is expensive for the regular rooms. I have been here before, only stayed in the average rooms. I would like to see if the club floor or suites were outstanding. The rooms tend to be nice, the bathrooms are tiny. There is no coffee machine, and no coffee sold in the lobby, so room service is the only option, or go out to get coffee. The 2 pots of coffee serving 6 people, was 50.00 plus tip. That is a lot for coffee, got a whole breakfast delivered on linen with flowers at the Ritz Boston for less. 40/nite to park, valet never got my luggage out, a few problems but close to T, Pretty location, great resturants around. Liked this hotel better than the Copley Plaza Hotel, but not as nice as the Ritz Boston Common. The lobby is average, nice old bostonian bar, very elegant, but pricey. Nice location on Copley Square. The Door man/ Bellman? was helpful getting a gang to the North End for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: New2it2000
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at the Fairmont Oct. 7th, 2006 for 3 nights. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The beds are to die for. Front desk was very accomodating. Requested to change room from 1st floor because of smoking rooms nearby. I was on the 6th floor the next day and they took care of moving luggage and all. Front desk is wonderful! This hotel is the perfect location to all shopping and subway. When I return, I will stay nowhere but here. My only complaint is the Oak Room. I ordered a Stoli Cosmo and it cost me $17.00. That I will NEVER do again. UGH!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely night”
Reviews.Author: GeorgicaPond
Reviews.Content: I spent an absolutely lovely night here last week and recommend it highly. I had booked through Priceline, and it was the first time I had ever used their service. I was only staying one night, I was arriving late, and I was willing to take a gamble. Smart gamble it was indeed! The drawbacks were these: I was given the smallest room at the hotel, but it was still extremely comfortable for one and beautifully appointed to boot. There were no views as it faced buildings on both sides, but since I was only staying one night, I didn't care, and it was blissfully quiet. There was no dresser and thus no drawer space (although again, one night, who cares), the bathroom was small (but it was comfortable and had good amenities), and one of the two phones in the room didn't work. On the plus side was absolutely everything else. I arrived just before 11pm. The hotel was still fully staffed, and every single person that dealt with me, down to the room service attendent, was absolutely lovely. The restaurant had closed so I called for room service at 11:30. It arrived in less than 15 minutes, piping hot, and, surprisingly, was actually extremely good. The mini bar was well stocked, and a half bottle of a wonderful red wine that is one of my favorites at home was among the choices. The room was beautiful....almost like a small luxury hotel in Paris. The wireless internet worked perfectly even though the hotel only guaranteed wireless in the lobby. They graciously allowed me a late check out even though I was leaving on a Friday that was the start of a busy holiday weekend. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat....although I would choose a larger room if I were staying longer than a couple of days or if I were to be more than one person. Let me just reiiterate though that I was in the smallest room the hotel offers (because of my price choice) and that their average double rooms are probably more than comfortable for two. I liked everything about the Fairmont Copley....the location is perfect, the hotel itself is quite beautiful and has a lot of old world charm, and the staff are just terrific. Of the many places I've stayed in Boston, this is so far my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Give me a brand new Marriott instead”
Reviews.Author: bness_traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic lobby and downhill from there. This is one of those hotels that charges you every chance they get. Another reviewer cited the $7 bottle of water. What he forgot to mention is that it really is $7+tax+a 10% restocking fee". I travel a lot on business and have never heard of a "restocking fee".Cha-ching. You want a coffee pot in your room? You know, like Courtyard's routinley supply. Well that coffee pot's gonna cost you $10 per night. Cha-ching. How about hi-speed internet service? $13.95. Cha-ching. And after all those charges, all you ahve is a small room in a tired old hotel. Give me a new Marriott any day.

Reviews.Title: “short business trip - absolutely beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: burke140
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business the week of 10/2. The attention to detail of this hotel is one of the best I've ever seen. Room was clean and comfortable and the food was great. Couldn't have been a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby, Tiny Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: BlvlTraveller
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel is first rate, location is superb. But if you are a businessman or family looking for comfort and space.... this is not for you. The lobby is massive, lush, and well appointed. This image begins to deteriorate when one walks into the cramped elevator, and dips further as musty odours waft you towards your tiny room. I'm sure you can pay for a sitting room and all, but I didn't and the room is so small that you almost have to squeeze by the foot of you bed to get to the bathroom. If you want to watch TV, there is no 'sitting room' style chair even. You either sit on edge of your bed, or lay down and watch it at an angle. Like most 'old lady' hotels (with apologies to any elderly women), the money has been spent in the lobby for those touring it's historical significance vice business style amenities for those staying there. A final kicker - 7$ for a bottle of water in the room - come on!. As with many who travel constantly, please.... book me at the Courtyard Marriot or equivalent next time! Likely cheaper for the company, and more practical!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: K_The_Tourist
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel in a superb location! We had a beautiful room with its own sitting room. From the moment we walked in to the moment we left we were treated so well. The concierge and bell boys were unbelievably helpful. The icing on the cake is Catie Copley, the hotel's very own Canine Ambassador (complete with her own business card!). She is absolutely gorgeous and it was a treat to take her to the common for a walk. To sum up, an elegant and stylish hotel with superb customer service. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else if I went back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ The Plaza”
Reviews.Author: the_vostok
Reviews.Content: We started our tour of New England with a 2 nights stay at the Plaza. When we arrived the staff were very obliging and made us feel welcome. A deluxe room on the third floor was beautifully appointed with quality furnishings and superb beds. Bathroom was also nice, if a little on the small side. Some traffic noise could be heard but this wasn't too much of a distraction. The hotel is ideally located near Newbury and Boylston streets, and the Prudential Centre for great shopping. A Starbucks Coffee is just around the corner for breakfast! Would definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect on the Gold Level”
Reviews.Author: sticklegs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at this hotel to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary. We booked a room on the Gold Level. When we checked in we were told we had been upgraded to a signature room. The room was very large and overlooked the square. We were personally shown to our room and on the table was a bottle of champagne and fruit and flowers which we thought was a lovely touch. Being on the gold floor gave us access to all the lounges which were beautifully decorated. Breakfast was complimentary and so were soft drinks, tea and coffe all day. In the evening there were tasty snacks put out. Some of the days we ate so much we did not need any dinner! There are only about 56 rooms on the gold floor and this gives you the idea that this is a hotel within a hotel. The lounges were very relaxing to come back to after a day of sightseeing. I must say that if you did not stay on the gold level there are no lounges in the main part of the hotel. Although there is a very nice bar and restaurant which we tried. If we went back to Boston we would stay there again, but only on the gold level. If anyone wants any more info let me know. My email is ruthlfraser@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel slap bang in centre. Good for City Break”
Reviews.Author: cburrell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Fairmont Copley Plaza in Boston for a four day city break through Virgin Holidays. It really is a wonderful hotel. Very grand indeed. Lots of mirrors, gilt and chandeliers. The restaurants are fabulous, service is great and the standard of the food and wine can not be faulted. We had the most amazing Pinot Noir and I wish I had got the name as it's become an unsurpassed wine for me. My only complaint about the hotel is the level of noise. You can literally hear everything that is going on outside your door which is a nightmare if you are trying to sleep. And yes, I would have to agree with the other reviewer who said the doors SLAM! They most certainly do. If you do decide to go to Boston and stay at the Copley Plaza, do say "Hi" to Katie for me...she is the resident chocolate lab who sits on her very own cushion in the reception. Boston is a fabulous city of British & American history so do try to do as much as you can...it's well worth it I promise you!

Reviews.Title: “Every moment was Fantastic!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisi1
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 1 week at the Copley with my 3 children all under the age of 7. We were in Boston celebrating my Fahter-in-laws 70th birthday, we celebrated in the Oak Room at the hotel. The Copley staff went above and beyond. Every staff member we interacted with from making the arrangements, to the door man, to the waiter who served our party were courteous and efficient. The food the evening of the party in the Oak Room was outstanding. The rooms were spotless and spacious. The location is the best in boston, walking distance to tons of activities and a 30 second walk to the T subway. This hotel is well worth the trip to Boston!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont was Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DanioCal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza 7/4-7/6/06. Booked the "Only One Way Summer Campaign" rate on the Fairmont website. For $195/night, we were given a very large room with a comfy king-sized bed, a large work desk, and a fireplace. The room was beautifully decorated, and the bathroom felt high-end (with separate toilet, shower, and vanity areas). Nice toiletries and bathrobes. The staff was very helpful with directions and suggestions. The Copley Plaza location was ideal for touring the city. Close to the subway. One of the best hotels we've stayed in. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: bdeml
Reviews.Content: This hotel tries its best to be top rate, but its hard to justify your stay in the tiny room (called Moderate Room), and the average food. If you love old hotels that have been fairly well renovated you'll like it. One annoying thing is the mice. We saw one zipping along the floor in the restaurant at breakfast. Colleagues mentioned that the had one in their room before which would be considerably less entertaining than our single mouse sighting. There are other nice hotels in the area so you definitely have choices. There is a Hilton which was recommended to us. I'd say you could do better for your price than this place. Be sure to go to the "Petit Robert Bistro" if you stay in this area which was one great highlight to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic hotel in a top location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one night stay at the Fairmont Copley Plaza which included my two young children. I was initially concerned about this hotel being a good family hotel, but that ended up to not be any problem. The "house dog" Caty Coply makes most kids feel right at home. This hotel is gorgeous and easily accomodates families. We were upgraded to a room that included two double beds (extremely comfortable by the way) with a fantasic city view. I have no complaints about this hotel in any way; cleanliness, service, location (outstanding), amenities.. all was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service for a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: AEC in SF
Reviews.Content: The room we were given, and the service we got, were not up to my expectations. I stay at 4- and 5-star hotels about 10 nights of the year, and am a member of the Fairmont President's Club preferred guest program. Every interaction we had with a staff member was unimpressive, from the mumbling check-in person to the distracted check-out clerk. No doorman was on duty when we checked in, nobody offered to help with our bags, and the concierge was unable to answer basic questions about the immediate Copley area. The door to our Fairmont Room opened right onto the bed, with no vestibule or closet area to separate the room from the public hallway. The closet provided less than 12 inches of hanging space, and no trouser hangers at all. There were no drawers or shelves for clothing, anywhere in the room -- the whole armoire was taken up by the TV and minibar. There was no coffee in the room, although a notice in the minibar area said that we could have a pot and supplies delivered for an additional cost! The bathroom was minimal, with a shower over the tub surrounded by a fabric shower curtain (which, of course, blows in on you as you're trying to relax) and no robes. Toiletry amenities were basic but decent, and actually smelled pleasantly of citrus and herbs. But still, for a 4-star hotel, I expected a better setup. The TV in our room was malfunctioning, turning itself on at will. We tried to unplug it, but the armoire was too heavy to move. We turned down the volume, closed the doors, and threw the bedspread over the armoire to hide the light that was coming throught the door. The next morning, we asked the front desk to have it fixed. Maintenence left a note saying that the problem was resolved, but it wasn't -- we were awakened at 2am by the TV turning itself on at full volume! Needless to say, we weren't very happy the next morning. We left for our day out at about 8am, and left the "please make up room" sign on the door. When we returned, exhausted and ready for a shower, at 3:30pm, the room was still just as we left it. We called housekeeping, and the person who answered actually lectured us that we should KNOW that they have until 4pm to make up the room. (Are we psychic?) We asked them to send up towels so that we could shower; 30 minutes later, they hadn't arrived, so we called again. 20 minutes later, still no towels. I went out into the hall, found the abandoned maid's cart, and got them myself. The maid finally came to our door a few minutes later at 5pm, asking to make up the room. We told her that we'd like her to come back in an hour or so, after we left for dinner, and she sighed and stamped off. We took our shower, and came out to find a little "sorry you didn't want your room made up" notice slid under the door -- infuriating! When we called the front desk and explained what had happened, and asked them to please send someone up in 30 minutes to freshen the room, they gave us all kinds of flack, and finally agreed to only change the sheets and towels. The location on Compley Square is fabulous, and the bed was comfortable -- but those are just about the only things I can think of to recommend this hotel. I'd rather spend less and stay at the Marriott across the street; at least then I'd expect minimal service.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat performance”
Reviews.Author: MVY
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here about 10 times in the past two years and feel like I know the place well. I would agree that certain house keeping issues are a concern at the Fairmont. When I arrived on this last trip, I found an old dust mop right in the hallway off the elevators (one of those yellow feathered things) and on my first day there, maid service did not show up until about 3:00. In addition, on my final morning, I had just stepped out of the shower and into a robe at 8:30 a.m. when there was an abrupt knock on the door. Before I had a chance to say anything (I was all wet and listeneing to the Today Show while drinking my coffee), a woman unlocked the door and walked into my room. I was so shocked and surprised I could barely react as this has NEVER happened before. She was in a uniform but there was no cleaning cart with her- I do not know who she was but it was totally uncalled for. I would recommend bolting the door. I had just gotten room service for breakfast and had not thought to do so. It was strange. And room service trays are left in the hallway for WAY too long. Aside from that, things were fine.
